1 EU rejects German call to boycott British lamb 
2 Peter Blackburn 
3 BRUSSELS 1996-08-22 
4 The European Commission said on Thursday it disagreed with German advice to consumers to shun British lamb until scientists determine whether mad cow disease can be transmitted to sheep 
5 Germany 's representative to the European Union 's veterinary committee Werner Zwingmann said on Wednesday consumers should buy sheepmeat from countries other than Britain until the scientific advice was clearer 
6 We do n't support any such recommendation because we do n't see any grounds for it the Commission 's chief spokesman Nikolaus van der Pas told a news briefing 
7 He said further scientific study was required and if it was found that action was needed it should be taken by the European Union 
8 He said a proposal last month by EU Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler to ban sheep brains spleens and spinal cords from the human and animal food chains was a highly specific and precautionary move to protect human health 
9 Fischler proposed EU-wide measures after reports from Britain and France that under laboratory conditions sheep could contract Bovine Spongiform Encephalopathy BSE mad cow disease 
10 But Fischler agreed to review his proposal after the EU 's standing veterinary committee mational animal health officials questioned if such action was justified as there was only a slight risk to human health 
11 Spanish Farm Minister Loyola de Palacio had earlier accused Fischler at an EU farm ministers meeting of causing unjustified alarm through dangerous generalisation 
12 Only France and Britain backed Fischler 's proposal 
13 The EU 's scientific veterinary and multidisciplinary committees are due to re-examine the issue early next month and make recommendations to the senior veterinary officials 
14 Sheep have long been known to contract scrapie a brain-wasting disease similar to BSE which is believed to have been transferred to cattle through feed containing animal waste 
15 British farmers denied on Thursday there was any danger to human health from their sheep but expressed concern that German government advice to consumers to avoid British lamb might influence consumers across Europe 
16 What we have to be extremely careful of is how other countries are going to take Germany 's lead Welsh National Farmers Union NFU chairman John Lloyd Jones said on BBC radio 
17 Bonn has led efforts to protect public health after consumer confidence collapsed in March after a British report suggested humans could contract an illness similar to mad cow disease by eating contaminated beef 
18 Germany imported 47,600 sheep from Britain last year nearly half of total imports 
19 It brought in 4,275 tonnes of British mutton some 10 percent of overall imports 
20 Rare Hendrix song draft sells for almost $ 17,000 
21 LONDON 1996-08-22 
22 A rare early handwritten draft of a song by U.S. guitar legend Jimi Hendrix was sold for almost $ 17,000 on Thursday at an auction of some of the late musician 's favourite possessions 
23 A Florida restaurant paid 10,925 pounds $ 16,935 for the draft of Ai n't no telling which Hendrix penned on a piece of London hotel stationery in late 1966 
24 At the end of a January 1967 concert in the English city of Nottingham he threw the sheet of paper into the audience where it was retrieved by a fan 
25 Buyers also snapped up 16 other items that were put up for auction by Hendrix 's former girlfriend Kathy Etchingham who lived with him from 1966 to 1969 
26 They included a black lacquer and mother of pearl inlaid box used by Hendrix to store his drugs which an anonymous Australian purchaser bought for 5,060 pounds $ 7,845 
27 The guitarist died of a drugs overdose in 1970 aged 27 
28 China says Taiwan spoils atmosphere for talks 
29 BEIJING 1996-08-22 
30 China on Thursday accused Taipei of spoiling the atmosphere for a resumption of talks across the Taiwan Strait with a visit to Ukraine by Taiwanese Vice President Lien Chan this week that infuriated Beijing 
31 Speaking only hours after Chinese state media said the time was right to engage in political talks with Taiwan Foreign Ministry spokesman Shen Guofang told Reuters The necessary atmosphere for the opening of the talks has been disrupted by the Taiwan authorities 
32 State media quoted China 's top negotiator with Taipei Tang Shubei as telling a visiting group from Taiwan on Wednesday that it was time for the rivals to hold political talks 
33 Now is the time for the two sides to engage in political talks 
34 that is to end the state of hostility Thursday 's overseas edition of the People 's Daily quoted Tang as saying 
35 The foreign ministry 's Shen told Reuters Television in an interview he had read reports of Tang 's comments but gave no details of why the negotiator had considered the time right for talks with Taiwan which Beijing considers a renegade province 
36 China which has long opposed all Taipei efforts to gain greater international recognition was infuriated by a visit to Ukraine this week by Taiwanese Vice President Lien 
37 China says time right for Taiwan talks 
38 BEIJING 1996-08-22 
39 China has said it was time for political talks with Taiwan and that the rival island should take practical steps towards that goal 
40 Consultations should be held to set the time and format of the talks the official Xinhua news agency quoted Tang Shubei executive vice chairman of the Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits as saying late on Wednesday 
41 German July car registrations up 14.2 pct yr yr 
42 FRANKFURT 1996-08-22 
43 German first-time registrations of motor vehicles jumped 14.2 percent in July this year from the year-earlier period the Federal office for motor vehicles said on Thursday 
44 The office said 356,725 new cars were registered in July 1996 304,850 passenger cars and 15,613 trucks 
45 The figures represent a 13.6 percent increase for passenger cars and a 2.2 percent decline for trucks from July 1995 
46 Motor-bike registration rose 32.7 percent in the period 
47 The growth was partly due to an increased number of Germans buying German cars abroad while manufacturers said that domestic demand was weak the federal office said 
48 Almost all German car manufacturers posted gains in registration numbers in the period 
49 Volkswagen AG won 77,719 registrations slightly more than a quarter of the total 
50 Opel AG together with General Motors came in second place with 49,269 registrations 16.4 percent of the overall figure 
51 Third was Ford with 35,563 registrations or 11.7 percent 
52 Only Seat and Porsche had fewer registrations in July 1996 compared to last year 's July 
53 Seat posted 3,420 registrations compared with 5522 registrations in July a year earlier 
54 Porsche 's registrations fell to 554 from 643

93 Israel plays down fears of war with Syria 
94 Colleen Siegel 
95 JERUSALEM 1996-08-22 
96 Israel 's outgoing peace negotiator with Syria said on Thursday current tensions between the two countries appeared to be a storm in a teacup 
97 Itamar Rabinovich who as Israel 's ambassador to Washington conducted unfruitful negotiations with Syria told Israel Radio it looked like Damascus wanted to talk rather than fight 
98 It appears to me the Syrian priority is still to negotiate 
99 The Syrians are confused they are definitely tense but the general assessment here in Washington is that this is essentially a storm in a teacup he said 
100 Rabinovich is winding up his term as ambassador 
101 He will be replaced by Eliahu Ben-Elissar a former Israeli envoy to Egypt and right-wing Likud party politician 
102 Israel on Wednesday sent Syria a message via Washington saying it was committed to peace and wanted to open negotiations without preconditions 
103 But it slammed Damascus for creating what it called a dangerous atmosphere 
104 Syria accused Israel on Wednesday of launching a hysterical campaign against it after Israeli television reported that Damascus had recently test fired a missile 
105 It said its arms purchases were for defensive purposes 
106 The message that we sent to Syrian President Hafez al- Assad is that Israel is ready at any time without preconditions to enter peace negotiations Israeli Foreign Minister David Levy told Israel Radio in an interview 
107 Tension has mounted since Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu took office in June vowing to retain the Golan Heights Israel captured from Syria in the 1967 Middle East war 
108 Israeli-Syrian peace talks have been deadlocked over the Golan since 1991 despite the previous government 's willingness to make Golan concessions 
109 Peace talks between the two sides were last held in February 
110 The voices coming out of Damascus are bad not good 
111 The media 
112 are full of expressions and declarations that must be worrying 
113 this artificial atmosphere is very dangerous because those who spread it could become its prisoners Levy said 
114 We expect from Syria if its face is to peace that it will answer Israel 's message to enter peace negotiations because that is our goal he said 
115 We do not want a war God forbid 
116 No one benefits from wars 
117 Israel 's Channel Two television said Damascus had sent a calming signal to Israel 
118 It gave no source for the report 
119 Netanyahu and Levy 's spokesmen said they could not confirm it 
120 The television also said that Netanyahu had sent messages to reassure Syria via Cairo the United States and Moscow 
121 Polish diplomat denies nurses stranded in Libya 
122 TUNIS 1996-08-22 
123 A Polish diplomat on Thursday denied a Polish tabloid report this week that Libya was refusing exit visas to 100 Polish nurses trying to return home after working in the North African country 
124 This is not true 
125 Up to today we have no knowledge of any nurse stranded or kept in Libya without her will and we have not received any complaint the Polish embassy 's charge d'affaires in Tripoli Tadeusz Awdankiewicz told Reuters by telephone 
126 Poland 's labour ministry said this week it would send a team to Libya to investigate but Awdankiewicz said the probe was prompted by some nurses complaining about their work conditions such as non-payment of their salaries 
127 He said that there are an estimated 800 Polish nurses working in Libya 
128 Two Iranian opposition leaders meet in Baghdad 
129 Hassan Hafidh 
130 BAGHDAD 1996-08-22 
131 An Iranian exile group based in Iraq vowed on Thursday to extend support to Iran 's Kurdish rebels after they were attacked by Iranian troops deep inside Iraq last month 
132 A Mujahideen Khalq statement said its leader Massoud Rajavi met in Baghdad the Secretary-General of the Kurdistan Democratic Party of Iran KDPI Hassan Rastegar on Wednesday and voiced his support to Iran 's rebel Kurds 
133 Rajavi emphasised that the Iranian Resistance would continue to stand side by side with their Kurdish compatriots and the resistance movement in Iranian Kurdistan it said 
134 A spokesman for the group said the meeting signals a new level of cooperation between Mujahideen Khalq and the Iranian Kurdish oppositions 
135 Iran heavily bombarded targets in northern Iraq in July in pursuit of KDPI guerrillas based in Iraqi Kurdish areas outside the control of the government in Baghdad 
136 Iraqi Kurdish areas bordering Iran are under the control of guerrillas of the Iraqi Kurdish Patriotic Union of Kurdistan PUK group 
137 PUK and Iraq 's Kurdistan Democratic Party KDP the two main Iraqi Kurdish factions have had northern Iraq under their control since Iraqi forces were ousted from Kuwait in the 1991 Gulf War 
138 Clashes between the two parties broke out at the weekend in the most serious fighting since a U.S.-sponsored ceasefire last year 
139 Mujahideen Khalq said Iranian troops had also been shelling KDP positions in Qasri region in Suleimaniya province near the Iranian border over the last two days 
140 It said about 100 Iraqi Kurds were killed or wounded in the attack 
141 Both Iran and Turkey mount air and land strikes at targets in northern Iraq in pursuit of their own Kurdish rebels 
142 A U.S.-led air force in southern Turkey protects Iraqi Kurds from possible attacks by Baghdad troops 
143 Saudi riyal rates steady in quiet summer trade 
144 MANAMA 1996-08-22 
145 The spot Saudi riyal against the dollar and riyal interbank deposit rates were mainly steady this week in quiet summer trade dealers in the kingdom said 
146 There were no changes in Saudi riyal rates 
147 The market was very quiet because of summer holidays one dealer said 
148 The spot riyal was put at 3.7504 06 to the dollar 
149 One-month interbank deposits were at 5-1/2 3/8 percent three months were 5-5/8 1/2 percent and six months were 5-3/4 5/8 percent 
150 One-year funds were at six 5-7/8 percent 
151 Israel approves Arafat 's flight to West Bank 
152 JERUSALEM 1996-08-22 
153 Israel gave Palestinian President Yasser Arafat permission on Thursday to fly over its territory to the West Bank ending a brief Israeli-PLO crisis an Arafat adviser said 
154 The problem is over 
155 The president 's aircraft has received permission to pass through Israeli airspace but the president is not expected to travel to the West Bank before Monday Nabil Abu Rdainah told Reuters 
156 Arafat had been scheduled to meet former Israeli prime minister Shimon Peres in the West Bank town of Ramallah on Thursday but the venue was changed to Gaza after Israel denied flight clearance to the Palestinian leader 's helicopters 
157 Palestinian officials accused right-wing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of trying to stop the Ramallah meeting by keeping Arafat grounded 
158 Arafat subsequently cancelled a meeting between Israeli and PLO officials on civilian affairs at the Allenby Bridge crossing between Jordan and the West Bank 
159 Abu Rdainah said Arafat had decided against flying to the West Bank on Thursday after Israel lifted the ban because he had a busy schedule in Gaza and would not be free until Monday 
160 Arafat to meet Peres in Gaza after flight ban 
161 JERUSALEM 1996-08-22 
162 Yasser Arafat will meet Shimon Peres in Gaza on Thursday after Palestinians said the right-wing Israeli government had barred the Palestinian leader from flying to the West Bank for talks with the former prime minister 
163 The meeting between Peres and Arafat will take place at Erez checkpoint in Gaza and not in Ramallah as planned Peres office said 
164 Palestinian officials said the Israeli government had barred Arafat from overflying Israel in a Palestinian helicopter to the West Bank in an attempt to bar the meeting with Peres 
165 Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has accused opposition leader Peres who he defeated in May elections of trying to undermine his Likud government 's authority to conduct peace talks 
166 Afghan UAE embassy says Taleban guards going home 
167 Hilary Gush 
168 DUBAI 1996-08-22 
169 Three Afghan guards brought to the United Arab Emirates last week by Russian hostages who escaped from the Taleban militia will return to Afghanistan in a few days the Afghan embassy in Abu Dhabi said on Thursday 
170 Our ambassador is in touch with the UAE foreign ministry 
171 Their return to Afghanistan will take place in two or three days an embassy official said 
172 The embassy is issuing them travel documents for their return to their homeland 
173 There is no objection to their travel he added 
174 The three Islamic Taleban guards were overpowered by seven Russian aircrew who escaped to UAE state Sharjah last Friday on board their own aircraft after a year in the captivity of Taleban militia in Kandahar in southern Afghanistan 
175 The UAE said on Monday it would hand over the three to the International Red Crescent possibly last Tuesday 
176 It has since been silent on the issue 
177 When asked whether the three guards would travel back to Kandahar or the Afghan capital Kabul the embassy official said That has not been decided but possibly Kandahar 
178 Kandahar is the headquarters of the opposition Taleban militia 
179 Kabul is controlled by President Burhanuddin Rabbani 's government which Taleban is fighting to overthrow 
180 The embassy official said the three men believed to be in their 20s were currently in Abu Dhabi 
181 He did not elaborate 
182 The Russians working for the Aerostan firm in the Russian republic of Tatarstan were taken hostage after a Taleban MiG-19 fighter forced their cargo plane to land in August 1995 
183 Taleban said its shipment of ammunition from Albania was evidence of Russian military support for Rabbani 's government 
184 Moscow said the crew 's nationality was coincidental 
185 Numerous diplomatic attempts to free the seven failed 
186 The Russians who said they overpowered the guards two armed with Kalashnikov automatic rifles while doing regular maintenance work on their Ilyushin 76 cargo plane last Friday left the UAE capital Abu Dhabi for home on Sunday 
187 Iraq 's Saddam meets Russia 's Zhirinovsky 
188 BAGHDAD 1996-08-22 
189 Iraqi President Saddam Hussein has told visiting Russian ultra-nationalist Vladimir Zhirinovsky that Baghdad wanted to maintain friendship and cooperation with Moscow official Iraqi newspapers said on Thursday 
190 President Saddam Hussein stressed during the meeting Iraq 's keenness to maintain friendship and cooperation with Russia the papers said 
191 They said Zhirinovsky told Saddam before he left Baghdad on Wednesday that his Liberal Democratic party and the Russian Duma parliament are calling for an immediate lifting of the embargo imposed on Iraq after its 1990 invasion of Kuwait 
192 Zhirinovsky said on Tuesday he would press the Russian government to help end U.N. trade sanctions on Iraq and blamed Moscow for delaying establishment of good ties with Baghdad 
193 Our stand is firm namely we are calling on the Russian government to end the economic embargo on Iraq and resume trade ties between Russia and Iraq he told reporters 
194 Zhirinovsky visited Iraq twice in 1995 
195 Last October he was invited to attend the referendum held on Iraq 's presidency which extended Saddam 's term for seven more years

223 CME live and feeder cattle calls range mixed 
224 CHICAGO 1996-08-22 
225 Early calls on CME live and feeder cattle futures ranged from 0.200 cent higher to 0.100 lower livestock analysts said 
226 The continued strong tone to cash cattle and beef markets should prompt further support 
227 Outlook for a bullish cattle-on-feed report is also expected to lend support and prompt some bull spreading analysts said 
228 However trade will likely be light and prices could drift on evening up ahead of the report 
229 Cash markets are also expected to be quiet after the record amount of feedlot cattle traded this week they said 
230 Kindercare says debt buy to hit Q1 results 
231 MONTGOMERY Ala 
232 1996-08-22 
233 KinderCare Learning Centers Inc said on Thursday that a debt buyback would mean an extraordinary loss of $ 1.2 million in its fiscal 1997 first quarter 
234 The company said that during the quarter which began June 1 it bought $ 30 million par value of its outstanding 10-3/8 percent senior notes due 2001 
235 The notes were bought for $ 31.5 million 
236 Philip Maslowe chief financial officer of the preschool and child care company said the buyback offered an opportunity to reduce the company 's weighted average interest costs and improve future cash flows and earnings

278 Well repairs to lift Heidrun oil output Statoil 
279 OSLO 1996-08-22 
280 Three plugged water injection wells on the Heidrun oilfield off mid-Norway will be reopened over the next month operator Den Norske Stats Oljeselskap AS Statoil said on Thursday 
281 The plugged wells have accounted for a dip of 30,000 barrels per day bpd in Heidrun output to roughly 220,000 bpd according to the company 's Status Weekly newsletter 
282 The wells will be reperforated and gravel will be pumped into the reservoir through one of the wells to avoid plugging problems in the future it said 
283 Oslo newsroom +47 22 42 50 41 
284 Finnish April trade surplus 3.8 billion markka NCB 
285 HELSINKI 1996-08-22 
286 Finland 's trade surplus rose to 3.83 billion markka in April from 3.43 billion in March the National Customs Board NCB said in a statement on Thursday 
287 The value of exports fell one percent year-on-year in April and the value of imports fell two percent NCB said 
288 Trade balance million markka 
289 April 96 March 96 Jan-April 96 Jan-April 95 
290 Imports 10,663 10,725 43,430 40,989 
291 Exports 14,494 14,153 56,126 56,261 
292 Balance +3,831 +3,428 +12,696 +15,272 
293 The January-April 1995 import figure was revised from 39,584 million markka and the export figure from 55,627 million markka 
294 The Bank of Finland earlier estimated the April trade surplus at 3.2 billion markka with exports projected at 14.5 billion and imports at 11.3 billion 
295 The NCB 's official monthly trade statistics are lagging behind due to changes in customs procedures when Finland joined the European Union at the start of 1995

297 Dutch state raises tap sale price to 99.95 
298 AMSTERDAM 1996-08-22 
299 The Finance Ministry raised the price for tap sales of the Dutch government 's new 5.75 percent bond due September 2002 to 99.95 from 99.90 
300 Tap sales began on Monday and are being held daily from 07.00 GMT to 15.00 GMT until further notice 
301 The ministry had raised 2.3 billion guilders from sales of the new bond by the close of trade on Wednesday 
302 Amsterdam newsroom +31 20 504 5000 
303 German farm ministry tells consumers to avoid British mutton 
304 BONN 1996-08-22 
305 Germany 's Agriculture Ministry suggested on Wednesday that consumers avoid eating meat from British sheep until scientists determine whether mad cow disease can be transmitted to the animals 
306 Until this is cleared up by the European Union 's scientific panels and we have asked this to be done as quickly as possible consumers should if at all possible give preference to sheepmeat from other countries ministry official Werner Zwingmann told ZDF television 
307 I do not want to say that there is a concrete danger for consumers he added 
308 There are too many holes in what we know and these must be filled very quickly 
309 Bonn has led efforts to ensure consumer protection tops the list of priorities in dealing with the mad cow crisis which erupted in March when Britain acknowledged humans could contract a similar illness by eating contaminated beef 
310 The European Commission agreed this month to rethink a proposal to ban the use of suspect sheep tissue after some EU veterinary experts questioned whether it was justified 
311 EU Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler had proposed banning sheep brains spleens and spinal cords from the human and animal food chains after reports from Britain and France that under laboratory conditions sheep could contract Bovine Spongiform Encephalopathy BSE mad cow disease 
312 But some members of the EU 's standing veterinary committee questioned whether the action was necessary given the slight risk to human health 
313 The question is being studied separately by two EU scientific committees 
314 Sheep have long been known to contract scrapie a similar brain-wasting disease to BSE which is believed to have been transferred to cattle through feed containing animal waste 
315 British officials say sheep meat is perfectly safe to eat 
316 ZDF said Germany imported 47,600 sheep from Britain last year nearly half of total imports 
317 It brought in 4,275 tonnes of British mutton some 10 percent of overall imports 
318 After the British government admitted a possible link between mad cow disease and its fatal human equivalent the EU imposed a worldwide ban on British beef exports 
319 EU leaders agreed at a summit in June to a progressive lifting of the ban as Britain takes parallel measures to eradicate the disease

353 REUTER 
354 HORSE RACING PIVOTAL ENDS 25-YEAR WAIT FOR TRAINER PRESCOTT 
355 YORK England 1996-08-22 
356 Sir Mark Prescott landed his first group one victory in 25 years as a trainer when his top sprinter Pivotal a 100-30 chance won the Nunthorpe Stakes on Thursday 
357 The three-year-old partnered by veteran George Duffield snatched a short head verdict in the last stride to deny Eveningperformance 16-1 trained by Henry Candy and ridden by Chris Rutter 
358 Hever Golf Rose 11-4 last year 's Prix de l Abbaye winner at Longchamp finished third a further one and a quarter lengths away with the 7-4 favourite Mind Games in fourth 
359 Pivotal a Royal Ascot winner in June may now be aimed at this season 's Abbaye Europe 's top sprint race 
360 Prescott reluctant to go into the winner 's enclosure until the result of the photo-finish was announced said Twenty-five years and I have never been there so I thought I had better wait a bit longer 
361 He added It 's very sad to beat Henry Candy because I am godfather to his daughter 
362 Like Prescott Jack Berry trainer of Mind Games had gone into Thursday 's race in search of a first group one success after many years around the top of his profession 
363 Berry said I`m disappointed but I do n't feel suicidal 
364 He Mind Games was going as well as any of them one and a half furlongs 300 metres out but he just did n't quicken

403 SOCCER DALGLISH SAD OVER BLACKBURN PARTING 
404 LONDON 1996-08-22 
405 Kenny Dalglish spoke on Thursday of his sadness at leaving Blackburn the club he led to the English premier league title in 1994-95 
406 Blackburn announced on Wednesday they and Dalglish had parted by mutual consent 
407 But the ex-manager confessed on Thursday to being sad at leaving after taking Blackburn from the second division to the premier league title inside three and a half years 
408 In a telephone call to a local newspaper from his holiday home in Spain Dalglish said We came to the same opinion albeit the club came to it a little bit earlier than me 
409 He added If no one asked I never opened my mouth 
410 I have stayed out of the way and let them get on with the job 
411 The club thought it the job had run its course and I came to the same conclusion 
412 Dalglish had been with Blackburn for nearly five years first as manager and then for the past 15 months as director of football

461 SOCCER FERGUSON BACK IN SCOTTISH SQUAD AFTER 20 MONTHS 
462 GLASGOW 1996-08-22 
463 Everton 's Duncan Ferguson who scored twice against Manchester United on Wednesday was picked on Thursday for the Scottish squad after a 20-month exile 
464 Glasgow Rangers striker Ally McCoist another man in form after two hat-tricks in four days was also named for the August 31 World Cup qualifier against Austria in Vienna 
465 Ferguson who served six weeks in jail in late 1995 for head-butting an opponent won the last of his five Scotland caps in December 1994 
466 Scotland manager Craig Brown said on Thursday I 've watched Duncan Ferguson in action twice recently and he 's bang in form 
467 Ally McCoist is also in great scoring form at the moment 
468 Celtic 's Jackie McNamara who did well with last season 's successful under-21 team earns a call-up to the senior squad

630 TENNIS NEWCOMBE PONDERS HIS DAVIS CUP FUTURE 
631 SYDNEY 1996-08-22 
632 Australian Davis Cup captain John Newcombe on Thursday signalled his possible resignation if his team loses an away tie against Croatia next month 
633 The former Wimbledon champion said the immediate future of Australia 's Davis Cup coach Tony Roche could also be determined by events in Split 
634 If we lose this one Tony and I will have to have a good look at giving someone else a go Newcombe was quoted as saying in Sydney 's Daily Telegraph newspaper 
635 Australia face Croatia in the world group qualifying tie on clay from September 20-22 
636 Under Newcombe 's leadership Australia were relegated from the elite world group last year the first time the 26-time Davis Cup winners had slipped from the top rank 
637 Since taking over as captain from Neale Fraser in 1994 Newcombe 's record in tandem with Roche his former doubles partner has been three wins and three losses 
638 Newcombe has selected Wimbledon semifinalist Jason Stoltenberg Patrick Rafter Mark Philippoussis and Olympic doubles champions Todd Woodbridge and Mark Woodforde to face the Croatians 
639 The home side boasts world number six Goran Ivanisevic and Newcombe conceded his players would be hard-pressed to beat the Croatian number one 
640 We are ready to fight to our last breath Australia must play at its absolute best to win said Newcombe who described the tie as the toughest he has faced as captain 
641 Australia last won the Davis Cup in 1986 but they were beaten finalists against Germany three years ago under Fraser 's guidance

748 BASEBALL ORIOLES MANAGER DAVEY JOHNSON HOSPITALIZED 
749 BALTIMORE 1996-08-22 
750 Baltimore Orioles manager Davey Johnson will miss Thursday night 's game against the Seattle Mariners after being admitted to a hospital with an irregular heartbeat 
751 The 53-year-old Johnson was hospitalized after experiencing dizziness 
752 He is in no danger and will be treated and observed this evening said Orioles team physician Dr. William Goldiner adding that Johnson is expected to be released on Friday 
753 Orioles bench coach Andy Etchebarren will manage the club in Johnson 's absence 
754 Johnson is the second manager to be hospitalized this week after California Angels skipper John McNamara was admitted to New York 's Columbia Presbyterian Hospital on Wednesday with a blood clot in his left calf 
755 Johnson who played eight seasons in Baltimore was named Orioles manager in the off-season replacing Phil Regan 
756 He led the Cincinnati Reds to the National League Championship Series last year and guided the New York Mets to a World Series championship in 1986 
757 Baltimore has won 16 of its last 22 games to pull within five games of the slumping New York Yankees in the American League East Division

834 BASEBALL GREER HOMER IN 10TH LIFTS TEXAS PAST INDIANS 
835 CLEVELAND 1996-08-22 
836 Rusty Greer 's two-run homer in the top of the 10th inning rallied the Texas Rangers to a 10-8 victory over the Cleveland Indians Wednesday in the rubber game of a three-game series between division leaders 
837 With one out Greer hit a 1-1 pitch from Julian Tavarez 4-7 over the right-field fence for his 15th home run 
838 It was an off-speed pitch and I just tried to get a good swing on it and put it in play Greer said 
839 This was a big game 
840 The crowd was behind him and it was intense 
841 The shot brought home Ivan Rodriguez who had his second double of the game giving him 42 this season 41 as a catcher 
842 He joined Mickey Cochrane Johnny Bench and Terry Kennedy as the only catchers with 40 doubles in a season 
843 The Rangers have won 10 of their last 12 games and six of nine meetings against the Indians this season 
844 The American League Western leaders have won eight of 15 games at Jacobs Field joining the Yankees as the only teams with a winning record at the A.L. Central leaders home 
845 Cleveland lost for just the second time in six games 
846 The Indians sent the game into extra innings in the ninth on Kenny Lofton 's two-run single 
847 Ed Vosberg 1-0 blew his first save opportunity but got the win allowing three hits with two walks and three strikeouts in 1 2/3 scoreless innings 
848 Dean Palmer hit his 30th homer for the Rangers 
849 In Baltimore Cal Ripken had four hits and snapped a fifth-inning tie with a solo homer and Bobby Bonilla added a three-run shot in the seventh to power the surging Orioles to a 10-5 victory over the Seattle Mariners 
850 The Mariners scored four runs in the top of the fifth to tie the game 5-5 but Ripken led off the bottom of the inning with his 21st homer off starter Sterling Hitchcock 12-6 
851 Bonilla 's blast was the first time Randy Johnson last season 's Cy Young winner allowed a run in five relief appearances since coming off the disabled list on August 6 
852 Bonilla has 21 RBI and 15 runs in his last 20 games 
853 Baltimore has won seven of nine and 16 of its last 22 and cut the Yankees lead in the A.L. East to five games 
854 Scott Erickson 8-10 laboured to his third straight win 
855 Alex Rodriguez had two homers and four RBI for the Mariners who have dropped three in a row and 11 of 15 
856 He became the fifth shortstop in major-league history to hit 30 homers in a season and the first since Ripken hit 34 in 1991 
857 Chris Hoiles hit his 22nd homer for Baltimore 
858 In New York Jason Dickson scattered 10 hits over 6 1/3 innings in his major-league debut and Chili Davis belted a homer from each side of the plate as the California Angels defeated the Yankees 7-1 
859 Dickson allowed a homer to Derek Jeter on his first major-league pitch but settled down 
860 He was the 27th pitcher used by the Angels this season tying a major-league record 
861 Jimmy Key 9-10 took the loss as the Yankees lost their ninth in 14 games 
862 They stranded 11 baserunners 
863 California played without interim manager John McNamara who was admitted to a New York hospital with a blood clot in his right calf 
864 In Boston Mike Stanley 's bases-loaded two-run single snapped an eighth-inning tie and gave the Red Sox their third straight win 6-4 over the Oakland Athletics 
865 Stanley owns a .367 career batting average with the bases loaded 33-for-90 
866 Boston 's Mo Vaughn went 3-for-3 with a walk stole home for one of his three runs scored and collected his 116th RBI 
867 Scott Brosius homered and drove in two runs for the Athletics who have lost seven of their last nine games 
868 In Detroit Brad Ausmus 's three-run homer capped a four-run eighth and lifted the Tigers to a 7-4 victory over the reeling Chicago White Sox 
869 The Tigers have won consecutive games after dropping eight in a row but have won nine of their last 12 at home 
870 The White Sox have lost six of their last eight games 
871 In Kansas City Juan Guzman tossed a complete-game six-hitter to win for the first time in over a month and lower his league-best ERA as the Toronto Blue Jays won their fourth straight 6-2 over the Royals 
872 Guzman 10-8 won for the first time since July 16 a span of six starts 
873 He allowed two runs one earned and lowered his ERA to 2.99 
874 At Minnesota John Jaha 's three-run homer his 26th capped a five-run eighth inning that rallied the Milwaukee Brewers to a 10-7 victory over the Twins 
875 Jaha added an RBI single in the ninth and had four RBI 
876 Jose Valentin hit his 21st homer for Milwaukee

940 SOCCER UEFA REWARDS THREE COUNTRIES FOR FAIR PLAY 
941 GENEVA 1996-08-22 
942 Norway England and Sweden were rewarded for their fair play on Thursday with an additional place in the 1997-98 UEFA Cup competition 
943 Norway headed the UEFA Fair Play rankings for 1995-96 with 8.62 points ahead of England with 8.61 and Sweden 8.57 
944 The rankings are based on a formula that takes into account many factors including red and yellow cards and coaching and spectators behaviour at matches played at an international level by clubs and national teams 
945 Only the top three countries are allocated additional places 
946 The UEFA Fair Play rankings are 1 
947 Norway 8.62 points 
948 2. England 8.61

995 Australia in Sri Lanka for a limited overs tournament which also includes India and Zimbabwe have been promised the presence of commandos sniffer dogs and plainclothes policemen to ensure the tournament is trouble-free 
996 They are making their first visit to the island since boycotting a World Cup fixture in February because of fears over ethnic violence

999 The youth side replied with 246 for seven

1016 In Home Health to appeal payment denial 
1017 MINNETONKA Minn 
1018 1996-08-22 
1019 In Home Health Inc said on Thursday it will appeal to the U.S. Federal District Court in Minneapolis a decision by the Health Care Financing Administration HCFA that denied reimbursement of certain costs under Medicaid 
1020 The HCFA Administrator reversed a previously favorable decision regarding the reimbursement of costs related to the company 's community liaison personnel it added 
1021 The company said it continues to believe the majority of the community liaison costs are coverable under the terms of the Medicare program 
1022 We are disappointed with the administrator 's decision but we continue to be optimistic regarding an ultimate favorable resolution Mark Gildea chief executive officer said in a statement 
1023 In Home Health said it previously recorded a reserve equal to 16 percent of all revenue related to the community liaison costs 
1024 Separately In Home Health said the U.S. District Court in Minneapolis ruled in its favor regarding the reimbursement of certain interest expenses 
1025 This decision will result in the reimbursement by Medicare of $ 81,000 in disputed costs 
1026 This is our first decision in federal distrct court regarding a dispute with Medicare Gildea said 
1027 We are extremely pleased with this decision and we recognize it as a significant step toward resolution of our outstanding Medicare disputes 
1028 Chicago Newsdesk 312-408-8787

1032 The company which reported improved first quarter earnings for the period ended July 31 1996 declared a quarterly distribution of $ 0.65 per partnership unit for the quarter ended July 
1033 Best sees Q2 loss similar to Q1 loss 
1034 RICHMOND Va 
1035 1996-08-22 
1036 Best Products Co Chairman and Chief Executive Daniel Levy said Thursday he expected the company 's second-quarter results to be similar to the $ 34.6 million loss posted in the first quarter 
1037 He also told Reuters before the retailer 's annual meeting that the second quarter could be better than the first quarter ended May 4 
1038 We could do even better he said 
1039 The second-quarter results are expected to be released in September 
1040 Levy said seeking bankruptcy protection was not under consideration 
1041 Best emerged from Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in June 1994 after 3-1/2 years 
1042 Bankruptcy is always possible particularly when you lose what we are going to lose in the first half of this year Levy said 
1043 But this is not something we are striving to do 
1044 The Richmond-based retailer lost $ 95.7 million in the fiscal year ended February 3 
1045 That was the second-largest loss in the company 's history 
1046 Levy said that Best planned to open two new stores this fall 
1047 The company announced in March that it was closing seven stores and backing out of nine new lease agreements 
1048 At the time Best said it did not plan to open any new stores this fall 
1049 It currently operates 169 stores in 23 states 
1050 For last year 's second quarter which ended July 29 1995 Best posted a loss of $ 7.1 million or $ 0.23 per share on sales of $ 311.9 million 
1051 Measles exposure can lead to bowel disease study 
1052 LONDON 1996-08-23 
1053 Women who get measles while pregnant may have babies at higher risk of Crohn 's disease a debilitating bowel disorder researchers said on Friday 
1054 Three out of four Swedish babies born to mothers who caught measles developed serious cases of Crohn 's disease the researchers said 
1055 Dr Andrew Wakefield of the Royal Free Hospital School of Medicine and colleagues screened 25,000 babies delivered at University Hospital Uppsala between 1940 and 1949 
1056 Four of the mothers had measles while pregnant 
1057 Three of the four children had Crohn 's disease Wakefield 's group wrote in the Lancet medical journal 
1058 Crohn 's is an inflammation of the bowel that can sometimes require surgery 
1059 It causes diarrhoea abdominal pain and weight loss 
1060 The researchers said the three children involved had especially severe cases 
1061 Exposure to viruses can often cause birth defects 
1062 Most notably women who get rubella German measles have a high risk of a stillborn baby

1074 replying above normal and those replying below normal 
1075 The survey was conducted between July 23 and August 14 and involved 1,305 companies representing 50 industries accounting for around half of the UK 's manufactured exports and some two million employees

1084 Garlic pills do n't lower cholesterol study finds 
1085 LONDON 1996-08-22 
1086 Garlic pills may not lower blood cholesterol and studies that show they do may be flawed British researchers have reported 
1087 A study by a team of doctors at Oxford University has found people with high blood cholesterol do not benefit significantly from taking garlic tablets 
1088 The study involved 115 people with high blood cholesterol levels 
1089 They were given 900 milligrams a day of dried garlic powder or placebo tablets 
1090 There were no significant differences between the groups receiving garlic and placebo they wrote in the Journal of the Royal College of Physicians 
1091 Those taking part were told to eat a low-fat diet for six weeks before they started taking the pills and their blood cholesterol measured before and after the six-week period 
1092 The researchers said this would make their findings more accurate 
1093 Several studies have found garlic pills can lower blood pressure and blood cholesterol 
1094 But the Oxford team disputed these findings and said either previous trials may have been interpreted incorrectly those taking part were not given special diets beforehand or the duration of the studies may have been too short 
1095 The six-month trial was funded by the British Heart Foundation and Lichtwer Pharma GmbH which makes Kwai brand garlic tablets 
1096 The study did not address whether whole garlic could affect cholesterol 
1097 London Newsroom +44 171 542 7950 
1098 Britain gives aid to volcano-hit Caribbean island 
1099 LONDON 1996-08-22 
1100 Britain said on Thursday it would give 25 million pounds $ 39 million of development aid to the Caribbean island of Montserrat where much of the population living in the south has fled to avoid a volcano 
1101 The volcano in the Soufriere hills has erupted three times in the past 13 months and last April some 4,500 people living in the capital Plymouth and southern areas were evacuated to the north where many are living in public shelters and schools 
1102 This assistance will provide a fast track development programme for the designated northern safe area Britain 's Overseas Development Administration said in a statement 
1103 Britain gave 8.5 million pounds $ 13 million to Montserrat which is one of its dependent territories when the volcano first became active 
1104 Overseas Development Minister Lynda Chalker said a recent census had shown most Montserratians wanted to remain on the island 
1105 The development of the north will help them to do just that she said 
1106 Tennis Philippoussis looms for Sampras in U.S. Open 
1107 Bill Berkrot 
1108 NEW YORK 1996-08-22 
1109 World number one Pete Sampras seeking his first Grand Slam title of the year and women 's top seed Steffi Graf aiming for her third should be able to ease into the year 's final major which begins on Monday 
1110 Sampras opens the defence of his U.S. Open crown against David Rikl of the Czech Republic while top-ranked Graf begins her title defence against Yayuk Basuki of Indonesia 
1111 Wednesday 's U.S. Open draw ceremony revealed that both title holders should run into their first serious opposition in the third round 
1112 Looming in Sampras 's future is a likely third-round date with recent nemesis Mark Philippoussis the rising Australian who took out Sampras in the third round of the Australian Open in January 
1113 Sampras avenged that defeat with a straight sets win over the 19-year-old power hitter in the second round at Wimbledon and their rubber match in New York could provide some first-week fireworks 
1114 While only a stunning upset will keep Graf from sailing through to a predictable semifinal showdown with third seed Arantxa Sanchez Vicario the German star could also be tested in the third round where she will probably face 28th-ranked veteran Natasha Zvereva of Belarus 
1115 There will be no repeat of last year 's men 's final with eighth-ranked Andre Agassi landing in Sampras 's half of the draw 
1116 Bumping Agassi up to the sixth seeding avoided the possibility that he would run into Sampras as early as the quarter-finals but they could lock horns in the semis 
1117 Olympic champion Agassi meets Karim Alami of Morocco in the first round 
1118 Surprise second seed Michael Chang ranked third in the world opens against Czech Daniel Vacek while women 's second seed Monica Seles drew American Anne Miller as her first victim 
1119 Second-ranked Austrian Thomas Muster who was seeded third did not have the luck of the draw with him 
1120 In the first round Muster faces American Richey Reneberg who has been playing some of the best tennis of his career of late 
1121 If he survives Muster is seeded to run into either fifth-seeded Wimbledon champion Richard Krajicek of the Netherlands or 12th-seeded American Todd Martin in the quarter-finals in Chang 's half of the draw 
1122 Perhaps the best yet most unfortunate first-round matchup of the men 's competition pits eighth seed Jim Courier against retiring star Stefan Edberg 
1123 The popular Swede is playing his final major tournament next week and the two-time champion 's Grand Slam farewell could well be a one-match affair 
1124 With the exception of a Philippoussis showdown Sampras looks to have landed in a comfortable quarter of the draw with the likes of Frenchman Cedric Pioline and ailing French Open champion Yevgeny Kafelnikov who is nursing a rib injury in his path 
1125 Seles runner-up to Graf last year is seeded to run into fifth-ranked German Anke Huber in the quarter-finals with fourth seed Conchita Martinez or eighth-seeded Olympic champion Lindsay Davenport looking like her most likely semifinal opponents 
1126 But Huber will be tested immediately with a first-round encounter against dangerous 18th-ranked South African Amanda Coetzer 
1127 Sanchez Vicario runner-up to Graf at the French Open and Wimbledon begins play against a qualifier in a quarter of the draw that includes young talent Martina Hingis the 16th seed before a probable quarter-final clash with seventh-seeded veteran Jana Novotna 
1128 Martinez begins play against Ruxandra Dragomir of Romania 
1129 Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800 
1130 RTRS Tennis Muster upset Philippoussis wins Stoltenberg loses 
1131 TORONTO 1996-08-21 
1132 Top-seeded Thomas Muster of Austria was beaten 6-3 7-5 by 123rd-ranked Daniel Nestor of Canada on Wednesday in his first match of the $ 2 million Canadian Open 
1133 A lefthander with a strong serve Nestor kept the rallies short by constantly attacking the net and the tactic worked in the second-round match against Muster playing his first match after receiving a first-round bye along with the other top eight seeds 
1134 The tournament also lost its second seed on the third day of play when second-seeded Goran Ivanisevic of Croatia was beaten 6-7(3-7 6-4 6-4 by unseeded Mikael Tillstrom of Sweden 
1135 Other seeded players advancing were number three Wayne Ferreira of South Africa number four Marcelo Rios of Chile number six MaliVai Washington of the United States and American Todd Martin the seventh seeed 
1136 Eighth seed Marc Rosset of Switzerland was eliminated in a one hour 55 minute battle by unseeded Mark Philippoussis of Australia 
1137 Philippoussis saved a match point at 5-6 in the third-set tie break before winning 6-3 3-6 7-6 8-6 
1138 Philippoussis 's compatriot 13th seed Jason Stoltenberg was not as fortunate 
1139 He held one match point at 9-8 in a marathon third-set tie break but was beaten 5-7 7-6 7-1 7-6 13-11 by unseeded Daniel Vacek of the Czech Republic 
1140 I knew I had to serve well and keep the points short and that 's what I was able to do said Nestor who ranks 10th in doubles 
1141 There were only two service breaks in the match 
1142 The lanky Canadian broke Muster at 4-3 in the first set and 5-5 in the second before ending the match on his third match point when the Austrian hit a service return long 
1143 I probably did n't hit five ground strokes in the whole match said Muster only partly joking 
1144 The way he was chipping and charging and serving and volleying I did n't really get my timing playing from the baseline 
1145 He played a good match took a few chances and every time he was down he was able to come up with a big first serve 
1146 Playing at night was not Muster 's preference 
1147 I asked for a day match and they gave me a night match he said 
1148 I do n't like playing under the lights but maybe it would not have made any difference 
1149 Ivanisevic rallied from a 2-5 deficit in the first set but then played erratically against the 44th-ranked Tillstrom who was a surprise winner over his famous compatriot Stefan Edberg in the second round at Wimbledon 
1150 Ivanisevic hit 32 aces but was outplayed from the back court by the 24-year-old Tillstrom 
1151 The sixth-ranked Ivanisevic who lost in the final at Indianapolis to world number one Pete Sampras of the U.S. last Sunday made a quick getaway after his loss but did say Something was not there when I arrived in Toronto 
1152 I did n't feel good 
1153 And I did n't have a good feeling as soon as I lost in my doubles on Tuesday 
1154 I thought he looked a little unfocused at certain times on his ground strokes said Tillstrom 
1155 The 19-year-old Philippoussis who beat Sampras in the third round of this year 's Australian Open stayed calm in a nervy third-set tie break against Rosset 
1156 I 'm pleased because I did n't play that great today but I fought really well he said 
1157 When I was down 2-5 in the tiebreak in the third set I just thought about winning my two serves and hoped that he might get tight 
1158 Then he shanked a forehand at to make it 5-all and that helped me back

1175 Senegal cholera outbreak kills five 
1176 DAKAR 1996-08-22 
1177 An outbreak of cholera has killed five people in the central Senegal town of Kaolack where health authorities have recorded 291 cases since August 11 a medical official said on Thursday 
1178 Doctor Masserigne Ndiaye said medical staff were overwhelmed with work 
1179 People are rushing to the hospital as soon as the first symptoms appear that 's why we have fewer deaths he told Reuters by telephone from the town 160 km 100 miles southeast of the Senegalese capital Dakar 
1180 Nigerian general takes over Liberia ECOMOG force 
1181 MONROVIA 1996-08-22 
1182 Nigerian Major General Sam Victor Malu took over on Thursday as commander of the ECOMOG peacekeeping force in Liberia two days after the start of the latest ceasefire in the six-year civil war 
1183 Malu replaced another Nigerian major general John Inienger who told officers at the handover ceremony that peace was now at hand for Liberia after six years of fighting and more than a dozen failed accords 
1184 The search for peace in Liberia has been difficult challenging and sometimes painful 
1185 Peacekeepers were harassed killed and taken hostage he said 
1186 It is difficult but I want to assure you that peace is in sight 
1187 United Nations military observers travelling to the western town of Tubmanburg on Wednesday to monitor the ceasefire were delayed by shooting along the highway U.N. special representative Anthony Nyakyi said 
1188 They finally went ahead with an escort from the ULIMO-J faction 
1189 Faction leaders who agreed a new peace deal in the Nigerian capital Abuja on Saturday have accused each other of breaking the ceasefire 
1190 The latest peace deal foresees the disarmament of an estimated 60,000 combatants and sets a target date of May 30 next year for elections 
1191 The ECOMOG force currently 10,000 strong was sent to Liberia by the Economic Community of West African States in 1990 at the height of the fighting 
1192 Guinea calls two days of prayer 
1193 CONAKRY 1996-08-22 
1194 The West African state of Guinea declared Thursday and Friday days of national prayer 
1195 A government statement broadcast repeatedly by state radio said the two days of prayer were for the dead for peace and prosperity in Guinea the victory of the new government and the health of the head of state 
1196 The precise reason for the call was not immediately clear 
1197 Guinea 's president Lansana Conte vice-president of the Organisation of the Islamic Conference left for Kuwait on August 16 to prepare the next OIC summit in Pakistan in 1997 
1198 Koranic reading sessions and prayers were to be held in the farming town of Badi-Tondon near his home about 60 km 40 miles from the capital Conakry 
1199 Conte an army general survived a February army pay revolt which at the time he described as a veiled attempt to topple him 
1200 He has since named a prime minister for the first time since early in his rule and ordered a crackdown on corruption 
1201 Conte seized power in 1984 after the death of veteran Marxist leader Ahmed Sekou Toure 
1202 He won elections in 1993 
1203 South African answers U.S. message in a bottle 
1204 JOHANNESBURG 1996-08-22 
1205 A South African boy is writing back to an American girl whose message in a bottle he found washed up on President Nelson Mandela 's old prison island 
1206 But Carlo Hoffmann an 11-year-old jailer 's son who found the bottle on the beach at Robben Island off Cape Town after winter storms will send his letter back by ordinary mail on Thursday the post office said 
1207 It will be sent for free 
1208 Danielle Murray from Sandusky Ohio the same age as her new penfriend asked for a reply from whoever received the message she flung on its journey months ago on the other side of the Atlantic Ocean 
1209 Rottweiler kills South African toddler 
1210 JOHANNESBURG 1996-08-22 
1211 A rottweiler dog belonging to an elderly South African couple savaged to death their two-year-old grandson who was visiting police said on Thursday 
1212 The dog attacked Louis Booy in the front garden of his grandparents house in Vanderbijlpark near Johannesburg on Tuesday 
1213 His bloody body was lying in the garden when his parents arrived in the afternoon to pick him up 
1214 It was unclear where the grandparents were at the time 
1215 Dogs fierce enough to scare off burglars are becoming increasingly popular in the crime-infested Johannesburg area 
1216 INDICATORS Hungary updated Aug 22

1234 Fifty Russians die in clash with rebels-Interfax 
1235 MOSCOW 1996-08-22 
1236 At least 50 Russian servicemen have been killed in a battle with separatist rebels which erupted in the Chechen capital Grozny on Thursday and continued after Russia and the rebels agreed a truce Interfax news agency said 
1237 Interfax quoted Russian military command in Chechnya as saying that about 200 interior ministry forces sent on reconaisance mission clashed with rebels at Minutka Square 
1238 The Interfax report could not be independently confirmed 
1239 Moscow peacemaker Alexander Lebed and rebel chief-of-staff Aslan Maskhadov signed an agreement earlier on Thursday under which the two sides would cease all hostilities at noon 0800 GMT on Friday 
1240 Interfax made clear that the interior ministry detachment had been sent on the mission before the truce deal had been signed at the local equivalent of 1500 GMT 
1241 But fierce fighting still raged at 1600 GMT Interfax said 
1242 It quoted a source in the Russian command in Chechnya as saying that the servicemen were outnumbered by the rebels 
1243 Polish schoolgirl blackmailer wanted textbooks 
1244 GDANSK Poland 1996-08-22 
1245 A Polish schoolgirl blackmailed two women with anonymous letters threatening death and later explained that she needed money for textbooks police said on Thursday 
1246 The 13-year-old girl tried to extract 60 and 70 zlotys $ 22 and $ 26 from two residents of Sierakowice by threatening to take their lives a police spokesman said in the nearby northern city of Gdansk on Thursday 
1247 He said the women reported the blackmail letters and police caught the girl on Wednesday as she tried to pick up the cash at the Sierakowice railway station 
1248 Interviewed in the presence of a psychologist she said she wanted to use the money for school books and clothes spokesman Kazimierz Socha told Reuters 
1249 He said the case of the girl from a poor family that had never been in trouble with the law would go before a special court dealing with underage offenders

1282 Grozny quiet overnight after raids 
1283 ALKHAN-YURT Russia 1996-08-22 
1284 The city of Grozny pounded by Russian planes and artillery for hours on Wednesday calmed down overnight although sporadic explosions and shooting could still be heard 
1285 Reuters correspondent Lawrence Sheets speaking from the nearby village of Alkhan-Yurt said he had heard little from Grozny since Wednesday evening 's arrival of Russian security chief Alexander Lebed who said he came with peace 
1286 A couple of helicopters flew over the city early on Thursday morning but did not appear to be firing at anything

1288 Boat passengers rescued off Colombian coast 
1289 BOGOTA Colombia 1996-08-22 
1290 Colombia 's Coast Guard on Thursday rescued 12 people lost for three days in an open boat off the Pacific coast officials said 
1291 The boat had been missing since Monday afternoon when it left the tiny island of Gorgona off Colombia 's southwest coast with sightseers for a return trip to Narino province near the border with Ecuador 
1292 The boat ran out of fuel and did not have a radio to call for help Navy spokesman Lt. Italo Pineda said 
1293 He said 11 passengers and one boatman survived on coconuts and rainwater during 65 hours lost at sea 
1294 The boat was towed to the port city of Buenaventura 
1295 Argentine July raw steel output up 14.8 pct vs 95 
1296 BUENOS AIRES 1996-08-22 
1297 Argentine raw steel output was 355,900 tonnes in July 14.8 percent higher than in July 1995 and up 1.9 percent from June Steel Industry Center said Thursday 
1298 Primary iron output was 297,700 tonnes 14.5 percent more than last July and 0.1 percent more than in June

1300 Production of cold laminates was 120,500 tonnes 4.2 percent higher than the same month last year and 11 percent higher than in June 
1301 Jason Webb Buenos Aires Newsroom +541 318-0655 
1302 Peru 's guerrillas kill one take 8 hostage in jungle 
1303 LIMA Peru 1996-08-21 
1304 Peruvian guerrillas killed one man and took eight people hostage after taking over a village in the country 's northeastern jungle region anti- terrorist police sources said on Wednesday 
1305 For three hours on Tuesday around 100 members of the Maoist rebel group Shining Path took control of Alomella Robles a small village about 345 miles 550 km northeast of Lima the sources said 
1306 Some guerrillas made villagers listen to propaganda speeches in the village centre others forced passing motorists out of their cars and daubed their vehicles with slogans 
1307 By Wednesday the whereabouts of the eight hostages was still not known the sources said 
1308 In recent months the Shining Path severely weakened since the 1992 capture of its leader Abimael Guzman has been stepping up both its military and propaganda activities 
1309 Peru 's guerrilla conflicts have cost at least 30,000 lives and $ 25 billion in damage to infrastructure since 1980 
1310 Former Surinam rebel leader held after shooting 
1311 PARAMARIBO Surinam 1996-08-21 
1312 Flamboyant former Surinamese rebel leader Ronny Brunswijk was in custody on Wednesday charged with attempted murder police said 
1313 Brunswijk turned himself into police after Freddy Pinas a Surinamese-born visitor from the Netherlands accused Brunswijk of trying to kill him on Sunday after a bar-room brawl in the small mining town of Moengo about 56 miles 90 km east of Paramaribo said police spokesman Ro Gajadhar 
1314 Pinas showing cuts and bruises on his face told reporters the former head of the feared Jungle Command had tried and failed to shoot him after Pinas objected to Brunswijk 's advances toward his wife 
1315 Pinas said Brunswijk then ordered his bodyguards to beat him up 
1316 Brunswijk 35 denied the charges and said he had merely defended himself when Pinas attacked him with a bottle 
1317 It was the second time Brunswijk had been charged with attempted murder in less than two years 
1318 In 1994 he served two months in prison for shooting a thief in the buttocks 
1319 Brunswijk led a rebel group of about 1,000 in a 1986 uprising against the regime of military strongman Desi Bouterse 
1320 The conflict which killed more than 500 and caused thousands to flee to neighbouring French Guiana in the late 1980s eventually paved the way to democratic elections in 1991 
1321 Despite numerous problems with authorities Brunswijk went on to become a successful businessman with mining and logging interests 
1322 He also manages and occasionally plays for one of the leading local soccer teams 
1323 Noisy saw leads Thai police to heroin hideaway 
1324 BANGKOK 1996-08-22 
1325 A Hong Kong carpenter was arrested in the Thai seaside town of Pattaya after police seized 18 kg 39.7 pounds of heroin following complaints by residents of a noisy saw police said on Thursday 
1326 Cheung Siu Man 40 was arrested late on Wednesday after police searched a house and found heroin in bags and hidden in hollow spaces in wooden planks police said 
1327 The suspect said he was hired to make a wooden box from the planks in order to hide the heroin 
1328 Police went to the house after receiving complaints of sawing during the night over the course of several days 
1329 When they arrived to investigate police saw people escaping from the back door so they decided to search the house 
1330 The seized heroin has an estimated street value of about 300 million baht $ 12 million police said 
1331 Officials are now hunting for the suspect 's collaborators police said 
1332 Cheung was being detained pending formal charges police said 
1333 Australia foreign minister arrives in China 
1334 BEIJING 1996-08-22 
1335 Australian Foreign Minister Alexander Downer arrived in Beijing on Thursday for a four-day visit that follows rising friction between the two nations in recent weeks 
1336 Downer was to meet Chinese Foreign Minister Qian Qichen and sign an agreement on an Australian consulate in Hong Kong an official of the Australian embassy in Beijing said 
1337 China will resume sovereignty over Hong Kong a British colony in mid-1997 
1338 Relations between China and Australia have been strained in recent weeks because of Australia 's plan to sell uranium to China 's rival Taiwan 
1339 Other issues affecting ties include plans by an Australian cabinet minister to visit Taiwan a security pact between Canberra and Washington and a possible visit to Australia next month by Tibet 's exiled spiritual leader the Dalai Lama 
1340 Downer is the first Australian minister to visit China since the new conservative government took office in Canberra in March 
1341 Palestinians accuse PA of banning books 
1342 NABLUS West Bank 1996-08-22 
1343 A West Bank bookseller charged on Thursday that the Palestinian Information Ministry has forced him to sign an undertaking not to distribute books written by critics of Israeli-PLO self-rule deals 
1344 They made me sign an undertaking not to sell the books to anyone at the risk of legal action 
1345 One official told me you have to either destroy the books or return them to Amman Daoud Makkawi owner of the Nablus-based al-Risala bookshop told Reuters 
1346 He said ministry officials made him sign this a few weeks ago after he brought about a dozen copies from Jordan of a book by Edward Said a prominent scholar at New York City 's Columbia University 
1347 Said a U.S. citizen of Palestinian origin has been an outspoken critic of the 1993 Israeli-PLO self-rule deal and has written at least two books on the accord 
1348 On Wednesday a bookseller in the West Bank town of Ramallah said police about a month ago confiscated several copies of two of Said 's books on the Israel-PLO self-rule deals 
1349 Palestinian Information Ministry Director-General Mutawakel Taha denied that ministry officials forced anyone to sign any undertaking and insisted that the Palestinian Authority has no plans to censor books 
1350 There is no strategy to ban books or to suppress freedom of expression in any form whatsoever Taha told Reuters 
1351 But Taha said that the absence of relevent legislations may have resulted in some mistakes by some security officials 
1352 This may explain some mistakes against some journalists and writers he said 
1353 Daoud said books by other authors including British Journalist Patrick Seale were also banned 
1354 He said that security officials often visit his shop to make sure he was not selling the books 
1355 I think this is a bad beginning 
1356 If we have confidence why should we be afraid of the other opinion ? 
1357 Daoud said 
1358 Thousands of books were banned from sale in the West Bank and Gaza Strip by the Israeli military authorities before the Jewish state handed over parts of the two areas to the PLO under a self-rule deal in 1994 
1359 Egypt blames Istanbul control tower for accident 
1360 CAIRO 1996-08-22 
1361 The chairman of national carrier EgyptAir on Thursday blamed the control tower at Istanbul airport for the EgyptAir plane accident 
1362 Twenty people were injured on Wednesday when the EgyptAir Boeing 707 overshot the runway caught fire hit a taxi and skipped across a road onto a railway line 
1363 Chairman Mohamed Fahim Rayyan told a news conference at Cairo airport The control tower should have allocated the plane another runway instead of the one the plane landed on 
1364 The one it landed on is 2,250 metres 2,460 yards long while the other one if more than 3,000 metres 3,300 yards long and is less steep he added 
1365 He said a Turkish civil aviation authority official had made the same point and he noted that a Turkish plane had a similar accident there in 1994 
1366 The EgyptAir pilot blamed Turkish airport staff for misleading him 
1367 The landing took place after a rainstorm 
1368 Its not an accident 
1369 It 's very wet 
1370 The brake action is very poor and the tower said it 's medium 
1371 That 's wrong the pilot told private Ihlas news agency in English 
1372 Egypt wants nothing to do with Sudanese rulers 
1373 CAIRO 1996-08-22 
1374 The Egyptian government will have nothing more to do with the Sudanese government because it continues to shelter and support Egyptian militants President Hosni Mubarak said in a speech on Thursday 
1375 Egypt says the Sudanese government helped the Moslem militants who tried to kill Mubarak in Addis Ababa last year 
1376 It sponsored last week 's U.N. Security Council resolution threatening a ban on Sudanese flights abroad if Khartoum does not hand over three men accused in the Addis Ababa incident 
1377 The sanctions will come into effect in November if Sudan fails to extradite the men but Sudan says it cannot hand them over to Ethiopia for trial because they are not in Sudan 
1378 We are still eager that nothing should affect the Sudanese people but we will not deal with the current regime or the Turabi front or whatever Mubarak told a group of academics 
1379 Hassan al-Turabi is the leader of the National Islamic Front the political force behind the Sudanese government 
1380 I do n't want to go into more details than that but there are more details and they are bitter 
1381 There are terrorists they are sheltering and they make Sudanese passorts for them and they get paid by them Mubarak said 
1382 He did not say if Egypt would go so far as to break relations a step it has been reluctant to take ostensibly because it would affect ordinary Sudanese 
1383 Turkish shares shed gains in profit-taking 
1384 ISTANBUL 1996-08-22 
1385 Turkish shares ended lower on Thursday shedding gains of earlier in the week amid profit-taking sales brokers said 
1386 The IMKB-100 lost 0.19 percent or 123.89 points to end at 64,178.78 
1387 Gains so far this week have totalled 2.92 percent 
1388 Daily volume dropped to 7.2 trillion lira from Wednesday 's 7.8 trillion lira 
1389 Profit-taking sales in the afternoon showed the latest gains of the index were actually a reaction rise 
1390 I expect the market to go as far down as 63,000 tomorrow if sales continue said Burcin Mavituna from Interbank 
1391 Brokers said profit taking sales had come especially as the index approached the 65,000 resistance level 
1392 They said the index could also rise towards 65,000 if the cheap share prices attracted buyers 
1393 The market had its first resistance at 67,000 if it pierced 65,000 they added 
1394 The session 's most active shares were those of Isbank gained 300 lira to 8,600 
1395 Shares of utility Cukurova lost 3,000 lira to 67,000 
1396 The 85-share industrial index lost 0.47 percent to 70,848.86 and the 15-share financial index rose by 0.55 percent to 55,929.89 
1397 Of the 218 shares traded gainers outdid losers by 100 to 64 and 54 shares were stable

1399 Miss Universe hides behind veil of silence 
1400 Kieran Murray 
1401 LAS CRUCES N.M. 1996-08-22 
1402 Miss Universe Venezuela 's Alicia Machado left New Mexico on Thursday refusing to answer questions about her weight or claims she was told to either go on a crash diet or give up her title 
1403 Machado 19 flew to Los Angeles after slipping away from the New Mexico desert town of Las Cruces where she attended the 1996 Miss Teen USA pageant on Wednesday 
1404 While Machado was not a contestant here she came under intense scrutiny following reports she was given an ultimatum by Los Angeles-based Miss Universe Inc. to drop 27 pounds 12 kg in two weeks or risk losing her crown 
1405 In Venezuela her mother told Reuters that Machado had a swollen face when she left home two weeks ago because she had her wisdom teeth extracted 
1406 Marta Fajardo insisted her daughter who weighed 112 pounds 51 kg when she won the Miss Universe title in Las Vegas in May had perfectly normal eating habits 
1407 Everybody has their own addiction to something or other but it 's not as if she eats cakes like crazy she said 
1408 Organisers flatly denied ever threatening Machado but immediately put her under wraps and blocked access to her 
1409 Dressed in a black strapless evening gown at Wednesday 's pageant Machado was clearly heavier than the contestants but still won rave reviews after her brief appearance on stage 
1410 Are you kidding ? 
1411 She 's fantastic said Nikki Campbell 28 who went to the pageant 
1412 She looked great 
1413 Very sexy 
1414 Machado 's publicists said on Thursday she was scheduled to stay in Los Angeles for promotional work with sponsors before returning to Venezuela on Sept 
1415 5 
1416 Beauty queens are high-profile personalities in Venezuela and Machado 's alleged weight problem made front page news this week 
1417 It was an official of the Miss Venezuela Organisation who first said Machado had been told to lose weight fast 
1418 People close to her said she then eased up on her diet and indulged her passion for pasta and cake but it was not clear how many pounds she gained and most people who saw her said she was still a long way from being fat 
1419 Martin Brooks president of Miss Universe Inc said he spoke with Machado to assure her that organisers were not putting pressure on her 
1420 She 's fine with it 
1421 She wished as we all did that it had n't happened but she 's spiritually and mentally terrific 
1422 There 's no problem whatsoever he told Reuters 
1423 He said the lifestyle associated with being Miss Universe could make routine exercise difficult 
1424 The problem is they travel so much and are so busy that the ability to have any type of regimented routine workout does n't exist 
1425 I dont know if Alicia is working out 
1426 We have n't talked about it because it has n't been an issue he said 
1427 Kevorkian attends third suicide in week 
1428 PONTIAC Mich 
1429 1996-08-22 
1430 Dr. Jack Kevorkian attended his third suicide in less than a week on Thursday bringing the body of a 40-year-old Missouri woman suffering from multiple sclerosis to a hospital emergency room doctors said 
1431 Dr Robert Aranosian emergency room director at Pontiac Osteopathic Hospital said Kevorkian brought in the body of Patricia Smith of Lees Summit Mo 
1432 at midday and told doctors that she had been paralysed by the disease 
1433 It was his second assisted-suicide in 36 hours and the 37th that he has acknowledged attending since starting his crusade for doctor assisted suicide in 1990 
1434 Kevorkian 's lawyer Geoffrey Fieger said those attending Smith 's death included her husband David a police officer her father James Poland and Kevorkian 
1435 It was the first known time that a police officer has been president at the suicide of one of Kevorkian 's patients 
1436 He offered no details about the cause of Smith 's death or the location 
1437 She was a nurse who had rapidly progressing multple sclerosis 
1438 On Tuesday night Kevorkian attended the death of Louise Siebens a 76-year-old Texas woman with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis or Lou Gehrig 's disease 
1439 On August 15 Kevorkian helped Judith Curren a 42-year-old Massachusetts nurse who suffered from chronic fatigue syndrome a non-terminal illness to end her life

1450 Defiant U.S. neo-Nazi jailed by German court 
1451 Andrew Gray 
1452 HAMBURG Germany 1996-08-22 
1453 A Hamburg court sentenced U.S. neo-Nazi leader Gary Lauck on Thursday to four years in prison for pumping banned extremist propaganda into Germany from his base in the United States 
1454 Lauck from Lincoln Nebraska yelled a tirade of abuse at the court after his conviction for inciting racial hatred 
1455 The struggle will go on the 43-year-old shouted in German before being escorted out by security guards 
1456 Lauck 's lawyer vowed he would appeal against the court 's decision arguing that his client should have been set free because he had not committed any offence under German law 
1457 The German government hailed the conviction as a major victory in the fight against neo-Nazism 
1458 Lauck 's worldwide network has been the main source of anti-Semitic propaganda material flowing into Germany since the 1970s 
1459 Lauck possessed a well-oiled propaganda machine honed during more than 20 years presiding judge Guenter Bertram told the court 
1460 He set up a propaganda cannon and fired it at Germany 
1461 said Bertram who also read out extracts from Lauck 's material praising Hitler as the greatest of all leaders and describing the Nazi slaughter of millions of Jews as a myth 
1462 Eager to put Lauck behind bars quickly and avoid a long and complex trial prosecutor Bernd Mauruschat limited his charges to offences since 1994 
1463 He had demanded a five-year jail term but said he was satisfied with the court 's sentence 
1464 Publishing and distributing neo-Nazi material is illegal in Germany but Lauck 's defence team had argued that U.S freedom of speech laws meant he was free to produce his swastika-covered books magazines videos and flags in his homeland 
1465 Interior Minister Manfred Kanther said in a statement he welcomed the prosecution and conviction of one of the ringleaders of international neo-Nazism and biggest distributers of vicious racist publications 
1466 It is high time he was behind bars the opposition Social Democrats said in a statement 
1467 Lauck dressed in a sober blue suit and sporting his trademark Hitleresque black moustache showed no sign of emotion as Bertram spent more than an hour reading out the verdict and explaining the court 's decision 
1468 But as Lauck was about to be led away he turned to reporters and blurted out a virtually incomprehensible quick-fire diatribe against the court 
1469 Neither the National Socialists Nazis nor the communists dared to kidnap an American citizen he shouted in an oblique reference to his extradition to Germany from Denmark 
1470 That 's the truth 
1471 His attorney Hans-Otto Sieg told reporters outside the courtroom that the judges had not explained how a German court could judge someone for actions carried out in the United States 
1472 Bertram said Lauck was obsessed by Nazism and devoted his life to leading his National Socialist German Workers Party Foreign Organisation NSDAP-AO which derives its name from the full German title of Hitler 's Nazi party 
1473 During the three-month trial the court dealt mainly with issues of the NSDAP-AO 's NS Kampfruf National Socialist Battle Cry magazine filled with references to Aryan supremacy and defamatory statements about Jews 
1474 The court rejected Sieg 's argument that Lauck 's extradition from Denmark where he was arrested in March last year at the request of German authorities was illegal 
1475 Lauck was also convicted of disseminating the symbols of anti-constitutional organisations 
1476 He will probably be free in around two and a half years 
1477 The court ruled that the 15 months he has spent in custody since his arrest should be subtracted from his prison term 
1478 UN official says Iraqi deal will occur soon 
1479 UNITED NATIONS 1996-08-22 
1480 A senior U.N. official said on Thursday he expected arrangements to implement the Iraqi oil-for-food deal could be completed quite soon 
1481 I am reluctant to speculate but we are doing the preparations and the secretary-general is anxious to start the program said Undersecretary-General Yasushi Akashi 
1482 It might be sooner than you think he told reporters after briefing the Security Council on arrangements for monitors needed to carry out the agreement 
1483 Akashi is head of the Department of Humanitarian affairs 
1484 His deputy earlier speculated at least 10 days 
1485 Suspected killers of bishop dead Algeria TV 
1486 PARIS 1996-08-22 
1487 Algerian security forces have shot dead three Moslem guerrillas suspected of killing a leading French bishop in western Algeria the Algerian state-run television said on Thursday 
1488 Security forces also arrested four other men sought for giving support to the slain Moslem rebels the television said 
1489 The television which did not say when the security forces killed the rebels said the four arrested men confessed details of the assassination of the French Roman Catholic Bishop Pierre Claverie 
1490 The 58-year-old Claverie was killed in August 1 in a bomb blast at his residence in the western Algerian city of Oran hours after he met visiting French Foreign Minister Herve de Charette in Algiers 
1491 An estimated 50,000 Algerians and more than 110 foreigners have been killed in Algeria 's violence pitting Moslem rebels against the Algerian government forces since early 1992 when the authorities cancelled a general election in which radical Islamists took a commanding lead

1526 Clinton 's Ballybunion fans invited to Chicago
