1536 Bonn says Moscow has promised to observe ceasefire 
1537 BONN 1996-08-22 
1538 Germany said on Thursday it had received assurances from the Russian government that its forces would observe the latest ceasefire in Chechnya 
1539 Foreign Ministry spokesman Martin Erdmann said top Bonn diplomat Wolfgang Ischinger had been assured by senior Russian officials that the ultimatum to storm and take the Chechen capital of Grozny was not valid 
1540 The Russian side confirmed that the ceasefire is in place and they will keep to it Erdmann told Reuters after speaking by telephone to Ischinger who had met the officials on a two-day visit to Moscow 
1541 He returned to Bonn on Thursday 
1542 Ischinger is the political director of Bonn 's foreign ministry 
1543 Ischinger said he met three Russian deputy foreign ministers and a vice defence minister who confirmed Russian Foreign Minister Yevgeny Primakov 's pledge that Moscow would seek a political solution under the aegis of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe OSCE 
1544 The ultimatum to storm Grozny is no longer an issue he said quoting Ischinger who had been sent to Moscow by German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel as his personal envoy to urge an end to Moscow 's military campaign in the breakaway region 
1545 Ischinger said the threat of a major assault to take Grozny had been the unauthorised initiative of the commanding general and not Moscow 's intention 
1546 The officials had been positive about Kinkel 's request on Wednesday that President Boris Yeltsin 's security chief Alexander Lebed should on his return to Moscow meet Tim Goldiman the OSCE representative responsible for Chechnya he said 
1547 India says sees no arms race with China Pakistan 
1548 NEW DELHI 1996-08-22 
1549 India said on Thursday that its opposition to a global nuclear test ban treaty did not mean New Delhi intended to enter into an arms race with neighbouring Pakistan and China 
1550 Foreign Minister I.K. Gujral was asked at a news conference if India 's decision to block adoption of the accord in Geneva would lead to an arms race with Pakistan and China 
1551 I do n't see that possibility because India is not entering into any arms race he said 
1552 Our not signing a new treaty does not mean we are going in for any new kind of weapons particularly nuclear 
1553 China along with Britain France Russia and the United States is a declared nuclear power 
1554 India carried out a nuclear test in 1974 but says it has not built the bomb 
1555 Experts believe both India and Pakistan could quickly assemble nuclear weapons 
1556 Gujral said he did not expect India 's veto of the Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty CTBT to damage bilateral ties with other nations 
1557 I do not visualise its straining our bilateral relations with any country 
1558 The text has already been blocked he said 
1559 Gujral said India would re-examine its position if the treaty particularly a clause providing for its entry into force was modified 
1560 Asked what India would do if the pact were forwarded to the United Nations General Assembly Gujral said That bridge I will cross when I come to it 
1561 In a written statement released at the news conference Gujral reiterated India 's objections to the treaty under negotiation at the Conference on Disarmament in Geneva 
1562 It is a sad fact that the nuclear weapon states show no interest in giving up their nuclear hegemony the statement said 
1563 Gujral said India had national security concerns that made it impossible for New Delhi to sign the CTBT 
1564 Our security concerns oblige us to maintain our nuclear option he said adding that India had exercised restraint in not carrying out any nuclear tests since the country 's lone test blast in 1974 
1565 He said We cannot accept constraints on our option as long as nuclear weapon states continue to rely on their nuclear arsenals for their security 
1566 Britain says death of its citizen will sour ties 
1567 DHAKA 1996-08-22 
1568 A British minister expressed his government 's official disquiet on Thursday at the recent death of a British citizen of Bangladeshi origin at Dhaka airport 
1569 I have told Bangladesh leaders that British goverment has attached serious importance to the resolution of the tragic death of Siraj Mia Under-Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs Liam Fox Fox told reporters 
1570 Siraj Mia died at Dhaka airport on May 9 during interogation by customs officials after arriving from London 
1571 His body bore multiple injuries and his relatives complained that he was murdered 
1572 A post-mortem report suggested he might have been tortured 
1573 But customs authorities said the passenger was drunk and died of loss of blood from a deep cut in his wrist after he hit a glass sheet 
1574 Fox who arrived in Bangladesh on Tuesday on four-day visit said Britain wanted Dhaka to act seriously on the case 
1575 This is one of the reasons of my visit here 
1576 this is an important issue in our relationship said Fox who is due to leave for Nepal on Friday 
1577 Fox said the incident had strained relations between the two governments 
1578 He said the Mia 's issue had been raised in the House of Commons 
1579 Fox said he had brought up the issue at every meeting he had had with government leaders in Dhaka 
1580 He said the Bangladesh government had assured him it was taking the matter seriously 
1581 The British government wants a thorough investigation and a just outcome he said 
1582 Fox said the British government wanted an end to the alleged harassment of its nationals at Dhaka airport by customs officials 
1583 Bangladesh 's Criminal Investigation Department has charged two immigration officials in connection with Mia 's killing 
1584 Mia a father of five children had a restaurant business in a London suburb 
1585 India fears attempts to disrupt Kashmir polls 
1586 SRINAGAR India 1996-08-22 
1587 India 's Home interior Minister accused Pakistan on on Thursday of planning to disrupt state elections in troubled Jammu and Kashmir state 
1588 It seems that from across the border there is going to be a planned attempt to disrupt the elections Inderjit Gupta told reporters in the state capital Srinagar 
1589 The local polls next month will be the first since 1987 in the state clamped under direct rule from New Delhi since 1990 
1590 India has often accused Pakistan of abetting militancy in the valley a charge Islamabad has always denied 
1591 Gupta said there might be an increase in the number of people infiltrating the Kashmir valley to create disturbance in the region 
1592 We noticed among the people who come from across the border there is a growing number of foreign mercenaries Gupta said 
1593 India and Pakistan have fought two of their three wars over the troubled region of Kashmir since independence from Britain in 1947 
1594 Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda 's centre-left government hopes the elections will help restore normality and democratic rule in Jammu and Kashmir where more than 20,000 people have died in insurgency-related violence since 1990 
1595 Over a dozen militant groups are fighting New Delhi 's rule in the state 
1596 Dhaka stocks end up on gains by engineering banks 
1597 DHAKA 1996-08-22 
1598 Dhaka stocks edged up on sharply higher volume as engineering and cash shares gained amid buying by both small and institutional investors brokers said 
1599 The Dhaka Stock Exchange DSE all-share price index rose 8.05 points or 0.7 percent to 1,156.79 on a turnover of 146.2 million taka 
1600 Of the total 119 issues traded 71 closed higher 44 ended lower and four remained unchanged

1603 India RBI chief sees cut in cash reserve ratio 
1604 NEW DELHI 1996-08-22 
1605 The Reserve bank of India governor C. Rangarajan said on Thursday that he expected the cash reserve ratio CRR maintained by banks to be reduced over the medium term 
1606 Over the medium term yes he told Reuters after addressing industrialists in the capital 
1607 He denied having said in a recent newspaper interview that the CRR could be raised if necessary 
1608 He said he was only trying in that newspaper report to explain the theoretical position on the use of the CRR by central banks to manage money supply 
1609 Rangarajan explained that the cash reserve ratio was an instrument that central banks could use to regulate money supply by reducing or increasing the ratio 
1610 But in the current context the government stood by an earlier commitment to reduce it over a period of time he said in response to a question 
1611 New Delhi newsroom +91-11-3012024 
1612 Two pct India current account deficit viable RBI 
1613 BOMBAY 1996-08-22 
1614 The Reserve Bank of India Governor Chakravarty Rangarajan said on Thursday that a current account deficit of two percent of gross domestic product GDP was sustainable given the currrent rate of growth 
1615 The current account deficit of around two percent of GDP is a sustainable level of deficit given the expected real growth rate and the trends in imports and exports Rangarajan said in an address to business leaders in New Delhi 
1616 Rangarajan said a current account deficit of two percent brought about by a 16-17 percent annual growth in exports and a 14-15 percent rise in imports along with an increase in non-debt flows could lead to a reduction in the debt-service ratio to below 20 percent over the next five years 
1617 Bombay newsroom +91-22-265 9000 
1618 Mother Teresa devoted to world 's poor 
1619 CALCUTTA 1996-08-22 
1620 Mother Teresa known as the Saint of the Gutters won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1979 for bringing hope and dignity to millions of poor unwanted people with her simple message The poor must know that we love them 
1621 While the world heaps honours on her and even regards her as a living saint the nun of Albanian descent maintains she is merely doing God 's work 
1622 It gives me great joy and fulfilment to love and care for the poor and neglected she said 
1623 The poor do not need our sympathy and pity 
1624 They need our love and compassion 
1625 The diminutive Roman Catholic missionary was on respiratory support in intensive care in an Indian nursing home on Thursday after suffering heart failure 
1626 But an attending doctor said Mother Teresa who turns 86 next Tuesday was conscious and in stable condition 
1627 The task Mother Teresa began alone in 1949 in the slums of densely-populated Calcutta and grew to touch the hearts of people around the world 
1628 When in 1979 she was told she had won the Nobel Peace Prize she said characteristically I am unworthy 
1629 The world disagreed showering more than 80 national and international honours on her including the Bharat Ratna or Jewel of India the country 's highest civilian award 
1630 Her health began to deteriorate in 1989 when she was fitted with a heart pacemaker 
1631 A year later the Vatican announced she was stepping down as Superior of her Missionaries of Charity order 
1632 More than 100 delegates flew in from around the world to elect a successor 
1633 They could not agree so asked her to stay on 
1634 She agreed 
1635 In 1991 Mother Teresa was treated at a California hospital for heart disease and bacterial pneumonia 
1636 In 1993 she fell in Rome and broke three ribs 
1637 In August the same year while in New Delhi to receive yet another award she developed malaria complicated by her heart and lung problems 
1638 Last April she fractured her left collar bone 
1639 But her increasing frailty arthritis and failing eyesight has not stopped her travels around the world to mingle with the poor and desperate 
1640 Mother Teresa was born Agnes Goinxha Bejaxhiu to Albanian parents in Skopje in what was then Serbia on August 27 1910 
1641 She attended a government school and was already deeply religious by the time she was 12 
1642 At the age of 18 she became a Loretto nun hoping to work at the Order 's Calcutta mission 
1643 She was sent to Loretto Abbey in Dublin and from there to India to begin her novitiate and teach geography at a convent school in Calcutta 
1644 She said her divine call to work among the poor came in September 1946 
1645 The message was quite clear she told one interviewer 
1646 I was to leave the convent and help the poor while living among them 
1647 It was an order 
1648 I knew where I belonged 
1649 The Vatican and the mother superior in Dublin approved and after intensive training as a nurse with American missionaries she opened her first Calcutta slum school in December 1949 
1650 She took the name of Teresa after France 's Saint Therese of the Child Jesus 
1651 In India she was simply called Mother 
1652 Mother Teresa set up her first home for the dying in a Hindu rest house in Calcutta after she saw a penniless woman turned away by a city hospital 
1653 Named Nirmal Hriday Tender Heart it was the first of a chain of 150 homes for dying destitute people admitting nearly 18,000 a year 
1654 Her Missionaries of Charity a Roman Catholic religious order she founded in 1949 now runs about 300 homes for unwanted children and the destitute in India and abroad 
1655 In 1994 a British television documentary called the myth around Mother Teresa a mixture of hyperbole and credulity 
1656 Catholics around the world rose to her defence 
1657 RTRS FOCUS-News forecasts alien-led profit boost 
1658 Bernard Hickey 
1659 SYDNEY 1996-08-22 
1660 Media baron Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp Ltd reported lower than expected 1995/96 profits on Thursday but forecast that the hit film Independence Day would help increase profits by at least 20 percent in 1996/97 
1661 From an earnings perspective the current fiscal year has begun with great promise due to the hit motion picture Independence Day News Corp said in a statement announcing its results for the year to June 30 1996 
1662 It said moderating paper prices and solid orders for advertising at its Fox Broadcasting television network in the United States would also help boost profits in the 1996/97 year 
1663 A budgeted profit increase of at least 20 percent for the full year currently appears very attainable News Corp said 
1664 The bullish comments for the coming year soothed analysts and most shareholders who were disappointed by the lower than expected profit for 1995/96 
1665 News announced pre-abnormals net profit for the year fell six percent to A$ 1.26 billion US$ 995 million and earnings per share dropped to 40 cents from 46 cents 
1666 Analysts had on average expected a pre-abnormals profit of A$ 1.343 billion 
1667 The year just gone was disappointing but the outlook for the current year looks good First Pacific media analyst Lachlan Drummond said 
1668 News Corp said strong performances in U.S. television and British newspapers were offset by lower profits from News Corp 's magazine and publishing divisions and further hefty losses from its Asian Star TV operations 
1669 Higher newsprint prices hit profits hard 
1670 Throughout the group higher paper prices increased costs by over US$ 300 million it said 
1671 News Corp said British newspaper operating profits rose 10 percent for the year as higher cover prices at The Sun and The Times and higher advertising volumes offset increased newsprint costs 
1672 Advertising revenues at The Times grew 20 percent 
1673 Analysts said sharply lower earnings from News Corp 's book publishing division and its U.S. magazines had been the major surprises in the results for 1995/96 
1674 News Corp said revenue gains at its magazines and inserts division were offset by higher paper prices and lower sales at the U.S. TV Guide 
1675 News said dramatically lower earnings from the British arm of its Harper-Collins publishing division more than offset healthy results from its U.S. operation 
1676 It said the demise of the Net Book Agreement had hurt the British operations and weak performances from the San Francisco unit of Harper-Collins had not helped 
1677 The minimum price setting expired last September when three publishers pulled out 
1678 But it was the bullish profit forecast for 1996/97 that took the spotlight in the market with some analysts saying 20 percent may even be an understatement 
1679 If they 're saying at least 20 percent then their internal forecasts are probably saying 25 or 30 percent said one Sydney media analyst who declined to be named 
1680 News Corp 's shares were down eight cents at A$ 6.39 at 2.00 p.m. 0400 GMT in a soft market 
1681 A$ 1 US$ 0.79 
1682 Sydney Newsroom 61-2 373-1800 
1683 RTRS Budget cuts to boost Australia savings RBA 
1684 CANBERRA 1996-08-22 
1685 The Australian government 's plans to slash its budget deficit should make a useful contribution to national savings the Reserve Bank of Australia RBA said in its annual report 
1686 The government 's announced plans to balance the budget if realised would make a useful contribution to raising national savings the RBA said 
1687 The bank said there were concerns fiscal consolidation would unduly restrict growth but evidence was ambiguous 
1688 In its 1996/97 budget announced on Tuesday the Australian Coalition government announced an underlying budget deficit of A$ 5.65 billion and pledged to return the underlying budget balance to surplus by 1998/99 
1689 The budget deficit was A$ 10.3 billion in 1995/96 
1690 Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800 
1691 Determined and credible efforts to rein in unsustainable fiscal positions are often rewarded by rising confidence giving favourable effects on economic activity even in the short term it said 
1692 More generally the long-term effects of fiscal consolidation are clearly positive with higher saving tending to promote economic growth by raising investment and lowering long-term real interest rates the RBA said

1706 WELLINGTON 1996-08-22

1713 Thais hunt for Australian jail breaker 
1714 BANGKOK 
1715 Thailand has launched a manhunt for an Australian who escaped from a high security prison in Bangkok while awaiting trial on drug possession charges officials said on Thursday 
1716 Daniel Westlake 46 from Victoria made the first sucessful escape from Klongprem prison in the northern outskirts of the capital on Sunday night 
1717 He was believed by prison officials to still be in Thailand 
1718 We have ordered a massive hunt for him and I am quite confident we will get him soon Vivit Chatuparisut deputy director general of the Correction Department told Reuters 
1719 Westlake arrested in December 1993 and charged with heroin trafficking sawed the iron grill off his cell window and climbed down the prison 's five-metre 15-foot wall on a rope made from bed sheets Vivit said 
1720 The corrections department was probing the escape and had ordered all foreign inmates chained to prevent more breakouts 
1721 There are 266 Westerners including six Australians in the prison most awaiting trial on drugs charges 
1722 There also are about 5,000 Thai inmates in Klongprem a prison official said

1744 Malaysia bans nitrofuran usage in chicken feed 
1745 KUALA LUMPUR 1996-08-22 
1746 Malaysia has banned the use of nitrofuran an antibiotic in chicken feed and veterinary applications because it believes the drug could cause cancer the health ministry said on Thursday 
1747 It is hoped that livestock breeders and feedmillers will abide by the laws and respect the cabinet decision in the interest of consumer safety Health Minister Chua Jui Meng was quoted as saying by the national Bernama news agency 
1748 Chua said offenders could face a two-year prison sentence and a maximum fine of 5,000 ringgit $ 2000 
1749 The ban takes effect immediately he added

1800 Ukraine hails peace as marks five-year independence 
1801 Rostislav Khotin 
1802 KIEV 1996-08-23 
1803 Ukraine celebrates five years of independence from Kremlin rule on Saturday hailing civil and inter-ethnic peace as its main post-Soviet achievement 
1804 Ukraine 's declaration of independence in 1991 backed nine-to-one by a referendum in December of that year effectively dealt a death blow to the Soviet empire and ended more than three centuries of rule from Moscow 
1805 Ukraine with a Russian community of 11 million people the world 's largest outside Russia has avoided conflicts like those in Russia 's Chechnya neighbouring Moldova and the former Soviet republics of Georgia Azerbaijan and Tajikistan 
1806 Ukraine 's biggest achievements for five years are the preservation of civil peace and inter-ethnic harmony President Leonid Kuchma said in televised statement this week 
1807 Unlike many other post-Soviet countries we were able to deal with conflict situations in a peaceful and civilised way 
1808 But independence was initially accompanied by hyper-inflation and economic collapse although there are signs of a turnaround 
1809 Inflation a hyper-inflationary 10,300 percent a year in 1993 was a respectable 0.1 percent a month in June and July and the economy has just begun to grow 
1810 Kuchma told a solemn ceremony at the Ukraina Palace on Friday that there was a turning point in reforms and that he expected a rise in the standard of living in the near future 
1811 There is no doubt that economic growth has already started said Adelbert Knobl head of the International Monetary Fund 's mission in Ukraine 
1812 The national bank and the government have every reason to be proud of their efforts 
1813 Central bank officials said on Thursday that a much-postponed hryvna currency would definitely be introduced before the end of this year 
1814 It will replace the interim karbovanets currency which was introduced at par to the Russian rouble in 1992 but now trades at almost 33 karbovanets per rouble 
1815 Ukraine has repeatedly promised to introduce the hryvna but had to postpone the plans because of economic problems 
1816 Proud of its record in promptly joining both the Council of Europe and NATO 's Partnership for Peace Ukraine caused a foreign policy wrangle this week offending China by allowing a Taiwanese minister to appear on a public if unofficial visit 
1817 China cancelled a visit by a top-level delegation in protest 
1818 Kiev 's Foreign Minister Hennady Udovenko said Beijing was overreacting 
1819 But Ukraine seeing itself as a bridge between Russia and the rapidly Westernising countries of eastern Europe is looking West as well as East 
1820 The strategic aim of European integration should not in any way damage Ukraine 's interests in post-Soviet areas 
1821 Relations with Russia which is our main partner have great importance Kuchma said 
1822 But Ukraine cannot be economically oriented on Russia even though those in some circles push us to do that 
1823 Kuchma has said Kiev wants membership of the European Union associate membership of the Western European Union defence grouping and to move closer to NATO 
1824 A message from the West this week from U.S. President Bill Clinton congratulated Ukraine on the anniversary promising to support market reforms and praising Ukraine as a stabilising factor in a united Europe 
1825 Oldest Albania book disappears from Vatican paper 
1826 TIRANA 1996-08-23 
1827 A 16th-century document the earliest complete example of written Albanian has disappeared from the Vatican archives an Albanian newspaper said on Friday 
1828 Gazeta Shqiptare said the Book of Mass by Gjon Buzuku dating from 1555 and discovered in 1740 in a religious seminary in Rome was the first major document published in the Albanian language 
1829 We Albanians sons of Buzuku believed our language had a written document but now we do not have it any more lamented scholar Musa Hamiti told of the loss by the Vatican library 
1830 Tirana 's national library has three copies of the Book of Mass 
1831 There is nothing left for us but to be grateful to civilisation for inventing photocopies Gazeta Shqiptare said 
1832 Russia to clamp down on barter deals 
1833 MOSCOW 1996-08-23 
1834 Russian officials keen to cut capital flight will adopt tight measures to cut barter deals in foreign trade to a minimum a customs official said on Friday 
1835 We have always been concerned about barter deals with other countries viewing them as a disguised kind of capital flight from Russia Marina Volkova deputy head of the currency department at the State Customs Committee told Reuters 
1836 Volkova said last year goods had been exported under many Russian barter deals with nothing imported in return 
1837 She said the cost of such unimported goods was $ 1.10 billion in 1995 
1838 Barter deals were worth $ 4.9 billion last year or about eight percent of all Russian exports estimated at $ 61.5 billion she said 
1839 The cost of exported goods is too often understated so the actual share of barter deals in Russian exports and the amount of unimported goods may be even higher Volkova said 
1840 A few days ago Russian President Boris Yeltsin issued a decree on state regulation of foreign barter deals and Volkova said this could substantially improve the situation 
1841 In line with the decree which will come into force on November 1 all Russian barter traders will be obliged to import goods worth the cost of their exports within 180 days 
1842 If traders are late they will have to pay fines worth the cost of their exported goods Volkova said 
1843 Understating the cost of exported goods could still be a loophole for barter dealers but Volkova said the authorities are currently tackling the technicalities of the issue 
1844 Barter has always been a feature of the Soviet Union 's foreign trade but Yeltsin 's decrees liberalising foreign trade in 1991-1992 has given barter a new impetus 
1845 A few years ago barter deals accounted for up to 25-30 percent of Russian exports because thousands of trade companies which popped up preferred barter in the absence of reliable Russian banks and money transfer systems Volkova said 
1846 Now many Russian banks are strong and can make various sorts of money tranfers while incompetent traders are being ousted by more experienced ones 
1847 But the current share of barter deals in Russian exports is still high she said 
1848 Dmitry Solovyov Moscow Newsroom +7095 941 8520 
1849 Viacom plans Mission sequel report 
1850 LOS ANGELES 1996-08-22 
1851 Paramount Pictures is going ahead with a sequel to the Tom Cruise blockbuster Mission Impossible and hopes to release it in the summer of 1998 Daily Variety reported in its Friday edition 
1852 The big-screen version of the spy TV series has grossed $ 175 million domestically since opening May 22 and $ 338 million overseas so far 
1853 It 's the biggest success for Viacom Inc-owned Paramount since 1994 's Forrest Gump 
1854 However many critics complained its plot was incomprehensible 
1855 Cruise will reprise his roles as star and co-producer and will soon meet Academy Award-winning screenwriter William Goldman who will write the script the report said 
1856 It said Mission Impossible director Brian De Palma would have first crack at the sequel though no deals have been made yet 
1857 Goldman whose Oscars were for Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid and All the President 's Men earlier this summer criticised some of the season 's blockbusters 
1858 However he singled out Mission Impossible as an especially entertaining movie Daily Variety said 
1859 CRICKET CRAWLEY FORCED TO SIT AND WAIT 
1860 LONDON 1996-08-23 
1861 England batsman John Crawley was forced to endure a frustrating delay of over three hours before resuming his quest for a maiden test century in the third test against Pakistan on Friday 
1862 Heavy overnight rain and morning drizzle ruled out any play before lunch on the second day but an improvement in the weather prompted the umpires to announce a 1415 local time 1315 GMT start in the event of no further rain 
1863 Crawley unbeaten on 94 overnight in an England total of 278 for six was spotted strumming a guitar in the dressing-room as the Oval ground staff took centre stage 
1864 There were several damp patches on the square and the outfield and it was still raining when the players took an early lunch at 1230 local time 1130 GMT 
1865 When brighter weather finally arrived the umpires announced a revised figure of 67 overs to be bowled with play extended to at least 1900 local time 1800 GMT

1940 CRICKET POLLOCK HOPES FOR RETURN TO WARWICKSHIRE 
1941 LONDON 1996-08-23 
1942 South African all-rounder Shaun Pollock forced to cut short his first season with Warwickshire to have ankle surgery has told the English county he would like to return later in his career 
1943 Pollock who returns home a month early next week said I would like to come back and play county cricket in the future and I do n't think I would like to swap counties 
1944 Explaining his premature departure was unavoidable Pollock said I have been carrying the injury for a while and I hope that by having the surgery now I will be able to last out the new season back home

1985 SOCCER SPONSORS CASH IN ON RAVANELLI 'S SHIRT DANCE 
1986 LONDON 1996-08-23 
1987 Middlesbrough 's Italian striker Fabrizio Ravanelli is to wear his team sponsor 's name on the inside of his shirt so it can be seen when he scores 
1988 Every time he finds the net the grey-haired forward pulls his shirtfront over his head as he runs to salute the fans and Middlesbrough 's sponsors want to cash in on the spectacle 
1989 Having seen Ravanelli celebrate his goals 
1990 we thought it would be fun to have the name on the inside of his shirt a spokesman for the sponsors said 
1991 It will give the fans something else to look at besides his chest 
1992 Ravanelli aggravated a foot injury in the 1-0 defeat at Chelsea on Wednesday and was given only an even chance of playing at Nottingham Forest on Saturday by his manager Bryan Robson 
1993 TENNIS AUSTRALIANS ADVANCE AT CANADIAN OPEN 
1994 TORONTO 1996-08-22 
1995 It was Australia Day at the $ 2 million Canadian Open on Thursday as three Aussies reached the quarter-finals with straight-set victories 
1996 Unseeded Patrick Rafter recorded the most noteworthy result as he upset sixth-seeded American MaliVai Washington 6-2 6-1 in just 50 minutes 
1997 Todd Woodbridge who defeated Canadian Daniel Nestor 7-6 7-2 7-6 7-4 and Mark Philippoussis a 6-3 6-4 winner over Bohdan Ulihrach of the Czech Republic also advanced and will meet in Friday 's quarter-finals 
1998 Third-seeded Wayne Ferreira of South Africa defeated Tim Henman of Britain 6-4 6-4 after a three-hour evening rain delay and fifth-seeded Thomas Enqvist of Sweden won his third-round match eliminating Petr Korda of the Czech Republic 6-3 6-4 
1999 Ferreira and Enqvist play in a Friday night quarter-final 
2000 Two Americans seventh seed Todd Martin and unseeded Alex O'Brien will meet on Friday after winning matches on Thursday 
2001 Martin overcame Cedric Pioline of France 2-6 6-2 6-4 and O'Brien beat Mikael Tillstrom of Sweden 6-3 2-6 6-3 
2002 If you really look at the match said the 12th-ranked Washington after losing to the 70th-ranked Rafter I never really got a chance to play because he was serving big and getting in close to the net 
2003 He was also able to handle my serve pretty easily because my first service percentage was only in the 40s 
2004 Put those two things together and you get a loss 
2005 Rafter missed 10 weeks after wrist surgery earlier this year and the time away from tennis has given him a new perspective 
2006 Before when I was on tour I always felt I had to be in bed by 9:30 or 10 o'clock and I had to be up at a certain time Rafter said 
2007 Now I can go to bed at at midnight or wake up at seven in the morning 
2008 I just do n't have as many set routines and it 's made me a happier person 
2009 Martin was pleased with his victory over Pioline his first in five meetings with the 11th-ranked Frenchman 
2010 It 's always difficult to win a match when you lose the first set especially against someone you have never beaten he said 
2011 I got more aggressive in the second and third sets and the wind picked up and that also affected things because Cedric definitely went off a little bit 
2012 The 26-year-old O'Brien who won the ATP Tour stop in New Haven last week has now won 18 of his last 20 matches dating back to qualifying rounds in Los Angeles in late July 
2013 He ranks 76th after being 285th four weeks ago 
2014 I feel I 'm hitting the ball well even though I 'm having more mental letdowns than I did last week O'Brien said 
2015 But I 'm still competing well 
2016 I got a lot of first serves in said Enqvist about his victory over Korda 
2017 I did n't miss that many shots and he was making the mistakes 
2018 Still marvelling at an exciting 64-stroke rally he won in the last game of his second-round match against Javier Sanchez of Spain on Tuesday Enqvist joked Today against Petr there were about 64 strokes in the whole match 
2019 It was mostly short points

2041 RUGBY UNION MULDER OUT OF SECOND TEST 
2042 JOHANNESBURG 1996-08-23 
2043 Centre Japie Mulder has been ruled out of South Africa 's team for the second test against New Zealand in Pretoria on Saturday 
2044 Mulder missed the first test in Durban with back spasms and failed a fitness check on Thursday 
2045 But new Springbok skipper Gary Teichmann has recovered from a bruised thigh and is ready to play coach Andre Markgraaff said 
2046 Mulder 's absence means that Northern Transvaal centre Andre Snyman should win his second cap alongside provincial colleague Danie van Schalkwyk 
2047 Wing Pieter Hendriks is expected to retain his place following speculation that Snyman would be picked out of position on the wing 
2048 The line-up would not be announced until shortly before the start Markgraaff said

2060 TENNIS INJURED CHANDA RUBIN OUT OF U.S. OPEN 
2061 NEW YORK 1996-08-23 
2062 Promising 10th-ranked American Chanda Rubin has pulled out of the U.S. Open Tennis Championships with a wrist injury tournament officials announced 
2063 The 20-year-old Rubin who was to be seeded 11th is still suffering from tendinitis of the right wrist that has kept her sidelined in recent months 
2064 Rubin 's misfortune turned into a very lucky break for eighth-seeded Olympic champion Lindsay Davenport 
2065 Davenport had drawn one of the toughest first-round assignments of any of the seeded players in 17th-ranked Karina Habsudova of Slovakia 
2066 But as the highest-ranked non-seeded player in the tournament Habsudova will be moved into Rubin 's slot in the draw while Davenport will now get a qualifier in the first round according to U.S. Tennis Association officials 
2067 Rubin is the third notable withdrawal from the women 's competition after 12th-ranked former Australian Open champion Mary Pierce and 20th-ranked Wimbledon semifinalist Meredith McGrath pulled out earlier this week with injuries 
2068 Men 's Australian Open champion Boris Becker will also miss the year 's final Grand Slam with a wrist injury

2145 BASEBALL SORRENTO HITS SLAM AS SEATTLE ROUTS ORIOLES 
2146 BALTIMORE 1996-08-22 
2147 Former Oriole Jamie Moyer allowed two hits over eight scoreless innings before tiring in the ninth and Paul Sorrento added his third grand slam of the season as the Seattle Mariners routed Baltimore 10-3 Thursday 
2148 Moyer 10-2 who was tagged for a pair of homers by Mike Devereaux and Brady Anderson and three runs in the ninth walked none and struck out two 
2149 Norm Charlton retired the final three batters to seal the victory 
2150 With one out in the fifth Ken Griffey Jr and Edgar Martinez stroked back-to-back singles off Orioles starter Rocky Coppinger 7-5 and Jay Buhner walked 
2151 Sorrento followed by hitting a 1-2 pitch just over the right-field wall for a 7-0 advantage 
2152 Right fielder Bobby Bonilla was after the ball which was touched by fans at the top of the scoreboard in right 
2153 Things fell in for us said Sorrento who has six career grand slams and hit the ninth of the season for the Mariners 
2154 We have over a month left 
2155 We 've got to make up some ground 
2156 In the American League wild-card race the Mariners are three games behind the White Sox two behind Baltimore and two ahead of the Red Sox heading into Boston for a weekend series 
2157 Moyer retired 11 straight batters between the third and seventh innings and threw two or fewer pitches to 11 of the 29 batters he faced 
2158 I made some bad pitches at the end but I 'm not going to dwell on it 
2159 We won the game said Moyer 
2160 Coppinger 7-5 was tagged for eight runs and 10 hits in 4 1/3 innings 
2161 Orioles manager Davey Johnson missed the game after being admitted to a hospital with an irregular heartbeat 
2162 Bench coach Andy Etchebarren took his place 
2163 In Boston Troy O'Leary homered off the right-field foul pole with one out in the bottom of the ninth and the Red Sox climbed to the .500 mark for the first time this season with their fourth straight victory 2-1 over the Oakland Athletics 
2164 Boston has won 15 of its last 19 games 
2165 Boston 's Roger Clemens 7-11 was one out away from his second straight shutout when pinch-hitter Matt Stairs tripled over the head of centre fielder Lee Tinsley on an 0-2 pitch and pinch-hitter Terry Steinbach dunked a broken-bat single into right to lift Oakland into a 1-1 tie 
2166 The run broke Clemens 28-inning shutout streak longest in the majors this season 
2167 He pitched his fourth complete game allowing eight hits with two walks and 11 strikeouts 
2168 Reliever Mark Acre 0-1 took the loss 
2169 In New York Garret Anderson and Gary DiSarcina drove in two runs apiece in a five-run first inning and Jim Edmonds highlighted a six-run sixth with a bases-loaded double as the California Angels coasted to a 12-3 victory over the Yankees in the rubber game of their three-game series 
2170 The Angels battered Kenny Rogers 10-7 for five runs in the first 
2171 The Yankees have allowed at least two runs in the first inning in six straight games getting outscored 21-1 in the first inning in that span 
2172 Chuck Finley 12-12 snapped a four-game losing streak 
2173 In Kansas City Travis Fryman doubled in the go-ahead run in the fifth and Melvin Nieves and Damion Easley belted two-run homers as the Detroit Tigers claimed a 10-3 win over the Royals handing them their fifth straight loss 
2174 The Tigers won their third straight and halted a seven-game road losing streak behind Justin Thompson 1-2 who earned his first major-league win 
2175 Tim Belcher 12-8 was tagged for six runs and nine hits in eight innings 
2176 At Minnesota Ken Hill allowed two runs en route to his sixth complete game of the season and Rusty Greer added three hits including a homer and two RBI as the red-hot Texas Rangers routed the Twins 11-2 
2177 The Rangers who won for the 11th time in their last 13 games have scored 45 runs in their last five contests 
2178 Hill 14-7 allowed 10 hits 
2179 He has yielded just seven runs in his last four starts covering 33 1/3 innings 
2180 In Chicago Erik Hanson outdueled Alex Fernandez and Jacob Brumfield drove in Otis Nixon with the game 's only run in the sixth inning as the Toronto Blue Jays blanked the White Sox 1-0 in a game shortened to six innings due to rain 
2181 Toronto won its fifth straight and handed the White Sox their seventh loss in nine games 
2182 Hanson 11-15 allowed three hits walked three and struck out four to snap a personal three-game losing streak 
2183 Fernandez 12-8 scattered six hits 
2184 SOCCER SPORTING START NEW SEASON WITH A WIN 
2185 LISBON 1996-08-23 
2186 Sporting 's Luis Miguel Predrosa scored the first goal of the new league season as the Lisbon side cruised to a 3-1 away win over SC Espinho on Friday 
2187 Predrosa drilled a right-foot shot into the back of the net after 24 minutes to set Sporting on the way to victory 
2188 Although Espinho 's Nail Besirovic put the home side back on terms in the 35th minute Sporting quickly restored their lead 
2189 Jose Luis Vidigal scored in the 38th minute and Mustapha Hadji added the third in the 57th 
2190 The game was brought forward from Sunday when reigning champions Porto and Lisbon rivals Benfica play their first games of the season

2196 SOCCER ST PAULI TAKE POINT WITH LATE FIGHTBACK 
2197 BONN 1996-08-23 
2198 Hamburg side St Pauli tipped as prime candidates for relegation produced a stunning second-half fightback to draw 4-4 in their Bundesliga clash with Schalke on Friday 
2199 Schalke who finished third last season raced to a 3-1 lead at halftime 
2200 St Pauli pulled a goal back through Andre Trulsen but Schalke striker Martin Max restored his team 's two-goal cushion shortly afterwards 
2201 Christian Springer put St Pauli back in touch in the 64th minute and three minutes later they were level thanks to a penalty from Thomas Sabotzik 
2202 In the night 's only other match Hamburg beat Hansa Rostock 1-0 Karsten Baeron scoring the winner after some dazzling build-up from in-form midfielder Harald Spoerl 
2203 The win put Hamburg in second place in the German first division after three games though that may change after the other sides play on Saturday 
2204 ATHLETICS SALAH HISSOU BREAKS 10,000 METRES WORLD RECORD 
2205 BRUSSELS 1996-08-23 
2206 Morocco 's Salah Hissou broke the men 's 10,000 metres world record on Friday when he clocked 26 minutes 38.08 seconds at the Brussels grand prix on Friday 
2207 The previous mark of 26:43.53 was set by Ethiopia 's Haile Gebreselassie in the Dutch town of Hengelo in June last year

2232 ATHLETICS MASTERKOVA BREAKS SECOND WORLD RECORD IN 10 DAYS 
2233 Adrian Warner 
2234 BRUSSELS 1996-08-23 
2235 Russia 's double Olympic champion Svetlana Masterkova smashed her second world record in just 10 days on Friday when she bettered the mark for the women 's 1,000 metres 
2236 After breaking the world record for the women 's mile in Zurich last Wednesday the Olympic 800 and 1,500 metres champion clocked two minutes 28.98 seconds over 1,000 at the Brussels grand prix meeting 
2237 The Russian ate up the ground in a swift last lap to shave 0.36 seconds off the previous best of 2:29.34 set by Mozambique 's Maria Mutola in the same stadium in August last year 
2238 Former world 800 champion Mutola pushed Masterkova all the way finishing second in 2:29.66 
2239 But it was the Russian who picked up the bonus of $ 25,000 for the historic run in front of a capacity 40,000 crowd 
2240 Masterkova dominated the middle-distance races at the recent Atlanta Games following her return to competition this season after a three-year maternity break 
2241 In her first mile race at the richest meeting in Zurich last Wednesday she slashed 3.05 seconds off the previous record 
2242 The record of four minutes 12.56 seconds in Zurich earned Masterkova a bonus of $ 50,000 plus one kilo of gold 
2243 After Friday 's performance the Russian will have earned well over $ 100,000 in less than a fortnight taking her appearance money into account 
2244 Brussels organisers had laid a new track for the meeting comparable to the surface at the Atlanta Games but put down on a softer surface 
2245 Masterkova clearly enjoyed it 
2246 Mutola looked threatening in the final 200 metres but the Russian found an extra gear to power home several strides ahead pointing at the time on the clock with delight as she crossed the line 
2247 ATHLETICS WOMEN 'S 1,000 METRES WORLD RECORD EVOLUTION 
2248 BRUSSELS 1996-08-23 
2249 Evolution of the women 's 1,000 
2250 metres world record tabulated under time name nationality 
2251 venue date 
2252 2:30.67 Christine Wachtel Germany Berlin 17.8.90 
2253 2:29.34 Maria Mutola Mozambique Brussels 25.8.95 
2254 2:28.98 Svetlana Masterkova Russia Brussels 23.8.96 
2255 ATHLETICS MASTERKOVA BREAKS WOMEN 'S WORLD 1,000 RECORD 
2256 BRUSSELS 1996-08-23 
2257 Russian Svetlana Masterkova broke the women 's world 1,000 metres record on Friday when she clocked an unofficial two minutes 28.99 seconds at the Brussels grand prix 
2258 The previous mark of 2:29.34 was set by Mozambique 's Maria Mutola here on August 25 last year 
2259 The time was officially adjusted to 2:28.98 
2260 GOLF GERMAN OPEN SECOND ROUND SCORES

2285 ATHLETICS MITCHELL UPSTAGES TRIO OF OLYMPIC SPRINT CHAMPIONS 
2286 Adrian Warner 
2287 BRUSSELS 1996-08-23 
2288 American Dennis Mitchell upstaged a trio of past and present Olympic 100 metres champions on Friday with a storming victory at the Brussels grand prix 
2289 Sporting his customary bright green outfit the U.S. champion clocked 10.03 seconds despite damp conditions to take the scalp of Canada 's reigning Olympic champion Donovan Bailey 1992 champion Linford Christie of Britain and American 1984 and 1988 champion Carl Lewis 
2290 Mitchell also beat world and Olympic champion Bailey at the most lucrative meeting in the sport in Zurich last week 
2291 The American who finished fourth at the Atlanta Games was fast out of his blocks and held off Bailey 's late burst in the final 20 metres before heading off for a lap of celebration 
2292 The Canadian was second in 10.09 with Lewis third in 10.10 ahead of Atlanta bronze medallist Ato Boldon who clocked 10.12 in fourth 
2293 Christie competing in what is expected to be his last major international meeting finished fifth in 10.14 
2294 Lewis making a rare appearance in Europe in a sprint race left the track with a slight limp 
2295 American Olympic high hurdles champion Allen Johnson defied the wet conditions to produce a brilliant 12.92 seconds in the 110 metres race just 0.01 outside the world record held by Britain 's Colin Jackson 
2296 Johnson ran the same time at the U.S. Olympic trials in Atlanta in June to become the second equal fastest hurdler of all time with American Roger Kingdom 
2297 He seemed to relish the new track at the Brussels meeting dominating the race from start to finish with a slight wind at his back 
2298 Jackson the only man to have run faster could not live with his speed taking second in 13.24 seconds 
2299 The rain was pelting down when the women 's high hurdlers stepped up for their 100 metres race 
2300 But Sweden 's Olympic high hurdles champion Ludmila Engquist who crashed out of last week 's meeting in Zurich after hitting a hurdle also kept her footing perfectly to win in a fast 12.60 seconds 
2301 Olympic silver medallist Brigita Bukovec of Slovenia could finish only fifth in the race in 12.95 
2302 Jamaican Commonwealth champion Michelle Freeman took second in 12.77 ahead of Cuban Aliuska Lopez 
2303 The Zurich fall cost Engquist a shot at a jackpot of 20 one-kg gold bars which can be won by athletes who clinch their events at all of the Golden Four series in Oslo Zurich Brussels and Berlin 
2304 Seven athletes went into Friday 's penultimate meeting of the series with a chance of winning the prize and American men 's 400 metres hurdles champion Derrick Adkins kept his hopes alive in the competition by winning his event in 47.93 
2305 American Olympic champion Gail Devers clocked a swift 10.84 seconds on her way to victory in the women 's 100 metres the second fastest time of the season and 0.10 seconds faster than her winning time in Atlanta 
2306 Jamaican veteran Merlene Ottey who beat Devers in Zurich after just missing out on the gold medal in Atlanta after a photo finish had to settle for third place in 11.04 
2307 American world champion Gwen Torrence the bronze medallist in Atlanta was second in 11.00 
2308 It was a costly defeat for Ottey since it threw her out of the race for the Golden Four jackpot

2506 SOCCER JORGE CALLS UP SIX PORTO PLAYERS FOR WORLD CUP QUALIFIER 
2507 LISBON 1996-08-23 
2508 Portugal 's new coach Artur Jorge called up six players from league champions Porto on Friday in an 18-man squad for the opening World Cup qualifier against Armenia on August 31 
2509 Midfielder Paulo Sousa recently transferred to Borussia Dortmund from Italy 's Juventus is the only leading member of the Portuguese side from this year 's European championships who will not make the trip 
2510 It will be Jorge 's first game in charge of the national squad since taking over from Antonio Oliveira who now coaches Porto at the end of Euro 96 
2511 Squad 
2512 Goalkeepers Vitor Baia Rui Correia 
2513 Defenders Jorge Costa Paulinho Santos Helder Cristovao Carlos Secretario Dimas Teixeira Fernando Couto 
2514 Midfielders Jose Barroso Luis Figo Rui Barros Rui Costa Oceano Cruz Ricardo Sa Pinto 
2515 Forwards Domingos Oliveira Joao Vieira Pinto Jorge Cadete Antonio Folha 
2516 SOCCER VOGTS KEEPS FAITH WITH EURO 96 CHAMPIONS 
2517 BONN 1996-08-23 
2518 Trainer Berti Vogts kept faith with his entire European championship winning squad for Germany 's first match since their title victory a friendly in Poland 
2519 Vogts picked no new players for the squad for the September 4 game in Zabrze 
2520 Instead on Friday he nominated all 23 Euro 96 veterans including Bremen 's Jens Todt called up before the final by special UEFA dispensation 
2521 He will however have to do without the Dortmund trio of libero Matthias Sammer midfielder Steffen Freund and defender Rene Schneider who were all formally nominated despite being injured 
2522 This squad is currently the basis of my planning for the 1998 World Cup Vogts said 
2523 We 'll have to see which other players produce good league performances to play themselves into the squad 
2524 Squad

2544 CRICKET SRI LANKA AND AUSTRALIA SAY RELATIONS HAVE HEALED 
2545 COLOMBO 1996-08-23 
2546 Sri Lanka and Australia agreed on Friday that relations between the two teams had healed since the Sri Lankans acrimonious tour last year 
2547 The Sri Lankans were first found guilty then cleared of ball tampering and off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan was called for throwing during a controversial three-test series in Australia 
2548 Our concern is to get out there and play proper cricket Sri Lanka captain Arjuna Ranatunga told a news conference on the eve of a warmup match between the World Cup champions and a World XI team scheduled for Saturday 
2549 What happened is history 
2550 Australian team manager Cam Battersby said he agreed with Ranatunga 
2551 I believe relations between the two teams will be excellent Batterby said 
2552 The Australians are making their first visit to the Indian Ocean island since boycotting a World Cup fixture in February after a terrorist bomb in Colombo 
2553 Australia have been promised the presence of commandos sniffer dogs and plainclothes policemen to ensure a limited overs tournament is trouble-free 
2554 The tournament starting on August 26 also includes India and Zimbabwe 
2555 Battersby said he was satisfied with the security arrangements 
2556 Sri Lankan officials said they expected heavy rain which washed out a warmup match on Friday should cease by Saturday 
2557 Australia led by wicketkeeper Ian Healy opened their short tour of Sri Lanka with a five-run win over the country 's youth team on Thursday 
2558 PRESS DIGEST ANGOLA AUG 23 
2559 LUANDA 1996-08-23 
2560 These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Friday 
2561 Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy 
2562 JORNAL DE ANGOLA 
2563 The Angolan Chief of State addressed a letter to UN Security Council proposing dates for the conclusion of the peace process in Angola 
2564 He proposed definite dates August 25 for return of Unita generals to the joint army September 5 for the beginning of the formation of the Government of National Unity and Reconciliation 
2565 Until this date the free circulation of peoples and goods should be guaranteed the government administration installed in all areas and the Unita deputies should occupy their places in the National Assembly 
2566 The president justified his proposal by the delays verified in the peace process including the fact that areas under Unita control or occupation have not been effectively demilitarised where the Unita military forces have been substituted by their so-called police 
2567 President Dos Santos proposes the establishment by UN Security Council of definitive and final timetable for the tasks and obligations under the Lusaka Agreement and the sending of a mission of SC as soon as possible to supervise the execution of the agreement

2606 Nigerian terms jeopardize Commonwealth trip-Canada 
2607 OTTAWA 1996-08-23 
2608 Commonwealth ministers concerned about human rights in Nigeria may cancel a planned trip there because of government restrictions on their mission Canadian Foreign Minister Lloyd Axworthy said on Friday 
2609 The reaction of the regime there is such that many of us feel that the mission under the present circumstances should n't go ahead Axworthy said 
2610 Commonwealth foreign ministers will meet in London on Wednesday to discuss what to do he added 
2611 Mid-tier golds up in heavy trading 
2612 TORONTO 1996-08-23 
2613 Investors gave into gold fever Friday morning with heavy trading in a handful of Toronto-based gold companies 
2614 TVX Gold Inc was up C$ 0.30 to C$ 11.55 in trading of 780,000 shares while Kinross Gold Corp gained C$ 0.25 to C$ 11 in volume of 720,000 shares 
2615 And Scorpion Minerals Inc a junior gold exploration company with five Indonesian mining properties was up C$ 0.50 to C$ 6 with about 120,000 shares changing hands 
2616 TVX and Kinross rose after recent buy recommendations from U.S. brokers analysts said 
2617 But Scorpion was raising a lot of eyebrows after it issued a release Friday morning saying it was not aware of any developments that could have affected the stock 
2618 The company was formed this year and a couple of analysts have been on their properties said one analyst 
2619 Exploration results are expected soon 
2620 Reuters Toronto Bureau 416 941-8100 
2621 RESEARCH ALERT Unitog Co upgraded 
2622 Barrington Research Associates Inc said Friday it upgraded Unitog Co to a near-term outperform from a long-term outperform rating 
2623 Analyst Alexander Paris said he expected consistent 20 percent earnings growth after an estimated gain of 18 percent for 1996 
2624 The stock closed unchanged at 27 down from a recent high of 30 
2625 Chicago newsdesk 312-408-8787 
2626 Buffett raises Property Capital stake 
2627 WASHINGTON 1996-08-23 
2628 Omaha billionaire Warren Buffett said Friday he raised his stake in Property Capital Trust to 8.0 percent from 6.7 percent 
2629 In a filing with the Securities and Exchnage Commission Buffett said he bought 62,900 additional common shares of the Boston-based real estate investment trust at prices ranging from $ 7.65 to $ 8.02 a share 
2630 The purchases increased his holding in the company to 725,900 shares which was purchased for a total of $ 6.2 million he said 
2631 Buffett who is well-known as a long-term investor is chairman of Berkshire Hathaway Inc a holding company through which he holds investments in several large U.S. companies 
2632 Colombia U.S. reach aviation agreement 
2633 MIAMI 1996-08-23 
2634 The U.S. and Colombian governments reached an agreement that will allow AMR Corp 's American Airlines to operate three round-trip flights between New York and Bogota the Department of Transportation said Friday 
2635 Under the agreement which followed talks in Miami this week AMR also will be allowed to shift up to four of the weekly flights it now operates between Miami and Colombia to its New York gateway 
2636 The United States also will be able to designate one new all-cargo carrier for service between the two nations after two years 
2637 Colombia was permitted to add a single additional round-trip flight to its current New York service although it will not be able to do so while under Category Two Conditional status under the Federal Aviation Administration 's International Aviation Safety program 
2638 Colombia would be allowed to add new service when its safety assessment has been improved the department said 
2639 With the exception of the new services just agreed to the governments of the two nations have agreed to maintain their current level of routes and airlines for the next 2-1/2 years the agreement said 
2640 The agreement resolved a dispute that arose in June when Colombia turned down American 's request to operate flights between New York and Bogota a denial that prompted the United States to charge that the Colombians were breaking a bilateral aviation agreement and to propose sanctions against one of two Colombian airlines Avianca and ACES

2679 RTRS Golf Norman sacks his coach after disappointing season 
2680 SYDNEY 1996-08-23 
2681 World number one golfer Greg Norman has sacked his coach Butch Harmon after a disappointing season 
2682 Butch and I are finished Norman told reporters on Thursday before the start of the World Series of Golf in Akron Ohio 
2683 Norman a two-time British Open champion parted ways with his long-time mentor after drawing a blank in this year 's four majors winning two tournaments worldwide 
2684 The blonde Australian opened with a level par round of 70 in Akron leaving him four shots adrift of the leaders Americans Billy Mayfair and Paul Goydos and Japan 's Hidemichi Tanaki 
2685 On Wednesday Norman described this year as his worst on the professional circuit since 1991 when he failed to win a tournament 
2686 My application this year has been strange Norman said 
2687 Maybe I have n't been as keyed up as I should have been 
2688 Sometimes you do n't have it in your head to play 
2689 Maybe this was one of those years where I was there but I was n't 100 percent there and you have to be 100 percent to perform he said 
2690 Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800 
2691 Soccer Arab team breaks new ground in Israel 
2692 Ori Lewis 
2693 TAIBE Israel 1996-08-23 
2694 For the first time in Israeli history an Arab team will take the field when the National League soccer season starts on Saturday 
2695 Hapoel Taibe fields four Jewish players and two foreign imports a Pole and a Romanian 
2696 The rest of the side is made up mainly of Moslem Arabs 
2697 The club founded in 1961 has a loyal following in Taibe an Arab town of 28,000 in the heart of Israel 
2698 But away from their home ground they face unfriendly crowds who taunt the players with racist abuse 
2699 The very first thing we thought about after we knew we would be promoted was the game against Betar Jerusalem said Taibe supporter Karem Haj Yihye 
2700 Two weeks ago Taibe coached by Pole Wojtek Lazarek met Betar a club closely associated with the right-wing Likud party for the first time in a Cup match in Jerusalem 
2701 Chants from the crowd of Death to the Arabs and bottle-throwing during the game marred the match which ended in a goalless draw 
2702 One Taibe supporter required hospital treatment for cuts and bruises after a stone struck his head as he was driving from the stadium 
2703 We 're used to hearing the taunts of Death to the Arabs said Sameh Haj Yihye a Taibe resident who studies at Jerusalem 's Hebrew University 
2704 But we know that these are only words nobody has died from hearing them and it only makes us support our team more vehemently 
2705 The dusty town of Taibe lacks the amenities of Jewish communities and many Israeli Arabs have long complained of state discrimination 
2706 There are no parks or empty areas of land around here so when we want to play a friendly game of soccer we all load up in the car and travel to Tel Aviv 60 km 36 miles away Sameh Haj Yihye said 
2707 The town 's ramshackle 2,500-seat ground is accessible only by two dirt tracks 
2708 We plan to build a 10,000-seat stadium but it may well be situated elsewhere said club chairman Abdul Rahman Haj Yihye 
2709 We will discuss this with the mayor and hopefully a new or refurbished ground will be completed by the start of the new year 
2710 In the meantime Taibe will play all their heavily policed home matches at the Jewish coastal town of Netanya 
2711 We are Israelis there is no question about that said Karem Haj Yihye a hotel waiter 
2712 We do n't have any connection with the Palestinians they live over there he said pointing to the West Bank seven km four miles to the east 
2713 We do n't feel our club represents Palestinian Arabs said club chairman Abdul Rahman 
2714 We are trying to do all we can to run a professional outfit we are pleased at any support we get but do not go out looking to represent the whole Arab world

2724 The draw made on Friday pitted Juventus who beat Dutch champions Ajax Amsterdam 4-2 on penalties in last year 's final against Alex Ferguson 's European hopefuls in group C 
2725 The other two teams in the group are last season 's Cup Winners Cup runners-up Rapid Vienna and Fenerbahce of Turkey 
2726 Juventus meet United in Turin on September 11 with the return match at Old Trafford on November 20 
2727 United have dominated the premier league in the 1990s winning three English championships in four years but have consistently failed in Europe crashing out of the European Cup to Galatasaray of Turkey and Spain 's Barcelona at their last two attempts 
2728 They have not lifted a European Trophy since 1991 when they beat Barcelona in the Cup Winners Cup final and their one and only European Cup triumph was way back in 1968 when they beat Benfica of Portugal 4-1 at Wembley 
2729 Juventus have won the European Cup twice 
2730 Before conquering Ajax last year they beat United 's big English rivals Liverpool in the ill-fated 1985 final in the Heysel stadium in Brussels

2740 Orthodox church blown up in southern Croatia 
2741 ZAGREB 1996-08-23 
2742 Saboteurs blew up a Serb orthodox church in southern Croatia on Friday with a blast which also damaged four nearby homes the state news agency Hina reported 
2743 HINA said the church in the small village of Karin Gornji 30 km 19 miles north of Zadar was destroyed by the morning attack 
2744 It did not report any casualties 
2745 Zadar police said in a statement they had launched an investigation and were doing their best to find the perpetrators 
2746 HINA said it was the first time an orthodox church had been blown up in the Zadar hinterland where a large number of Serbs lived before the 1991 war over Croatia 's independence from the Yugoslav federation 
2747 The area was part of the self-styled state of Krajina proclaimed by minority Serbs in 1991 and recaptured by the Croatian army last year 
2748 Up to 200,000 Serbs fled to Bosnia and Yugoslavia leaving Krajina vacant and depopulated

2766 Russians Chechens say observing Grozny ceasefire 
2767 GROZNY Russia 1996-08-23 
2768 Rebel fighters and Russian soldiers said a ceasefire effective at noon 0800 GMT on Friday was being generally observed although scattered gunfire echoed through the Chechen capital Grozny 
2769 The Russian army said earlier it was preparing to withdraw from the rebel-dominated southern mountains of the region as part of the peace deal reached with separatists on Thursday 
2770 There has been some shooting from their side but it has been relatively quiet said fighter Aslan Shabazov a bearded man wearing a white t-shirt and camoflage trousers 
2771 Soon after he spoke another burst of gunfire rocked the courtyard where the rebels had set up their base and a captured Russian T-72 tank roared out to investigate 
2772 The separatists who swept into Grozny on August 6 still control large areas of the centre of town and Russian soldiers are based at checkpoints on the approach roads 
2773 The ceasefire is being observed said woman soldier Svetlana Goncharova 35 short dark hair poking out from under a peaked camouflage cap 
2774 A few helicopters flew overhead firing off flares but there was no shooting from the air 
2775 The truce the latest of several was agreed in talks on Thursday between Russian peacemaker Alexander Lebed and rebel chief-of-staff Aslan Maskhadov 
2776 The two also agreed to set up joint patrols in Grozny but Goncharova said she was sceptical about whether this could work 
2777 We have to try it but I doubt if this is possible with the separatists she said

2782 Granic arrives to sign Croatia-Yugoslavia treaty 
2783 BELGRADE 1996-08-23 
2784 Yugoslavia and Croatia were poised on Friday to sign a landmark normalisation treaty ending five years of tensions and paving way for stabilisation in the Balkans 
2785 Croatian Foreign Minister Mate Granic landed at Belgrade airport aboard a Croatian government jet on Friday morning for talks with his Yugoslav counterparts and a signing ceremony expected around noon 1000 GMT 
2786 On Thursday the Yugoslav government endorsed the text of the agreement on normalising relations between the two countries the Yugoslav news agency Tanjug said 
2787 The government assessed the agreement as a crucial step to resolving the Yugoslav crisis ensuring the restoration of peace in former Yugoslavia it said 
2788 Last-minute talks this week on the legal fine print finally cleared the way for a treaty based on mutual recognition within internationally recognised borders and the establishment of diplomatic relations diplomats said 
2789 The pact ends five years of hostility after Croatia 's secession from federal Yugoslavia 
2790 Western powers regard diplomatic normalisation between Croatia and Serbia twin pillars of the old multinational federal Yugoslavia as a crucial step towards a lasting peace in the Balkans

2799 Brazil to use hovercrafts for Amazon travel 
2800 BRASILIA 1996-08-22 
2801 Hovercrafts will soon be plying the waters of the Amazon in a bid to reduce the difficulties of transportation on the vast Brazilian waterway the government said on Thursday 
2802 Two Russian-built hovercrafts capable of carrying up to 50 tons each will begin ferrying passengers and cargo up and down the huge river from its mouth at Belem by the end of the year Brazil 's Amazon Affairs Department said in a statement 
2803 The use of riverways in the region has been made a priority under a government plan for the Amazon and the high-speed hovercraft will help reduce the time involved in travelling often massive distances it said

2809 Jordan expels Iraqi diplomat after bread riots 
2810 Rana Sabbagh 
2811 AMMAN 1996-08-23 
2812 Jordan which has blamed Iraq for bread riots last week has asked an Iraqi diplomat to leave official and diplomatic sources said on Friday 
2813 The main Friday prayers in southern Jordan that were the starting point for the riots a week ago passed peacefully under tight security imposed by the army with only brief demonstrations reported 
2814 Adel Ibrahim the Iraqi embassy 's press attache was asked to leave because he was carrying out duties incompatible with diplomatic norms one source told Reuters implying he was accused of spying 
2815 Ibrahim told Reuters by telephone from his embassy office in Amman that he had not been notified of any explusion order 
2816 The government declined official comment 
2817 Ibrahim 's assistant Hussein Khalaf was expelled earlier this year for similar reasons amid rising tension in bilateral ties after King Hussein began calling for change in Baghdad following top Iraqi defections in August 1995 
2818 Iraq retaliated then by expelling a junior administrator working in the Jordanian embassy in Baghdad but has continued its policy of trying to avoid public conflicts with Jordan its only secure route to the rest of the world 
2819 Jordan has accused Iraq and a local pro-Baghdad party for the country 's worst unrest in seven years which erupted after it almost doubled the prices of bread last week under radical economic reforms agreed with the International Monetary Fund 
2820 In Karak where two days of riots flared last Friday a few hundred young men lingered outside Omari mosque on leaving shouting slogans for about 15 minutes 
2821 Disperse abstain from forming groups and help maintain order army officers who has enforced a loose curfew since the riots told the crowd through loudspeakers 
2822 The men shouted Allahu Akbar God is Greatest as a former Islamist deputy Ahmed Kafawin told soldiers the crowd would not cause trouble 
2823 He had earlier mounted the mosque 's pulpit to demand release of detainees an end to raids on houses and the cancelling of the bread price rises 
2824 Armoured cars had patrolled streets in Karak traditional bastion of communist ideology and Baath socialism that swept the region in the 1950s and guarded entrances to the hill-top city famed for its Crusader castle before the prayers 
2825 There was also heavy security in the crowded centre of Amman where smaller clashes had erupted last Saturday but Friday prayers at the main mosque ended quietly as police in full riot gear looked on 
2826 The Jordanian Arab Socialist Baath Party which has one deputy in the 80-seat lower house of parliament has denied involvement in unrest which it blamed on government policies and rising economic hardship 
2827 Government attempts to link the rioting to foreign influence has been treated with derision by those in the streets who blame the protests on severe economic hardships

2829 ANKARA 1996-08-23 
2830 Turkish troops have killed 17 Kurdish rebels in recent clashes in the southeast of the country the state-run Anatolian news agency said on Friday 
2831 Two security officials and two state-paid village guards were killed in the fighting with Kurdistan Workers Party PKK guerrillas the agency quoted the emergency rule governor 's office as saying 
2832 Eight of the rebels were killed in Van province five in Sirnak and four in Hakkari 
2833 The agency did not say when the clashes took place 
2834 More than 20,000 people have died in the PKK 's 12-year-old fight for independence or autonomy in southeastern Turkey 
2835 Three people including two village guards died when a mine planted by PKK rebels exploded on a road in the southeast Anatolian reported earlier 
2836 It said a taxi carrying the guards members of a mostly Kurdish militia which fights the PKK hit the mine in the province of Diyarbakir 
2837 U.S. says Iraqi Kurds agree ceasefire 
2838 WASHINGTON 1996-08-23 
2839 Leaders of Iraq 's two main Kurdish factions agreed on Friday to end six days of fighting and to attend U.S.-mediated peace talks next month the State Department said 
2840 Spokesman Glyn Davies said in a statement that the agreement followed direct U.S. contacts with Massoud Barzani leader of the Kurdistan Democratic Party KDP and Jalal Talabani leader of the Patriotic Union of Kurdistan PUK 
2841 Davies said the two leaders have agreed to cease the fighting and return their forces to the positions held before the current fighting began on August 17 
2842 He did not give a specific time for the ceasefire but said the United States looked forward to immediate implementation 
2843 The two party leaders had also agreed to meet U.S. Assistant Secretary for Near Eastern Affairs Robert Pelletreau in September to solidify the cease-fire and to pursue reconciliation Davies said 
2844 His statement gave no venue or precise date for the meeting 
2845 The United States has already called on the Kurdish factions to hold peace talks in London 
2846 The KDP said Thursday night it had repelled an attack by thousands of PUK fighters killing wounding or capturing about 400 opposing guerrillas 
2847 The fighting has threatened a U.S.-led peace plan to unite the mountainous Kurdish region in northern Iraq against President Saddam Hussein

2853 Detective Richard Black of the Chesapeake Police Department said a neighbour Curtis Lee White II 19 was arrested in the attack but had not been charged by late morning on Friday

2855 The detective said details were sketchy but two of the teenagers were reportedly downstairs watching television when White allegedly entered the house and told the girls to take off their clothes

2857 The other teenagers also confronted the assailant and three girls all under 18 were stabbed one fatally 
2858 At least two of them were sexually molested Black said 
2859 He said all of the wounded teenagers were taken to a hospital but none of the injuries were considered life-threatening

2912 Washington to curb Tamil support in U.S. Sri Lanka

2915 The Sri Lankan foreign ministry said in a statement The United States government sympathised with the current predicament Sri Lanka was facing 
2916 The statement said the U.S. government would do all within its prevailing legal framework to prevent the use of American soil to perpetrate violence against the democratic government of Sri Lanka 
2917 It said the U.S. State Department 's coordinator for counter terrorism Philip Wilcox had expressed Washington 's support for the government when he visited Colombo this week 
2918 Colombo has said it believes Tamil rebels fighting a 13-year war for independence against the government finance their military activity through funds extorted from expatriate Sri Lankans in western countries such as the United States

2932 Madhusudan Munakarmi was arrested on Thursday after his neighbours informed police about the plight of 12-year old Dhiraj K.C. who told police his employer used to tie him up with iron chains and locks concealed under his clothes 
2933 The neighbours in Kathmandu called the police when they saw Dheeraj employed by the man for the past nine months limping because of the chains

2936 OPTIONS Euro debt vols seen regrouping after fall 
2937 LONDON 1996-08-23 
2938 Implied volatility of European bond and interest rate options should stabilise around current levels until early next week after falling before and after this week 's German-led cut in interest rates traders said 
2939 Volatility has come off a lot 
2940 We 're looking for it to stabilise now said one Euromark options trader at a U.S. bank 
2941 A trader at a Japanese bank said Euromark volatility now stood at 14.00 for September contract 16.75 for December 19.50 for March and 21.25 for June 
2942 This compared with midweek levels before the welter of interest rate cuts of 18.50 for September 20.00 for December 22.00 for March and 23.5 for June he said 
2943 At 1347 GMT December Euromark futures were trading at 96.78 two basis points down on the day 
2944 He said the sell-off in June vols might have been overdone which could offer value at current levels 
2945 He said caps and floors would be well bid after the round of interest rate cuts due to the fact these rates should stay low at the short end 
2946 The size of the Bundesbank 's repo rate cut to 3.00 percent from 3.30 percent took markets by surprise 
2947 Volatility has a bid to it longer-dated volatility more than short-dated because the event people were buying for has passed and now perhaps people will sell some short dated vol and buy some long dated vol he said 
2948 Long dated volatility has been low this year so it is still at levels which are not historically high 
2949 It is not a dangerous level to own vol. You are not going to lose a lot and you could make quite a bit 
2950 He said volatility levels should be stable until markets reassess the situation after a long weekend in Britain 
2951 Paribas Capital Markets OTC options specialist Robert Coughlan said that if volatility continued lower for the rest of Friday in over-the-counter 10-year Bunds it should be higher next Tuesday 
2952 He said the absence on holiday of many market makers was a main factor behind falls this week in volatility in high-yielding markets such as Italy Spain and Sweden 
2953 Coughlan said the market had more downside than upside potential but a fall was not likely to be of significant size 
2954 I recommend people sell strangles in a number of markets in Germany and France in particular 
2955 With high-yielding markets Italy will be a lot more vulnerable in September on economic and political fronts so I would use current the low level of vol to buy options 
2956 So sell options on Bunds and France to enhance yield and buy options on Italy Coughlan said .. 
2957 Stephen Nisbet International Bonds +44 171 542 6320

2968 Legal challenge to Diana delayed by jail term 
2969 LONDON 1996-08-23 
2970 A British photographer branded a stalker by Princess Diana has been forced to postpone a legal challenge to a ban on approaching her because he 's been jailed for criminal damage his lawyer said on Friday 
2971 Martin Stenning started a 12-week jail sentence on Thursday just as he was preparing to contest an injunction obtained by Diana banning him from coming within 300 metres yards of her 
2972 We were in the process of preparing a detailed affidavit responding to the Princess 's affadavit and expected to go to court in the next couple of weeks said Stenning 's lawyer Benedict Birnberg 
2973 But everything has been put on ice now 
2974 Birnberg told Reuters that the challenge to the injunction would be delayed until Stenning was released 
2975 Stenning threw a brick through the window of a van in February after an argument with a driver when he was working as a motorcycle dispatch rider 
2976 Stenning who has previous convictions is expected to appeal against the sentence 
2977 Magistrates also ordered him to pay compensation of 182 pounds $ 282 
2978 The freelance photographer was branded a stalker by Diana whose divorce from heir-to-the-throne Prince Charles is due to become final next week after persistently trailing her on his motorcycle 
2979 In an affidavit the princess said that in chasing her Stenning had got so close that he twice smashed into her car and pushed her when she tried to remove the film from his camera 
2980 Stenning has rejected Diana 's claims and said he was being made a scapegoat to scare off press photographers
