2982 AMMAN 1996-08-23 
2983 Jordan has asked an Iraqi diplomat to leave the kingdom for carrying out duties incompatible with diplomatic norms an official source said on Friday 
2984 The move came after Amman blamed Iraq and a pro-Baghdad local political party for last week 's worst unrest in seven years after a government decision to double prices of bread 
2985 The government declined comment 
2986 Jordan has asked Mr. Adel Ibrahim the Iraqi embassy 's press attache to leave because he was carrying out duties incompatible with diplomatic norms the source told Reuters 
2987 He said Ibrahim was still in Amman 
2988 The Jordanian Arab Socialist Baath Party has denied involvement in unrest which it blamed on government policies and rising economic hardship 
2989 The riots which shook Jordan for two days broke out after last Friday 's main prayers in the southern town of Karak and spread to Amman 
2990 Kurd rebels to free Turkish soldier prisoners 
2991 DOHUK Iraq 1996-08-23 
2992 Turkish Kurd guerrillas said on Friday they would free seven Turkish soldiers they hold in northern Iraq under a tentative Islamist peace bid 
2993 ...For the sake of safety we are asking for their family members or the authorities to come and pick them up Kurdistan Workers Party PKK central committee member Riza Altun told journalists near the Iraqi city of Dohuk 
2994 PKK guerrillas would accompany the soldiers captured last spring in one of Turkey 's frequent cross-border drives until they could be handed over he said 
2995 Their release has been negotiated by Islamist writer Ismail Nacar as part of a wider effort partly backed by Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan to find a political solution to Turkey 's Kurdish problem 
2996 Erbakan has encouraged Nacar 's bid but has ruled out direct talks with the rebels 
2997 The PKK often uses bases in northern Iraq in its fight for autonomy or independence in southeast Turkey 
2998 More than 20,000 people have died in 12 years of fighting between the guerrillas and Turkish forces

3009 Zenith lands $ 1 billion contract plans $ 100 million plant 
3010 Susan Nadeau 
3011 CHICAGO 1996-08-22 
3012 A consortium of telephone companies and The Walt Disney Co 
3013 said Thursday it had signed a $ 1 billion contract with Zenith to make digital televison set-top boxes for its home entertainment service 
3014 The announcement of the contract for 3 million set-top boxes gave new hope to Zenith which has struggled with years of losses 
3015 This really indicates we 're back in the business William Luehrs president of the Glenview Ill.-based company 's Networks Services Division said in a telephone interview 
3016 Anytime somebody gets the opportunity to enter the next era with such a big bang has got to be seen as a strong message to the industry 
3017 Following the announcement Zenith 's stock soared $ 5.50 to $ 16.875 on the New York Stock Exchange 
3018 The consortium called Americast said the contract was part of its strategy to develop and market the next generation in home entertainment 
3019 In addition to Disney Americast 's partners are phone companies Ameritech Corp. BellSouth Corp. GTE Corp. and SBC Communications 
3020 Americast said Southern New England Telecommunications Corp. has signed a letter of intent to join the group which plans to provide a home entertainment service similar to cable television 
3021 Zenith also said it planned to build a new $ 100 million plant in Woodridge Ill 
3022 to make picture tubes for 32- and 35-inch screen TV sets 
3023 The company currently buys the tubes from competitors 
3024 The new plant which is dependent on obtaining financing will create about 280 new jobs Zenith said 
3025 The contract calls for production of the set-top boxes over five years 
3026 Luehrs said manufacturing will begin and revenue will start to roll in during the first half of next year 
3027 The boxes will be made on a build-to-order basis 
3028 Zenith will convert its Chihuahua Mexico analogue set-top box plant to manufacture the digital boxes 
3029 Luehrs declined to say when the operation was expected to be profitable 
3030 Americast will provide the boxes to subscribers as part of the service 
3031 Its service is being introduced in selected markets across the United States 
3032 Luehrs said digital technology in set-top boxes is only the beginning and said the technology will eventually show up in retail consumer electronics 
3033 We 'll build a lot of these devices into television sets for digital television he said 
3034 Although that is not where this particular contract is headed the fact that there is a strong Zenith presence will pay us dividends in the future 
3035 Zenith has been plagued by generally soft conditions in the colour television industry reporting full-year losses since 1989 
3036 Last month it reported a second-quarter loss of $ 33.2 million or 51 cents a share vs. a loss of $ 45.3 million or 97 cents a share a year earlier 
3037 Last November South Korea-based LG Electronics Inc. bought a majority stake in Zenith 
3038 Robert Gutenstein an analyst for Kalf Voorhis & Co 
3039 said the contract was not unique but it 's big 
3040 Digital is coming it 's economic and the question is what will make the consumer happy and at what price 
3041 Natural Law Party says it can meditate problems away 
3042 WASHINGTON 1996-08-22 
3043 From the people who brought you hundreds of yogic fliers who claimed to defy nature by levitating comes The Natural Law Party a minor political party that nominated a presidential candidate on Thursday 
3044 At a hotel convention here the party associated with the Transcendental Meditation TM movement named physicist John Hagelin as its presidential nominee for the Nov. 5 election 
3045 The party is running on a platform claiming it can ward off problems before they occur through techniques such as mass meditation that would reduce stress crime terrorism and even wars 
3046 Social stress can be reduced and problems such as crime and violence will automatically decrease said a party paper 
3047 Many party members are practitioners of TM which involves meditating to a repeated word or phrase called a mantra 
3048 Some advanced TM followers contend they can actually mediate to such a point that they fly 
3049 But in a demonstration of yogic flying several years ago critics said the people were merely bouncing off the ground from a sitting position 
3050 Huge Windows 95 sales fail to meet expectations 
3051 Martin Wolk 
3052 SEATTLE 1996-08-22 
3053 A year after its massively publicized introduction Microsoft Corp. 's Windows 95 computer operating system has fallen short of the most optimistic expectations for the software giant and the industry 
3054 Even though more than 40 million copies of Windows 95 have been sold making it the fastest-selling new software ever it would have been impossible for any product to live up to the unprecedented hype of the Aug. 24 1995 launch when stores around the world opened at midnight to greet long lines of customers 
3055 The Redmond Wash.-based company spent tens of millions of dollars promoting the product with stunts that included buying the entire print run of the Times of London and lighting New York 's Empire State building in a Windows color scheme 
3056 But the product delivered eight months late has fallen short of its sales potential in part because Microsoft delivered a mixed message to business customers analysts said 
3057 It did n't do as well as it could have said Rob Enderle an analyst with Giga Information Group 
3058 Scores of software and hardware companies that had hoped for a big boost in sales were disappointed when only a brief spike materialized 
3059 People who were expecting major coat-tails were somewhat disappointed said Scott Winkler an analyst with Gartner Group 
3060 It 's not as though it has n't had an impact he said 
3061 It just has n't had the huge earth-shattering impact some people were looking for 
3062 Symantec Corp. which had been among the most bullish of software companies at the time of the Windows 95 launch ended up posting disappointing financial results when retail sales of the operating system fell short of its projections 
3063 Touchstone Software Corp. had to pay $ 1.3 million in cash and stock to settle a shareholders lawsuit brought after the company 's sales failed to meet expectations tied to the Windows 95 launch 
3064 Many software developers apparently saw their crucial holiday season sales suffer last year because store shelves were jammed with blue-and-white boxes of Windows 95 resulting in a shortage of space for seasonal products said Ann Stephens president of PC Data Inc 
3065 To be sure sales of Windows 95 and the accompanying Office 95 upgrade drove Microsoft sales up 46 percent last year to a record $ 8.67 billion and cemented the company 's status as the industry 's dominant company 
3066 Microsoft executives say they are thrilled with the sales figures and industry analysts estimate that by sometime next year the installed base of Windows 95 will surpass that of the older version of Windows now used on about 100 million computers worldwide 
3067 But Enderle said the figure could have been even higher if Microsoft had done a better job of handling the huge demand for technical support from customers who were frustrated trying to install the system 
3068 He and other analysts said corporate America adopted a go-slow approach because Microsoft already was promoting the new version of its high-end Windows NT operating system expected to be available in stores in the next several weeks 
3069 Microsoft sent a lot of signals that NT was going to be the answer Winkler said 
3070 Many people began to believe that Windows 95 was being downplayed 
3071 But now that Windows NT 4.0 has been launched Winkler and others believe only a relatively small proportion of corporate users will elect to pay the added software and hardware costs needed to use it instead of Windows 95 
3072 Windows 95 is going to do great he said 
3073 The mistake people made was in thinking it was going to be a fast sweeping change rather than a slow building change 
3074 U.S. says still committed to Cuba migration pacts 
3075 WASHINGTON 1996-08-22 
3076 The United States said on Thursday it remained committed to migration accords with Cuba and would continue to repatriate intercepted Cuban migrants who attempted to enter U.S. territory illegally 
3077 A State Department statement appeared in part a response to Cuban complaints that Washington was jeopardising the accords by failing to return some of the Cubans involved in recent illegal migration incidents 
3078 The United States reiterates its full commitment to the implementation of the accords signed by the two countries in 1994 and 1995 said the statement by spokesman Glyn Davies 
3079 The United States will continue to return Cuban migrants intercepted at sea who seek to enter the United States or the Guantanamo Naval Base illegally it said 
3080 Washington would also take prompt and effective law enforcement action against alien smuggling and hijackings from Cuba it added 
3081 Davies told reporters the statement would be distributed in the Cuban exile community in Miami to remind everyone of the importance of abiding by the accords and avoiding dangerous attempts to cross the straits from Cuba to Florida 
3082 Havana 's complaints centred on an incident in which a boatload of emigrants capsized in the Florida Straits last week and two recent aircraft hijackings from Cuba 
3083 Sixteen of those picked up from the boat were returned to Cuba but eight were taken to the United States and three to Guantanamo Bay a U.S. base on Cuba until they emigrated to another nation 
3084 The most recent hijacking last Friday involved three hijackers and the pilot of a small aircraft 
3085 Davies said on Tuesday the pilot could soon return to Cuba but U.S. authorities planned to try the hijackers 
3086 In an incident on July 7 a Cuban interior ministry official hijacked a commercial plane and sought aylum at Guantanamo Bay 
3087 Davies said he knew of no plans to return the man to Cuba 
3088 Wis 
3089 says is first state to apply for new welfare 
3090 CHICAGO 1996-08-22 
3091 In keeping with its pioneering image in the area of welfare Wisconsin was the first state to submit an administrative plan under the nation 's new welfare law Gov 
3092 Tommy Thompson said Thursday 
3093 According to a new release from the governor Wisconsin submitted a plan to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services for administration of the new block grant system for welfare just minutes after President Bill Clinton signed the measure into law Thursday 
3094 As the nation 's leader in welfare reform Wisconsin is far ahead of the curve and ready to go under this new system Thompson said 
3095 Still the governor said the new law does not go as far as the state 's own welfare reform program dubbed W-2 
3096 He said that despite the new law Wisconsin will still require federal waivers allowing the working poor to acquire health care coverage from the state a 60-day residency requirement for participation in the welfare program and child support collections to go directly to custodial parents 
3097 The nation 's new welfare reform law limits eligibility gives states more power and ends direct federal aid for poor children

3101 A Vietnamese man who tried to take a snooze in a railway boxcar in Canada found himself locked in and bound for Alaska with no food or water 
3102 Officials in the port of Whittier said on Thursday that they found Tuan Quac Phan 29 dehydrated famished and terrified after sailing to Alaska from Canada in the boxcar loaded on a barge a trip that takes about five days

3104 Dan Jewell of the Whittier Alaska police department described Phan as extremely cooperative 
3105 Seeing me in my uniform he kept saying Jail better 
3106 Jail better 
3107 Phan 's accidental journey started last week in Prince Rupert British Columbia where he was searching for a fishing job Jewell said 
3108 He had climbed up in this boxcar to get out of the weather and to get some sleep Jewell said 
3109 The next thing you know the boxcar is coupled up and loaded up to a barge and headed north 
3110 Police found Phan late on Monday when the boxcar which was transporting lumber was opened at Whittier a port in western Prince William Sound 
3111 Officials fed Phan some soup gave him medical care kept him overnight and then fed him a large breakfast

3198 Sea lion paparazzi to keep tabs on whales 
3199 LONDON 1996-08-22 
3200 U.S. marine biologists have trained a pair of sea lions to tag and photograph elusive whales as they cruise through the Pacific depths New Scientist magazine reported on Thursday 
3201 James Harvey and Jennifer Hurley of the Moss Landing Marine Laboratories in California say their sea lions natural companions of many species of whale can go where no man or woman has ever gone before 
3202 Any diver knows that when a whale gets going you ca n't keep up Harvey told the magazine 
3203 That is why we know only about five percent of what whales do 
3204 The sea lions 17-year-old Beaver and nine-year-old Sake have undergone six years of training for their mission 
3205 Beaver once worked for the U.S. Navy and Sake is an amusement park veteran 
3206 Harvey said they could accurately tag whales with a radio transmitter and could also swim all the way around one of the giant mammals filming it with a video camera 
3207 Their first assignment later this year will be documenting humpback whale migration off Monterey California 
3208 The article did not spell out exactly how the sea lions manage to tag the whales but said in training they were taught to stick a radio transmitter on to a plastic model of a whale using suction cups

3210 CANBERRA 1996-08-23

3212 Every time the Senate hacks away at the budget they hack away at the lower interest rate environment Howard told reporters on Thursday night after attending a Liberal Party function 
3213 Senior ministers have repeatedly warned since the fiscally-tight budget was handed down on Tuesday night that the chance of lower official rates could be hampered in the Senate 
3214 The budget contained sharp spending cuts in areas such as the labour market to reduce the deficit to about A$ 5.6 billion 
3215 The conservative government 's plan for reform of the industrial relations environment and to partially sell Telstra has also been opposed by parties in the Senate such as the Greens and Australian Democrats as well as the official opposition the Labor Party 
3216 Official cash rates were last cut on July 31 to 7.0 percent

3267 China copper stocks owned by state reserve trade 
3268 Lynne O'Donnell 
3269 HONG KONG 1996-08-23 
3270 Up to 100,000 tonnes of copper held in Shanghai bonded warehouses confounding the world market as to its source and ultimate fate probably belongs to China 's strategic state reserve industry sources said on Friday 
3271 Around 40,000 tonnes of the copper have already been moved to warehouses near the northern port of Yingkou where some of the strategic stockpile was stored they said 
3272 Just who owns the copper is a question that has kept traders and industry analysts guessing since the metal was channelled into Shanghai by the China National Nonferrous Metals Import and Export Corp CNIEC in June and July 
3273 It was unclear whether or not the 40,000 tonnes had cleared customs which would provide some concrete indication that the strategic reserve administered directly by the central government 's State Planning Commission owned the copper 
3274 Traders have said the reserve could negotiate concessions on duties three percent import tax and 17 percent value-added tax that made the copper prohibitively expensive otherwise 
3275 But one source the head of a Hong Kong trading house said it made no difference if the copper was customs cleared or not 
3276 If they spend all this money moving the copper to Yingkou it will be sitting there for years he said 
3277 Once it arrives in Yingkou it is subject to monitoring by the State Planning Commission which has to give permission for any more movement ; it is out of the hands of traders he said 
3278 Mystery has surrounded the Shanghai stockpile in recent months with traders unsure not only of who owns it but of its exact size and what its owner planned to do with it 
3279 Trading sources generally agreed it would be cost-effective to take the copper back into a depleted central reserve as it had already served its purpose in taking advantage of long-term backwardation on the London Metal Exchange LME 
3280 A backwardation occurs when the spot price of a metal is higher than the forward price 
3281 CNIEC lent around 85,000 tonnes of copper onto the LME between April and June 1995 on behalf of the state reserve running the state stockpile down to 115,000 tonnes from 200,000 tonnes previously 
3282 Traders in Asia said CNIEC could well have lent it to the market at around US$ 2,700 a tonne and then paid somewhere between $ 2,200 and $ 2,400 a tonne when it started taking the metal back earlier this year 
3283 This would have cleared CNIEC a healthy profit which could then have been used to finance storage and other costs 
3284 Word that CNIEC had offered the copper to European trading houses in a series of secret meetings unnerved an already jittery market 
3285 Industry analysts Bloomsbury Minerals Economics BME said on Wednesday the motivation of the owners of the 85,000 tonnes whoever they are is the most important short-term fundamental in an already tight world market 
3286 BME repeated in its latest review rumours of involvement by Sumitomo Corp with CNIEC said to be helping the Japanese trader unload its copper positions after it revealed in June losses of $ 1.8 billion in a decade of unauthorised deals 
3287 Sumitomo and CNIEC have made no comments on the talk and Chinese traders said they know nothing of such an arrangement 
3288 Traders in Shanghai said on Thursday they were unaware of movements out of the Shanghai bonded warehouses 
3289 They reported more arrivals that were probably spot purchases 
3290 They also expressed concern that the tonnage in bonded warehouses would move onto the domestic market 
3291 But these concerns were irrelevant a Singapore trader said despite a forecast that domestic Chinese copper demand could hit one million tonnes this year 
3292 As with many commodities there is a desire by the Chinese government to keep a stockpile of the metal he said 
3293 You do n't keep it to help industry you keep it in case of emergency 
3294 Hong Kong newsroom 852 2843-6470

3309 Softbank to procure $ 900 mln via forex by Sept 5 
3310 TOKYO 1996-08-23 
3311 Softbank Corp said on Friday that it would procure $ 900 million through the foreign exchange market by September 5 as part of its acquisition of U.S. firm Kingston Technology Co 
3312 It is in the contract that we pay Kingston $ 900 million by September 5 he said adding that Softbank had already started making forward transactions to buy dollars 
3313 On August 15 computer software retailer Softbank said it would buy 80 percent of Kingston the world 's largest maker of memory boards for about $ 1.5 billion in the latest in a series of high-profile acquisitions it has made in the United States

3324 Promodes set to sell German assets paper 
3325 PARIS 1996-08-23 
3326 German retailer Promodes is in advanced talks about selling its German assets and the retailer 's board might decide as soon as Tuesday to sell the assets to Spar AG Les Echos newspaper said on Friday 
3327 It said investment bank Rothschild & Cie was an intermediary in the talks and added that unlisted German retailers Metro Rewe and Lidl were also still in discussions 
3328 Promodes has in Germany its Promo hypermarket unit with 36 Continent superstores which is 1995 generated 4.7 percent of total Promodes sales 
3329 The French group entered the German market in 1990 buying 
3330 In June Promodes signed an outline agreement to sell its Specia unit which runs 100 Dia stores in France to Germany 's Aldi 
3331 Promodes was not immediately available for comment 
3332 Paris newsroom +33 1 4221 5452 
3333 PRESS DIGEST Ireland August 23 
3334 DUBLIN 1996-08-23 
3335 Following are highlights of stories in the Irish press on Friday 
3336 Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy 
3337 IRISH INDEPENDENT 
3338 Ireland 's biggest mortgage lender Irish Permanent ended weeks of stalemate when it announced it was increasing its mortgage lending rate by a quarter of a percentage point 
3339 Two investors who claim to be owed nearly one million Irish pounds by fund manager Tony Taylor believe they may have lost their money 
3340 A second Japanese trawler was under arrest on Thursday night as the Irish Navy and Air Corps continued a cat and mouse game with up to 40 vessels off the Irish coast 
3341 The Irish Department of Enterprise and Employment has widened its probe into Taylor Asset Managers to include the investigation of investments of 10 more investors 
3342 Irish exploration company Ivernia and its South African partner Minorco have received planning permission from the local county council for a major lead and zinc mine at Lisheen County Tipperary 
3343 Building materials firm CRH refused to comment on reports that it is about to pay 180 million pounds stering for U.S. stone and concrete business Tilcon Inc 
3344 IRISH TIMES 
3345 Mortgage lending rates are on the way up with banks and building societies poised to add around a quarter of a percentage point to their main variable rates of interest 
3346 Members of a County Antrim Protestant family who were driven into exile by by loyalist paramilitaries two years ago returned yesterday to live in Northern Ireland in defiance of the threat hanging over them 
3347 Talks will resume next Tuesday in an attempt to avoid a major strike in Irish retail chain Dunnes Stores 
3348 Top dealers in the London office of U.S. bankers Merrill Lynch are transferring to Dublin 
3349 The Irish plastics industry called on the government to support incineration to deal with plastics not suitable for recycling 
3350 Ford China JV posts 77 percent net drop in H1 96 
3351 SHANGHAI 1996-08-24 
3352 A Chinese truck maker in which Ford Motor Co has a 20 percent stake said it posted a 77 percent drop in post-tax profits in the first half of 1996 
3353 Jiangling Motors Corp in a statement in Saturday 's edition of the China Securities newspaper said net profit in the period was 3.385 million yuan down from 14.956 million in the same 1995 period 
3354 Turnover fell to 937.891 million yuan from 1.215 billion while net assets per share were 1.88 yuan unchanged and earnings per share fell to 0.005 yuan from 0.02 yuan the statement said 
3355 In the first half the company said it produced 8,333 vehicles and sold 9,018 but it did not explain the difference 
3356 It blamed the drop in profits on a weak vehicle market and said as its engine plant had only just started trial production the company 's results would not improve in the short-term 
3357 Ford owns 138.643 million shares in the firm 
3358 The majority shareholder with 51 percent or 353.24 million shares is Jiangling Motors Group 
3359 The company in the southern province of Jiangxi had about eight percent of China 's light truck market in 1994 
3360 $ 1 8.3 yuan

3377 RALLYING KANKKUNEN IN COMMAND AS MCRAE ROLLS OUT 
3378 JYVASKYLA Finland 1996-08-24 
3379 Finland 's Juha Kankkunen produced an impressive performance in his Toyota on Saturday to open up a 37 seconds lead after six stages of the 1,000 Lakes Rally sixth round of the world championship 
3380 On a weekend overshadowed by Friday 's fatal accident four times world champion Kankunnen emerged from the first five of Saturday 's 10 stages with a commanding advantage over his country 's latest prospect Marcus Gronholm also in a Toyota 
3381 World championship leader Tommi Makinen in his Mitsubishi was third but current world champion Colin McRae ended a bad week by crashing out 
3382 After being fined $ 250,000 by the sports governing body on Tuesday the British driver rolled his Subaru 6.5 km into stage six 
3383 He and co-driver Derek Ringer were unhurt but team boss David Richards was furious with them 
3384 It 's not unfortunate it 's incompetent he declared 
3385 Kankkunen has set an astonishing pace for a driver who has not rallied for three months 
3386 If you do a lot of something sometimes it 's good to have a break 
3387 It 's not bad for an old man ! 
3388 said the 37-year-old veteran 
3389 Ford had a poor morning with Spaniard Carlos Sainz losing 90 seconds through turbo trouble while Belgian Bruno Thiry dropped four minutes when a transmission shaft snapped

3418 RALLYING BELGIAN SPECTATOR DIES IN FINNISH RALLY 
3419 JYVASKYLA Finland 1996-08-24 
3420 A Belgian man died and 31 people were injured after an accident in Friday 's opening phase of the world championship 1,000 Lakes Rally 
3421 The unnamed victim died during the night a hospital spokesman said on Saturday 
3422 Danish driver Karsten Richardt had ploughed into the crowd during the two-kilometre first stage held in the host city of Jyvaskyla 
3423 Richardt 's Mitsubishi skidded down an escape road and ploughed into a cordoned-off area for spectators 
3424 A second Belgian was also seriously injured but the hospital spokesman said his life was not in danger 
3425 The stage was suspended but the four-day rally resumed on Saturday 
3426 A woman was killed before last year 's event when she walked in front of a car practising on the course

3452 GOLF THUNDERSTORMS FORCE SUSPENSION OF SECOND ROUND IN AKRON 
3453 AKRON Ohio 1996-08-23 
3454 Thunderstorms forced the suspension of the World Series of Golf after just five players in the 43-man field had completed the second round on Friday 
3455 Play initially was interrupted for more than 3-1/2 hours before resuming for two hours 
3456 But play was finally suspended for the day when the storm continued 
3457 The 38 players are schedeled to resume their rounds on Saturday morning before the third round begins

3528 CRICKET ESSEX POISED TO STEP UP TITLE CHALLENGE 
3529 LONDON 1996-08-24 
3530 Essex are set to step up their English county championship challenge with a fifth consecutive victory after new-ball pair Neil Williams and Mark Ilott sent Gloucestershire reeling on Saturday 
3531 Williams seized two wickets in two deliveries and left-armer Ilott also captured two as Gloucestershire 252 behind on first innings slumped to 27 for four at the close on the third day of the four-day game at Colchester 
3532 Essex who started the current round of matches in fifth place 20 points behind leaders Derbyshire with a game in hand could go top if they complete victory on Monday 's last day and other results favour them 
3533 Williams thrust Essex on course for success by dispatching Matt Windows and Andrew Symonds in his second over before Ilott removed Dominic Hewson and Tim Hancock to reduce Gloucestershire to 17 for four at one stage 
3534 The visitors had started the day optimistically by sending back former England captain Graham Gooch when he added just six to his overnight 105 but Essex went on to make 532 for eight before declaring 
3535 Captain Paul Prichard plundered 88 from 73 deliveries hitting 15 fours and one six 
3536 Second-placed Kent were frustrated by rain which prevented any play at Cardiff where they have reached 255 for three in their first innings against Glamorgan while third-placed Surrey are facing an uphill task against Nottinghamshire 
3537 Surrey slipped to 88 for four in reply to Notts commanding first innings of 446 for nine declared at Trent Bridge before Alistair Brown struck a 55-ball half-century 
3538 Brown 's 56 not out containing eight fours and three sixes lifted Surrey to 128 for four on a rain-curtailed day 
3539 Fourth-placed Leicestershire had Hampshire on the ropes at Leicester before rain intervened 
3540 Pace trio David Millns 2-24 Gordon Parsons 3-20 and Vince Wells 2-19 had Hampshire reeling at 81 for seven in reply to the home county 's first innings of 353 
3541 Yorkshire rekindled their title hopes after three successive defeats by taking the upper hand against arch-rivals Lancashire at Old Trafford 
3542 Facing Yorkshire 's 529 for eight declared Lancashire were forced to follow on 206 behind after being bowled out for 323 paceman Darren Gough polishing off the innings with a burst of three wickets for one run in 17 deliveries 
3543 Lancashire then reached 210 for five at the close just four ahead after Neil Fairbrother hit 55 in 60 balls to add to his first innings of 86

3631 SOCCER OUT-OF-SORTS NEWCASTLE CRASH 2-1 AT HOME 
3632 LONDON 1996-08-24 
3633 Newcastle 's early season teething problems continued on Saturday when they lost 2-1 at home to premier league pacesetters Sheffield Wednesday 
3634 England striker Alan Shearer gave Kevin Keegan 's talent-laden side the lead from the penalty spot after 13 minutes after Wednesday 's Yugoslav Dejan Stefanovic pulled down Colombian forward Faustino Asprilla 
3635 But two minutes later Wednesday equalised through Peter Atherton who found space in the penalty area to meet Mark Pembridge 's free kick with a precise glancing header 
3636 Guy Whittingham stole three points for the Yorkshire side with a goal 10 minutes from time 
3637 To add to Newcastle 's misery England striker Les Ferdinand was stretchered off in the second half 
3638 Wednesday who escaped relegation on the final day of last season have now won their first three games of the season 
3639 Elsewhere title hopefuls Liverpool were held 0-0 at home by newly-promoted Sunderland and in London the tie between Tottenham Hotspur and Everton also ended goaless 
3640 Frenchman Frank LeBoeuf and Italian Gianluca Vialli scored their first premier league goals as Chelsea beat Coventry 2-0 and managerless Arsenal won by the same scoreline at Leicester 
3641 Last season 's league and Cup winners Manchester United host 1995 champions Blackburn on Sunday

3720 RUGBY UNION NEW ZEALAND WIN FIRST SERIES IN SOUTH AFRICA 
3721 PRETORIA South Africa 1996-08-24 
3722 New Zealand made history on Saturday when they completed their first series victory in South Africa with a 33-26 victory in the second test 
3723 The win gave the All Blacks an unbeatable 2-0 lead in the three-test series 
3724 Each side scored three tries and the Springboks outscored the All Blacks 15-12 in the second half but still suffered a fourth successive defeat against their old enemies 
3725 Two tries from wing Jeff Wilson in the first quarter gave New Zealand a 24-11 lead before tries from flanker Ruben Kruger and scrum-half Joost van der Westhuizen in the space of two minutes narrowed the gap to a single point at 23-24 
3726 The Springboks would have gone ahead had not fly-half Joel Stransky 's conversion hit an upright and New Zealand only scrambled to safety through a fine penalty from replacement fly-half Jon Preston and a drop goal by number eight Zinzan Brooke 
3727 RUGBY UNION NEW ZEALAND DEFEAT SOUTH AFRICA 33-26 
3728 PRETORIA South Africa 1996-08-24 
3729 New Zealand beat South Africa 33-26 halftime 21-11 in the second test on Saturday

3902 SOCCER DISAPPOINTING AJAX SLUMP 2-0 AT HEERENVEEN 
3903 AMSTERDAM 1996-08-24 
3904 Dutch champions Ajax Amsterdam faltered in their second league match of the season on Saturday losing 2-0 away at Heerenveen 
3905 Ajax who had a dismal series of pre-season results before beating NAC of Breda in their opening game had the best of an entertaining first half but failed to break the deadlock 
3906 Eight minutes after the interval Heerenveen 's Romeo Wouden broke through the Amsterdam defence left defender John Veldman standing and curled the ball beyond goalkeeper Edwin van der Sar into the Ajax net 
3907 Ajax without injured defenders Marcio Santos and Winston Bogarde and strikers Jari Litmanen and Marc Overmars then stepped up the pace and looked certain to equalise 
3908 But they left gaps at the back and on 73 minutes Danish striker Jon Dahl Tomasson rushed out of his own half beat the Ajax defence and lobbed van der Sar 
3909 The defeat means Ajax 's main title contenders PSV Eindhoven who beat the champions 3-0 in the traditional league curtain-raiser can go three points clear of their rivals if they beat Groningen on Sunday

4110 CRICKET RAIN BRINGS PREMATURE END TO SRI LANKA MATCH 
4111 COLOMBO 1996-08-24

4114 British hostage in Chechnya describes ordeal 
4115 LONDON 1996-08-24 
4116 A British aid worker held hostage in Chechnya for nearly four weeks said on Saturday a cocked Kalashnikov had been thrust into his mouth at one point during his ordeal 
4117 Michael Penrose a 23-year-old worker with the group Action Against Hunger described his ordeal to a news conference when he arrived back in Britain from Moscow 
4118 The worst period of physical manhandling was during that time when we were beaten with Kalashnikovs and at one point I had a Kalashnikov held to the back of my throat cocked he said 
4119 For the first period we were held in a small room with no bed or anything 
4120 We had very little food and sometimes went two or three days without eating 
4121 Gunmen seized Penrose who comes from Swerford in southern England Frenchman Frederic Malardeau and six other hostages from their car in Grozny the capital of Chechnya on July 27 
4122 The assailants had demanded a ransom of 300,000 pounds $ 465,000 but no money was paid by the charity when they were released on Wednesday 
4123 The hostages were held in a house in or near Grozny which was bombarded regularly 
4124 During the last 15 days of being held the fighting in Grozny was very close 
4125 At first it was street fighting outside the house and then we came under very heavy shelling and bombardment from conventional weapons like tanks artillery and grenade launchers he said 
4126 Penrose had been working for the charity which provides food to civilians for only a few weeks before he was captured 
4127 When asked if he would return to the mountainous region where rebels have been fighting Russian troops for full independence Penrose said Not for the time being 
4128 I do n't think it 's safe for me 
4129 But maybe in the future depending on the circumstances 
4130 Princess Diana send message to Mother Teresa 
4131 LONDON 1996-08-24 
4132 Britain 's Princess Diana has sent a message to seriously ill Mother Teresa the nun to whom she has turned several times for spiritual guidance 
4133 Diana 's office said on Saturday the princess had sent a message to the Nobel Peace Prize-winning missionary as news broke this week of her battle against heart problems and malaria 
4134 A spokeswoman declined to release details of the message 
4135 Diana first met the Albanian-born missionary in Rome in 1992 
4136 She said afterwards that the meeting had fulfilled her dearest wish and the two women have met several times since 
4137 The princess who has carved out a major role for herself as a helper of the sick and needy is said to have turned to Mother Teresa for guidance as her marriage crumbled to heir to the British throne Prince Charles 
4138 The 85-year-old nun said in the past that she was praying for the couple whose divorce is expected to become final next week 
4139 Doctors caring for Mother Teresa in a Calcutta hospital said on Saturday that her fever had fallen and her malaria was under control but she remained on a respirator in intensive care

4156 Adventurers start Canadian wilderness race 
4157 PEMBERTON British Columbia 1996-08-24 
4158 About 350 adventurers from nine countries set out on Saturday to climb raft bike and run in a 323-mile 517-km endurance race through the Canadian wilderness 
4159 The event called the Eco-Challenge is part of a growing sport known as adventure racing in which competitors test their limits for days over a perilous wilderness course 
4160 I 'm looking forward to this race 
4161 I think it will be more physically challenging and we 'll have to go up against more diverse situations due to the terrain said Dr. Michael Stroud a veteran Eco-Challenge participant 
4162 The Eco-Challenge has been staged twice before in Utah and Maine last year and is modelled on similar races overseas 
4163 The 70 teams in this year 's race will will trek glaciers climb mountains whitewater raft horseback ride canoe and mountain bike along the grueling course 
4164 This year 's race the route of which was keep a secret until Friday evening is being held near Pemberton British Columbia about 100 miles 160 km northeast of Vancouver 
4165 The area is filled with treacherous mountain peaks ice fields and frigid waters 
4166 Organisers expect about two-thirds of the participants to drop out or be disqualified before the finish 
4167 The hardy ones are expected to complete the course in about six days with first-place finishers receiving $ 10,000 in prize money 
4168 In the Eco-Challenge competitors race in teams of five which must include both men and women 
4169 Team members must remain within 100 yards metres of each other at all times and finish together 
4170 With racers carrying about 40 pounds 18 kg of gear on their backs broken bones sunstroke dehydration and exhaustion are common 
4171 Cholera kills 21 in southern Nigeria 
4172 LAGOS 1996-05-28 
4173 An outbreak of cholera has killed 21 people in a week at Ubimini in oil-rich southern Nigeria the News Agency of Nigeria reported on Saturday 
4174 The chairman of the local council Damian Ejiohuo said drugs had been rushed to the area to quell the disease and the community needed a safer source of drinking water to prevent future outbreaks 
4175 Epidemics are common in rural areas of Nigeria where piped water is not usually available 
4176 Malawi 's ex-president Banda says he 's feeling well 
4177 BLANTYRE 1996-08-24 
4178 Malawi 's frail former president Kamuzu Banda said on Saturday in a rare public interview that he was feeling well despite his advanced years 
4179 I feel all right and I eat everything that is put on the table 
4180 And that means I am all right he told reporters invited to his home 
4181 Banda a vegetarian teetotaller believed to be 97 walked unaided but supporting himself on a walking stick 
4182 He clutched a fly whisk which for a long time symbolised his obsession with power 
4183 His health was the subject of much recent speculation 
4184 Malawi 's undisputed ruler for three decades he lost power in the first all-party elections in 1994 
4185 He spent a year under house arrest and was tried but acquitted last year on charges of ordering the murder of four opponents in 1983 
4186 Zimbabwe fires striking civil servants 
4187 Emelia Sithole 
4188 HARARE 1996-08-24 
4189 The Zimbabwean government fired thousands of workers on Saturday for defying an order to end a strike which has crippled essential services and disrupted international and domestic flights 
4190 The Public Service Commission PSC said in a statement that the workers including nurses junior doctors mortuary attendants customs officers and firefighters would be barred from entering their workplaces on Monday 
4191 All civil servants who did not return to work at their normal working hours and remained working for the full working day on 23 August 1996 have been summarily dismissed 
4192 with immediate effect it said in a statement 
4193 Union officials from the Public Service Association PSA were unavailable for comment 
4194 Public Service Labour and Social Welfare Minister Florence Chitauro told state radio her ministry had already begun recruiting other people to replace the strikers sub-contracting some of the work to private firms 
4195 The government had been threatening to fire the workers since the strike began on Tuesday saying it was illegal 
4196 But the strikers ignored the threat and vowed to stay on the streets until their demands for wage rises of 30 to 60 percent were met 
4197 The stoppage has left essential services stretched with many hospitals handling only emergency cases under senior doctors with the help of army medical personnel and the Red Cross 
4198 It has also disrupted flights 
4199 Some internal services were cancelled leaving tourists at the Victoria Falls resort stranded and flights abroad were delayed 
4200 The PSA said 80 percent of the country 's 180,000 civil servants took part in the strike which is a rare challenge to President Robert Mugabe who has been in power since independence from Britain in 1980 
4201 Opposition parties civic organisations and private-sector unions have expressed support for the action and denounced the government 's pay rises of up to eight percent for its workers 
4202 Civil servants earn on average Z$ 1,000 $ 100 a month 
4203 They say their pay has not kept up at all with inflation currently running at 22 percent 
4204 Rwanda says Zaire expels 28 Rwandan refugees 
4205 KIGALI 1996-08-24 
4206 Rwanda said on Saturday that Zaire had expelled 28 Rwandan Hutu refugees accused of being trouble-makers in camps in eastern Zaire 
4207 Captain Firmin Gatera spokesman for the Tutsi-dominated Rwandan army told Reuters in Kigali that 17 of the 28 refugees handed over on Friday from the Zairean town of Goma had been soldiers in the former Hutu army which fled to Zaire in 1994 after being defeated by Tutsi forces in Rwanda 's civil war 
4208 Zairean Prime Minister Kengo wa Dondo said on Thursday in a visit to Rwanda that his country would expell all the refugees back to Rwanda but he gave no timeframe 
4209 Zaire is home to 1.1 million Rwandan Hutu refugees who fled three months of civil war in 1994 
4210 Many had taken part in the genocide that year of one million people mostly Tutsis and refuse to go home for fear of reprisal at the hands of the new Tutsi-dominated government in Kigali 
4211 Gatera said the refugees were handed over following a deal made at a meeting between the governor of Zaire 's north Kivu region and his counterpart in the Rwandan border town of Gisenyi 
4212 After a meeting between the governor of north Kivu and the prefect of Gisenyi 28 prisoners refugees were handed over to Rwandan authorities on Friday Gatera said 
4213 Out of these 17 were former soldiers 
4214 These people are now in Gisenyi prison Gatera added 
4215 Revered skull of S. Africa king is Scottish woman 's 
4216 JOHANNESBURG 1996-08-24 
4217 A limelight-loving South African chief was in disgrace on Saturday after a prized skull he brought home from Scotland was identified as belonging not to his sacred tribal ancestor but to a middle-aged white woman 
4218 A forensic scientist who examined the supposed skull of 19th century King Hintsa a chief of President Nelson Mandela 's Xhosa tribe killed in battle by the British said it was in fact the cranium of a European woman 
4219 Chief Nicholas Gcaleka dressed in animal skins and full tribal regalia journeyed to a wintry Scotland in February on a hugely publicised quest to find Hintsa 's skull 
4220 The witchdoctor said ancestors had appeared to him in a dream and ordered him to return the head said to have been carried off as a colonial trophy by the officer who shot and allegedly beheaded Hintsa after a battle in 1835 
4221 But Gcaleka ran into trouble as soon as he returned to South Africa with a skull he found in a cottage in a lonely Highland forest near Inverness 
4222 He said the spirit of a hurricane had guided him there 
4223 Members of the Xhosa royal family branding Gcaleka a charlatan confiscated the head and sent it for tests to a forensic scientist who examined the shape of the skull and the hole that he determined had not come as supposed from a bullet 
4224 It can be stated beyond reasonable doubt that this skull is not that of the late king the scientist said in a statement 
4225 Sudan arrests opposition sewing machine smugglers 
4226 KHARTOUM 1996-08-24 
4227 Sudanese police have arrested three people trying to smuggle sewing machines and army clothing to Sudanese opposition groups in Eritrea an official newspaper reported on Saturday 
4228 The government-owned al-Ingaz al-Watani said the smugglers were caught in Banat in the eastern state of Kassala on the border with Eritrea and had confessed they were on their way to the so-called alliance forces which have been undertaking subversive operations on the eastern border 
4229 Authorities in Kassala said opposition forces based in Eritrea have been laying landmines and stealing vehicles and other goods to smuggle them across the border into Eritrea 
4230 Sudan accuses the Eritrean authorities of providing support to Sudanese opposition elements based in Eritrea 
4231 Eritrea cut diplomatic ties with Sudan in 1994 accusing it of training rebels to make raids into Eritrea 
4232 The exiled National Democratic Alliance a Sudanese umbrella opposition group has its headquarters in the Eritrean capital Asmara 
4233 It uses the former Sudanese embassy 
4234 Albanian Socialists start landmark reform congress 
4235 TIRANA 1996-08-24 
4236 Albania 's opposition Socialist Party began a two-day congress on Saturday to discuss major jettisoning its links with almost half a century of Stalinist dictatorship in the Balkan country 
4237 The congress will approve new concepts that will turn the party into a Social-Democratic and electoral party not a class and ideological one the Socialist Zeri i Popullit daily said in an editorial 
4238 Jailed Socialist leader Fatos Nano made the first call for change in July a month after the party 's chief opponents the conservative Democrats of President Sali Berisha almost swept the board in a disputed general election 
4239 The Socialists reformed heirs to the communists pulled out of the poll saying it was a sham 
4240 Acting Socialist leader Servet Pellumbi has said he too will urge the party to scrap the ideas of Karl Marx at the congress 
4241 The pro-reform stance of some of the party leadership initially caused a storm and triggered the resignation last month of the party 's Secretary-General Gramoz Ruci 
4242 More recently political commentators have reported a growing consensus however and a rift at the meeting looks increasingly unlikely

4244 MANAGUA Nicaragua 1996-08-23 
4245 Nicaraguan President Violeta Chamorro was due to fly to the United States on Saturday for a medical check-up to determine if surgery was needed on the lower part of her spinal column the government said on Friday 
4246 Chamorro has complained of lower back pain since her trip to Taiwan in May when the pain forced her to go to Taipei University Hospital for an examination 
4247 Chamorro 66 suffers from osteoporosis a disease that weakens the bones and has repeatedly flown to Washington for treatment by her longtime doctor Sam Wilson 
4248 Nepal wo n't help split Tibet king tells China 
4249 BEIJING 1996-08-24 
4250 King Birendra of Nepal has told China his nation will not become the tool of people who want Tibetan independence from Beijing the official China Daily newspaper said on Saturday 
4251 King Birendra in Tibet at the start of a one-week unofficial visit to China said the Nepalese government had maintained a sharp vigilance against such intentions the newspaper said 
4252 Nepal shares a long mountain border with the restive Himalayan region where opposition to Beijing 's four-decade rule is widespread 
4253 Chinese official media has often accused foreign forces notably the United States of seeking to support Tibetan independence activists 
4254 King Birenda told Gyaicain Norbu chairman of the Tibetan government that Nepal would not become a tool for others to split Tibet the newspaper said 
4255 Gyaicain told the royal visitor increased cooperation between Nepal and Tibet was possible in the fields of trade tourism communications and sports it said 
4256 It gave no details 
4257 Iran hangs two men for drug trafficking 
4258 TEHRAN 1996-08-24 
4259 Iran has hanged two drug traffickers in the southern city of Shiraz the evening newspaper Resalat reported on Saturday 
4260 The two Iranian men were arrested in July with 419 kilograms 924 lbs of opium after they opened fire on police and killed a pedestrain and wounded four the newspaper quoted a police commander as saying 
4261 Resalat said the executions were ordered by the Islamic Revolutionary Court 
4262 It did not say when they took place 
4263 One of the men who killed the pedestrian was hanged at the site of the crime and the other was executed in Adel prison in Shiraz the newspaper said 
4264 Possession of 30 grammes just over an ounce of heroin or five kg 11 lb of opium is punishable by death in Iran 
4265 More than 1,000 people have been executed in drug-related cases since the law took effect in 1989 
4266 Iran has an estimated one million drug addicts and is a key transit route for drugs mostly opium smuggled to Europe through Afghanistan and Pakistan the so called Golden Crescent 
4267 Main Tunisian opposition party ousted from HQ 
4268 TUNIS 1996-08-24 
4269 Tunisia 's main opposition party on Saturday announced that it had been ousted from its headquarters building by a court decision for failing to pay the rent 
4270 Mohamed Ali Khalfallah spokesman for the Movement of Socialist Democrats MDS said that a bailiff who was accompagnied by policemen on Saturday ordered the party to leave the building 
4271 We were not allowed a delay to enable us to transfer the movement 's goods and documents Khalfallah added in a statement 
4272 The building is state property 
4273 The MDS was represented in court and admitted owing money for rent but did not give details 
4274 MDS this year lost its president and vice-president both of whom were tried and given jail sentences 
4275 MDS president Mohamed Moada was sentenced last February to 11 years in jail on charges of having secret contacts with Libyan agents and receiving money from Tripoli 
4276 Vice-president Khemais Chammari last July was sentenced to five years in prison on a charge of disclosing secrets of judicial proceedings in Moada 's affair 
4277 To replace Moada the MDS after the trial named Khalfallah as coordinator but Ismail Boulahya the last of the MDS founding members still politically active claimed the title of president causing a new split within the movement 
4278 MDS was founded in 1978 by a group led by Ahmed Mestiri who withdrew from politics in 1992 
4279 Succeeding him as head of the movement Moada an Arab nationalist ousted liberals led by MDS secretary-general Mustapha Ben Jaafar in 1993 
4280 Kurdish group says two killed in Iraqi shelling

4285 Two civilians were killed in the Iraqi bombing IRNA quoted the radio report as saying 
4286 The PUK-run radio on Friday said Iraqi heavy artillery was pounding its positions in Kurdish-controlled northern Iraq but it gave no details of casualties

4288 The rival Kurdistan Democratic Party KDP which accuses Iran of supporting the PUK said on Thursday that its forces had halted an Iranian-backed attack by thousands of PUK fighters 
4289 The United States said in Washington on Friday that it had brokered a ceasefire to end six days of fighting between the two main Kurdish factions and persuaded them to attend U.S.-mediated peace talks next month 
4290 The clashes shattering a ceasefire negotiated last year by Washington had threatened a U.S.-led peace plan to unite the Kurdish region against Iraqi President Saddam Hussein 
4291 U.S. British and French planes have been patrolling the skies of northern Iraq since shortly after the 1991 Gulf War to shield Iraq 's Kurds from any attack by Iraqi troops 
4292 Iran accuses Iraq of ceasefire violations 
4293 NICOSIA 1996-08-24 
4294 Iran has accused Iraq of violating the ceasefire ending their 1980-88 war some 32 times between the end of March and May 31 this year the Iranian news agency IRNA reported on Saturday 
4295 Iran 's deputy representative to the United Nations Majid Takht Ravanchi made the allegations in a letter to U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali on Friday the agency said 
4296 The Islamic Republic of Iran has reported some 32 new cases of ceasefire violations by the Iraqi regime between March 31 and May 31 1996 it reported from New York 
4297 It said violations included constructing observation posts installing mortars and anti-aircraft cannons setting up tents penetrating Iranian territory and firing rifle grenades towards Iranian territory 
4298 The eight-year war between the two countries ended with a U.N.-sponsored ceasefire

4316 Clinton campaign busy making news 
4317 Laurence McQuillan 
4318 WASHINGTON 1996-08-24 
4319 President Bill Clinton has served notice he intends to be busy making news or at least doing things that look and sound like it in a campaign year 
4320 With Democrats gathering in Chicago to start a convention on Monday to nominate him for a second term as president Clinton plans a steady parade of events designed to highlight his leadership and dim the glow of the just-concluded Republican conclave that gave a boost to rival Bob Dole 
4321 After a week of carefully orchestrated events signing into law bills passed by the Republican-controlled Congress Clinton used his Saturday radio address to the nation to proudly announce a development in the war on crime 
4322 Sixty days ago I directed the attorney general to draw up a plan for a national registry of sex offenders Clinton said 
4323 That plan has now reached my desk 
4324 Today I am pleased to announce that we are following through on our commitment to keep track of these criminals not just in a single state but wherever they go he said 
4325 Actually creation of such a registry was underway without Clinton lifting a finger 
4326 Attorney General Janet Reno 's report all nine pages of it including footnotes offers only the interim services of the FBI until a formal registry on sex offenders has been established 
4327 Two months ago Clinton announced he wanted an interim effort established 
4328 Now 60 days later he had a chance to talk about it again 
4329 It is an example of Clinton 's strategic planning as he heads into the stretch drive for the Nov. 5 presidential election 
4330 Such things do not happen by chance in the Clinton White House they are part of his political chess game 
4331 In the past week Clinton signed into law an increase in the minimium wage a bill that makes it easier for someone with a pre-existing health problem to change jobs and sweeping changes overhauling the nation 's welfare system 
4332 America can look back on a week of remarkable achievement Clinton said without even a passing reference to the Republican majority in the House and Senate 
4333 America is on the right track offering more opportunity demanding more responsibility building a stronger community the sense of shared values and stronger families he said in striking the theme of his coming week 
4334 According to a senior campaign official Clinton will be making a lot of news in the coming week something different each day 
4335 Clinton departs on Sunday on a four-day train trip through West Virginia Kentucky Ohio Michigan and Indiana while fellow Democrats are gathered in Chicago 
4336 He 'll make news during the day and then at night the attention will go to the convention said the campaign official 
4337 We think it 'll work really well 
4338 Although officials decline to say just what each day 's news will be the intent is to put a focus on Clinton himself and not just those attending the party 's convention 
4339 Each day of the trip will have a late start so that network television correspondents will be able to do live reports for morning programmes 
4340 Campaign officials then hope the day 's news event will be showcased on evening television news shows as a lead-in for that night 's convention programme 
4341 We 'll be concentrating on supporting the president as he is on the trip and making significant public policy statements related to some of his plans for the future said White House Press Secretary Mike McCurry 
4342 McCurry said that when Clinton delivers his acceptance address on Thursday night to fellow Democrats and a national television audience he will set out a road map for the nation 's future one the president hopes guides him back to the White House for four more years 
4343 Hurricane expected to veer north of Caribbean 
4344 MIAMI 1996-08-24 
4345 Hurricane Edouard grew stronger on Saturday as it swirled across the Atlantic Ocean but forecasters at the National Hurricane Center said the storm would likely swing north and miss the Caribbean 
4346 Edouard is getting stronger and stronger and it already has winds of 105 mph 185 kph said hurricane forecaster Lixion Avila 
4347 But the good news is that all our computer models indicate Edouard is going to turn to the west-northwest on Sunday and miss the islands he added 
4348 At 11 a.m. EDT 1500 GMT Edouard was 1,130 miles east of the Lesser Antilles and moving west at 14 mph 25 kph 
4349 Its exact position was latitude 14.5 north longitude 44.2 west

4355 German troops to remain in Bosnia for 1997--Ruehe 
4356 BONN 1996-08-24 
4357 Defence Minister Volker Ruehe said that German troops would stay on in Bosnia next year as part of an international force to ensure the establishment of peace a newspaper reported on Saturday 
4358 The current NATO-led peace force IFOR in Bosnia is due to return home at the end of the year 
4359 But Ruehe told Bild am Sonntag in an interview that a new and different mandate for the troops would be agreed on for next year after the current mandate expires in December 
4360 After the Bosnian elections on September 14 the troops will start being reduced from the beginning of October from 60,000 to about 20,000 
4361 A completely new and different mandate will be agreed for next year Ruehe said 
4362 The defence ministers will begin negotiations for this at the beginning of September at a NATO meeting he told the newspaper in an interview excerpts of which were released ahead of publication on Sunday 
4363 But we must avoid giving the impression this peace deployment in former Yugoslavia is being perceived in the long run as an occupation 
4364 On the other hand we must prevent any return of war and massacres he said 
4365 Italian comics hope independence-joke 's on Bossi 
4366 ORVIETO Italy 1996-08-24 
4367 A group of Italian comics hope the joke will be on separatist leader Umberto Bossi next month when they lead the ancient Etruscan town of Orvieto in a mock split from Rome 
4368 Orvieto mayor Stefano Cimicchi said the comics including popular actor Roberto Benigni would declare Orvieto capital of Etruria on September 15 the day Bossi plans a march across the north in favour of independence from Rome 
4369 We will then proceed with the annexation of Sardinia Corsica and Cyprus Cimicchi told reporters on Saturday 
4370 He said the city council would be ironically present when the comics made their proclamation on the same day Bossi has threatened to declare the birth of Padania the name he has given to northern Italy 
4371 Orvieto located in Umbria between Rome and Florence was once the capital of Etruria an ancient federation of 12 Etruscan towns 
4372 We want to pop some air out of this balloon of tension that has been blown up around September 15 Cimicchi said 
4373 We want to help turn down the rhetoric in a country that borders former Yugoslavia yet in which people are still talking about secession he added 
4374 Bossi has intensified his separatist rhetoric since his Northern League party 's good showing in last April 's general election when it took 10 percent of the vote nationally 
4375 He has recently dropped a drive for federalism saying secession from Rome 's wasteful and centralised bureaucracy is the only solution for northerners 
4376 Italian farmer says he mutilated four women 
4377 VERONA Italy 1996-08-24 
4378 An Italian farmer accused of multiple homocide has confessed to mutilating the bodies of four women after having sex with them the Italian news agency ANSA reported on Saturday 
4379 It quoted the lawyer of Gianfranco Stevanin as saying the 35-year-old farmer confessed on Friday to a Verona magistrate that he had killed and mutilated the women 
4380 ANSA said Stevanin was unable to recall how he had killed the women remembering only that he had found them lifeless in his arms after having sadmasochistic sex with them 
4381 Stevanin arrested in 1994 and jailed for three years for assaulting an Austrian prostitute is accused of murdering five women three of whose bodies were found near his villa outside Verona between July and December 1995 
4382 Two of the corpses were identified but not the third found headless and decomposed in a sack in a nearby canal 
4383 Lawyer Cesare dal Maso told ANSA that Stevanin confessed to beheading and dumping the body of a fourth woman in the nearby Adige river 
4384 Dal Maso declined to comment on the alleged fifth murder saying only that the interrogations are not over yet with investigators 
4385 It said investigators believed Stevanin had suffocated them by putting plastic bags on their heads 
4386 Stevanin was first sentenced for assault but investigators began digging in the garden of his villa after the first body was found by a passer-by 
4387 Belgium asks how paedophile suspect eluded police 
4388 Jeremy Lovell 
4389 BRUSSELS 1996-08-24 
4390 Belgian police searched two more houses on Saturday for bodies in a child-sex scandal of murder kidnapping and pornography that has sent a shockwave of revulsion throughout Europe 
4391 Recriminations built up over how the scandal 's central figure convicted child rapist Marc Dutroux managed to prey on children unhindered for so long 
4392 In just over a week two young girls have been found dead from starvation two have been freed from a dungeon-like secret compartment and an international hunt has started for at least two others 
4393 On Saturday investigators with dogs trained to find bodies searched one house at Ransart and one at Mont-sur-Marchienne both suburbs of the southern city of Charleroi 
4394 Both houses are owned by Dutroux 
4395 Belgian media speculated that Dutroux charged with abduction and illegal imprisonment of children must have had high level protection to molest youngsters 
4396 They put forward no proof to support the speculation but seized on a comment by chief prosecutor Michel Bourlet on Belgian television on Friday night that he would chase down everyone involved in the case if I am allowed to 
4397 Bourlet said between 300 and 400 paedophile porn video tapes had been seized some of which featured Dutroux 
4398 Dutroux was charged a week ago after police rescued two young girls from a concrete dungeon in the basement of one of the six houses he owns in and around Charleroi 
4399 Just a day later the national euphoria at the rescue turned to disgust as Dutroux led police to the bodies of two eight-year-old girls in another of his houses 
4400 Julie Lejeune and Melissa Russo had been kidnapped in June last year 
4401 Dutroux said they starved to death nine months later 
4402 He also admitted kidnapping two other girls An Marchal and Eefje Lambrecks a year ago 
4403 The fate of the girls is unknown but there has been speculation they were sold into prostitution in Slovakia or the Czech Republic where Dutroux was a frequent visitor 
4404 Belgian police have visited Bratislava and will visit Prague 
4405 Five other people have been arrested including Dutroux 's second wife Michelle Martin charged as an accomplice 
4406 The others have been charged with abduction and illegal imprisonment of children or are suspected of criminal association 
4407 Dutch police are also holding a 74-year old Dutchman in connection with the disappearance of An and Eefje although a spokesman said no direct link had yet been established 
4408 At least part of the speculation in the Belgian media of high-level protection for Dutroux and his accomplices is based on leaked documents cataloguing a high degree of police bungling incompetence and indifference 
4409 Among the revelations are the fact that the gendarmerie was running a surveillance operation codenamed Othello against Dutroux in 1995 when both Julie and Melissa and An and Eefje were kidnapped 
4410 They show that the gendarmes were aware that Dutroux was building cells in some of his houses for holding children yet this information was either not passed on to other police forces searching for the missing girls or was overlooked when it was 
4411 They also show that police investigating a theft visited Dutroux late last year at the house where Julie and Melissa were being held but accepted his word that the children 's cries they could hear came from neighbours 
4412 Justice Minister Stefaan De Clerck has admitted that mistakes were made and ordered an inquiry at the same time as stressing there were no indications of a cover-up 
4413 There is also widespread disbelief that no one appeared to question how Dutroux an unemployed father of three with no visible means of support managed to own six houses 
4414 Death toll of Algeria bomb put at seven-newspaper 
4415 PARIS 1996-08-24 
4416 An Algerian newspaper on Saturday put at seven two women and five children the death toll of a bomb blast in a market west of Algiers on Friday 
4417 Algerian security forces said on Friday three women and two children were killed and five people wounded when a home-made bomb exploded at a market in the coastal town of Bou Haroun 65 km 40 miles west of Algiers 
4418 The security forces also said a man carrying an explosive device also died after it went off prematurely 
4419 El-Watan paper said the blast killed seven a mother and her 25-year-old daughter four young boys and a five-year-old girl 
4420 Several people were also wounded it said 
4421 The explosion was the latest in series of bomb attacks in Algeria 's four-year-old civil strife 
4422 The government-appointed watchdog Human Rights National Observatory was quoted this month by local newspapers as saying about 1,400 civilians have died in bomb attacks blamed on Moslem rebels in the past two years 
4423 An estimated 50,000 Algerians and more than 110 foreigners have been killed in violence pitting Moslem rebels against government forces since early 1992 when the authorities cancelled a general election in which radical Islamists had taken a commanding lead

4434 Most Spaniards back talks with Basque rebels--poll 
4435 MADRID 1996-08-24 
4436 Most Spaniards would support government talks with the illegal Basque separatist group ETA if the rebels renounced violence permanently a survey published in daily El Mundo on Saturday said 
4437 While 57 percent of the population supported negotiations with ETA Basque Homeland and Freedom 30 percent opposed it the survey by the state-controlled Centre for Sociological Studies CIS found 
4438 But 80 percent said ETA had shown little interest in achieving peace in the Basque country when it offered a one-week truce in July while continuing to hold prison officer Jose Antonio Ortega Lara kidnapped in January 
4439 The problem of terrorism had neither worsened nor improved since the conservative Popular Party PP came to power in May according to 56 percent of those questioned while 22 percent said it had worsened 
4440 The survey questioned 2,496 people between July 17 and 21 and has a margin of error of plus or minus two percent 
4441 Thirty killed as floods plunge Lahore into chaos 
4442 ISLAMABAD 1996-08-24 
4443 At least 30 people have been killed and about 100 injured in the flood-hit Pakistani city of Lahore newspapers reported on Saturday 
4444 They said 461 mm 18 inches of rain had drenched the Punjab provincial capital in 36 hours turning streets into rivers knocking out power water and telephone services disrupting air and rail traffic and sweeping away houses and cars 
4445 Newspapers quoted witnesses as saying they had seen bodies floating in the streets 
4446 Among the dead were five members of the religious Jamaat-i-Islami party who drowned while trying to remove books from a basement library 
4447 They said thousands of people had been made homeless after a breach opened in the city canal inundating residential areas 
4448 Army troops were called in to evacuate residents of low-lying areas to higher ground 
4449 Officials said the Ravi and Chenab rivers which both flow through Punjab were in high flood and emergency services backed by troops were on full alert 
4450 Internet Startup funded to develop Java software 
4451 MOUNTAIN VIEW Calif. 1996-08-25 
4452 A small team of engineers from Sun Microsystems Inc. 's JavaSoft unit said Sunday they have formed a new company dubbed Internet Startup to build Java infrastructure software 
4453 The fledgling company established in a ground-floor office here over the last two weeks has received venture financing from Bessemer Venture Partners of Menlo Park Calif .. 
4454 David Cowan Internet Startup founder and acting chief executive is a general partner of Bessemer 
4455 The startup company 's acting chairman is Jim Bidzos the president of RSA Data Security a unit of Security Dynamics Technologies Inc. as well as chairman of VeriSign 
4456 Internet Startup which opened its doors with about half a dozen initial employees combines experience at JavaSoft Apple Computer Inc. and Oracle Systems 
4457 Java portends dramatic changes in the way we use the Internet said Hong Bui vice president of engineering of the new company after serving as a senior engineer at JavaSoft 
4458 Java is a computer programming language introduced by Sun Microsystems in mid-1995 which has immediately captured the attention of the industry for its ability to operate across virtually all computer system in a relatively secure manner 
4459 Just last week Sun Microsystems and the Silicon Valley venture capital giant Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers said they had completed financing of a $ 100 million fund managed by Kleiner Perkins to fund startups developing Java technologies 
4460 Java has been licensed by nearly 50 organisations ranging from Microsoft Corp. and International Business Machines Corp. to the Taiwan government 
4461 Prasad Wagle another former senior JavaSoft engineer who is among the founding engineers at Internet Startup said the new company aims to build software infrastructure using Java to make networked applications ubiquitious 
4462 One feature of the Java language is that small software programmes known as applets because they are small applications can be downloaded from the server computers at the centre of networks onto individual computers for use 
4463 In this model individual computer users can always gain access to the latest programmes and do not need to store more software than they are currently using on their computers at any one time also saving costs of memory and storage 
4464 Chris Zuleeg a veteran of Apple and a former JavaSoft marketing manager is vice president of marketing at Internet Startup whose Web site is www.internetstartup.com 
4465 Bessemer has funded numerous Internet pioneers including PSI Net VeriSign and Individual 
4466 GOLF MICKELSON WINS FOURTH TITLE OF YEAR IN AKRON 
4467 AKRON Ohio 1996-08-25 
4468 Phil Mickelson birdied two of the last three holes to win World Series of Golf by three strokes over Billy Mayfair on Sunday 
4469 It was the fourth tournament title this year for Mickelson who shot an even-par 70 after being tied for the lead with Billy Mayfair with three holes to play 
4470 Along with Mayfiar at 277 for the tournament were Steve Stricker who had a 68 and Duffy Waldorf with a 66 
4471 It was very hard to sleep last night because there was so much I could accomplish with this win said Mickelson who had a three-stroke lead entering the third round 
4472 This was a win I wanted very very much 
4473 Mickelson 's victory gave him a 10 year exemption to the PGA Tour 
4474 The $ 378,000 first place check brings Mickelson back to the top of the money list with $ 1,574,799 won this year 
4475 This is a major championship golf course and for me to perform well on this style of course is a big step up for me in my career and my performance in future majors he said 
4476 Mickelson three-stroke lead was cut to two when Mayfair birdied the course 's only easy hole the par five second hole while Mickelson three-putted for par from 25 feet 
4477 On the back nine Mickelson began driving erratically and poor tee shots resulted in bogeys on the eighth 12th and 13th holes bringing Mickelson back to four under par tied with Mayfair who had parred 14 straight holes after the birdie on no.2 
4478 Mickelson then set up a tap in birdie on the 16th sending a wedge shot to 18 inches 
4479 He had another birdie on the 17th where he his a 6-iron to six feet 
4480 Mayfair bogeyed the 17th missing a five foot par putt and dropped from solo second place to a three way tie for second 
4481 It was the second successive year in which Mayfair has finished runner up in this tournament 
4482 He lost to Greg Norman in sudden death last year 
4483 The defending champion was in contention two behind Mickelson for much of the day until he bogeyed the 13th and 14th holes

4862 MOTORCYCLING JAPANESE WIN BOTH ROUND NINE SUPERBIKE RACES 
4863 SUGO Japan 1996-08-25 
4864 Teenager Yuuichi Takeda racing in only his first season outclassed the big names to win the first race in round nine of the world superbike championship on Sunday 
4865 Takeda 18 showed poise far beyond his years to overtake Australian Ducati rider Troy Corser last year 's championship runner-up with four of the 25 laps left 
4866 Honda 's Takeda was pursued past Corser by the Yamaha duo of Noriyuki Haga and Wataru Yoshikawa with Haga briefly taking the lead in the final chicane on the last lap 
4867 But Takeda found one more spurt of power to just take the flag first with Haga second and Yoshikawa third 
4868 Haga had the consolation of recording the fastest lap at 147.159 kph 
4869 Corser who crashed during practice on Friday limped in fourth four seconds behind Takeda with championship leader Aaron Slight of New Zealand 11 seconds behind the winner 
4870 In the second race Takeda again challenged strongly until the fifth lap from the end when he crashed while running second to eventual race winner Takuma Aoki 
4871 Aoki the elder brother of reigning 125cc world champion Haruchika had a race-long duel with John Kocinski of the United States on a Ducati before taking the chequered flag 
4872 Kocinski led for the early laps before he was passed first by Aoki who recorded the fastest lap of 147.786 kph and then by Takeda 
4873 With Takeda out of the race Kocinski regained second place but he could not overtake Aoki 
4874 Haga again was the unlucky rider finishing third ahead of Slight with Corser in 10th place 
4875 But the strong showing by the Japanese riders did not alter the championship table with Slight still leading on 280 points followed by Corser with 269 and Kocinski with 254

4895 CRICKET POLLOCK CONCLUDES WARWICKSHIRE CAREER WITH FLOURISH 
4896 LONDON 1996-08-25 
4897 South African fast bowler Shaun Pollock concluded his Warwickshire career with a flourish on Sunday by taking the final three wickets during the county 's Sunday league victory over Worcestershire 
4898 Pollock who returns home on Tuesday for an ankle operation took the last three wickets in nine balls as Worcestershire were dismissed for 154 
4899 After an hour 's interruption for rain Warwickshire then reached an adjusted target of 109 with 13 balls to spare and record their fifth win in the last six games 
4900 Warwickshire are currently in fourth position behind Yorkshire Nottinghamshire and Surrey 
4901 Yorkshire captain David Byas completed his third Sunday league century as his side swept clear at the top of the table reaching a career best 111 not out against Lancashire 
4902 Lancashire 's total of 205 for eight from 40 overs looked reasonable before Byas put their attack to the sword collecting his runs from just 100 balls with three sixes and nine fours 
4903 Yorkshire eventually reached their target with only four wickets down and 7.5 overs to spare 
4904 SOCCER HINCHCLIFFE CALLED INTO ENGLAND SQUAD 
4905 LONDON 1996-08-25 
4906 England manager Glenn Hoddle called up uncapped Everton defender Andy Hinchcliffe on Sunday to the national squad for the opening World Cup qualifier against Moldova next weekend 
4907 Left-back Hinchcliffe 27 replaces Tottenham 's Darren Anderton who has a recurring groin problem
