8595 TENNIS CHANG WASHINGTON ADVANCE TWO WOMEN 'S SEEDS FALL 
8596 Larry Fine 
8597 NEW YORK 1996-08-26 
8598 Michael Chang is playing in his 10th U.S. Open and enjoying his highest seeding ever but the 24-year-old American had to overcome a case of the jitters Monday before winning his first-round match on opening day 
8599 Chang seeded second behind defending champion Pete Sampras took two hours 40 minutes to defeat 186th-ranked Jaime Oncins of Brazil 3-6 6-1 6-0 7-6 8-6 in the tiebreaker 
8600 I was pretty tight the whole match conceded Chang one of the hottest players on tour this summer with a 16-2 record on hardcourts that included two titles and a runner-up finish 
8601 Everyone has moments when they get tight 
8602 Hopefully this will have been my nerves for the whole tournament 
8603 Joining Chang into the second round was Wimbledon runner-up MaliVai Washington the 11th seed who also needed four sets to get past talented Moroccan Karim Alami 6-4 2-6 7-6 7-5 6-1 
8604 Washington 's win was not comfortable either 
8605 The 27-year-old American hurried off the Stadium Court for treatment of an upset stomach after his two and a half hour struggle against Alami 
8606 Towards the end of my match my stomach felt like week-old sushi said Washington 
8607 Maybe it was a combination of the heat and something I ate 
8608 Chang and Washington were the only men 's seeds in action on a day that saw two seeded women 's players fall 
8609 Australian Open runner-up Anke Huber of Germany the sixth seed was undone by an unlucky draw that put her against 17th ranked South African Amanda Coetzer in her opening match 
8610 Coetzer claimed revenge for the semifinal defeat she suffered to Huber in Melbourne by taking a 6-1 2-6 6-2 victory 
8611 Last year 's Wimbledon junior champion Aleksandra Olsza of Poland removed another seed from the draw by eliminating number 12 Magdalena Maleeva of Bulgaria 6-4 6-2 
8612 Other men 's winners included a pair of former Grand Slam tournament champions whose victories set up a showdown in the second round 
8613 Germany 's Michael Stich the 1991 Wimbledon champion and two-time French Open winner Sergi Bruguera of Spain will face each other next after beating German Tommy Haas 6-3 1-6 6-1 7-5 and Belgian Kris Goossens 6-2 6-0 7-6 7-1 respectively 
8614 Alex O'Brien who scored his first professional title eight days ago in New Haven advanced to the second round with a 6-4 1-6 6-4 6-3 win over Ecuador 's Nicolas Lapentti 
8615 Wimbledon bad boy Jeff Tarango caught a break Monday when he advanced after the retirement of German Alex Radulescu due to heat exhaustion 
8616 Tarango was leading 6-7 5-7 6-4 6-1 3-1 
8617 Chang blamed breezy conditions for some of the erratic play in his match with Oncins who had beaten him in the round of 32 at the 1992 Barcelona Olympics 
8618 Chang committed an untidy 53 unforced errors though he made seven fewer than the Brazilian who also walloped a woeful 24 double faults 
8619 The most deflating double fault came when Oncins was serving to force a fifth set leading 6-4 in the tiebreaker 
8620 The set point came after confusion at the net on the point previous which was awarded to Oncins after the two exchanged shots at close quarters at the net 
8621 First Chang approached the umpire then Oncins then Chang again before play finally resumed 
8622 Those little seconds were like an hour to me said Oncins who promptly fired two serves barely contained by the baseline as he frittered away his best chance 
8623 Chang ran off the next three points to close out the match but for Oncins the contest was a personal victory 
8624 The 26-year-old Brazilian had risen into the top 30 in 1992 
8625 The next year a close friend was struck by a stray bullet while riding home in a car from a soccer game in Sao Paulo 
8626 He died slumped against Oncins who subsequently lost interest in tennis 
8627 Two months ago I started talking about quitting said Oncins who decided to give it one last try and made it through the Open qualifying tournament last weekend 
8628 I believe in my game again he said 
8629 At the end of the day a spate of withdrawals from the tournament were announced 
8630 Eighth seed Jim Courier withdrew because of a bruised right knee and 1988 Open champion Mats Wilander bowed out due to a groin pull organisers said 
8631 Women 's ninth seed Mary Joe Fernandez pulled out because of tendinitis in her right wrist

8637 SOCCER MARSEILLE HOLD AUXERRE TO GOALLESS DRAW 
8638 PARIS 1996-08-27 
8639 Former European champions Marseille held French champions Auxerre to a goalless draw in a lacklustre league match on Tuesday 
8640 The bill looked promising but both sides struggling to find their form early in the season were disappointing 
8641 Auxerre who start their European Cup campaign next week against Ajax Amsterdam dominated the match but were unable to score 
8642 Unbeaten in four matches they still trail leaders Lens by one point 
8643 Lens who have won all their three league matches so far host Montpellier on Wednesday night 
8644 Despite another dismal performance especially in defence Marseille restored some pride by keeping the reigning champions at bay after losing 2-1 at home to Metz last Saturday 
8645 After two seasons in the second division and after taking on half a dozen new recruits this season some of whom do not speak a word of French Marseille are not playing with any fluidity 
8646 But German international goalkeeper Andreas Koepke again proved a sound investment when under pressure from the Auxerre strikers saving his team with a number of fine parries 
8647 Marseille now lie seventh in the league on five points

8729 SOCCER NEUCHATEL TO APPEAL AGAINST CYPRIEN 'S NINE-MONTH BAN 
8730 GENEVA 1996-08-27 
8731 Swiss league leaders Neuchatel Xamax said on Tuesday they would appeal against a nine-month ban imposed on French international defender Jean-Pierre Cyprien for his part in a post-match brawl 
8732 Cyprien also fined 10,000 Swiss francs $ 8,400 traded punches with St Gallen 's Brazilian player Claudio Moura after a match on Saturday 
8733 When officials and coaching staff tried to intervene Cyprien launched a flying kick at Moura but only succeeded in kneeing St Gallen coach Roger Hegi in the stomach 
8734 Moura who appeared to have elbowed Cyprien in the final minutes of the 3-0 win by Neuchatel was suspended for seven matches and fined 1,000 francs $ 840 by the Swiss league disciplinary committee 
8735 Club president Gilbert Facchinetti said he was astonished the committee had arrived at its decision so quickly and vowed the club would appeal 
8736 Neuchatel coach Gilbert Gress described the incident as shocking but said Moura was also to blame 
8737 Moura physically and verbally provoked Cyprien during the match 
8738 The referee could not have seen it or he would have punished him Gress said 
8739 During the scuffle Moura threw the first punch 
8740 Tomorrow if someone punches me I would not know how to react 
8741 Cyprien who won his one French cap against Italy in February 1994 cannot play in Switzerland or elsewhere until May next year 
8742 CYCLING BUGNO CLEARED OF DOPING 
8743 MILAN 1996-08-27 
8744 Veteran Italian Gianni Bugno has been cleared of doping after testing positive for high levels of testosterone during the Tour of Switzerland in June the Italian cycling federation said on Tuesday 
8745 He has been cleared 
8746 The case is closed a spokesman said 
8747 Bugno tested positive for the banned hormone after the fifth stage of the Tour in which he finished third overall 
8748 But the spokesman said subsequent tests in Cologne proved his body produced higher-than-average testosterone levels naturally 
8749 Bugno who won the Giro d'Italia in 1990 and two successive world titles was banned for three months in 1994 after testing positive for the stimulant caffeine

8774 COFINEC SLIPS ON BUDAPEST BOURSE BUT FUTURE STRONG 
8775 Emese Bartha 
8776 BUDAPEST 1996-08-27 
8777 Expectations that Cofinec S.A. the Hungarian bourse 's first foreign listing will report a disappointing first half have depressed the stock below its issue price but analysts expect a rebound in the long term 
8778 The first half of the year is unlikely to be as strong as expected so the company will probably be unable to reach its annual plan in 1996 said Gabor Sitanyi a London-based analyst for ING Barings 
8779 The French-registered packaging materials company which floated its shares in Hungary in July for most of the past two weeks hovered below the 6,425 forints Global Depositary Receipts price of its initial offering which was oversubscribed 
8780 The company which asked for a two-week delay from the usual August 15 deadline for reporting first-half results closed on Tuesday at 5,800 forints down 300 
8781 Cofinec 's first-half figures will be 
8782 between one-third of two-fifths of its annual plan said Tamas Erdei a Budapest-based analyst for ABN-AMRO Hoare Govett 
8783 Analysts blame at least partly Hungary 's macroeconomic environment for the weaker figures for Cofinec which operating in Hungary Poland and the Czech Republic now generates about 55 to 60 percent of its annual sales from Hungary 
8784 Hungary 's Gross Domestic Product fell one percentage point in the first quarter while real wages plunged 7.2 percentage points in the first half of 1996 
8785 Both will have their impact on Cofinec 's figures the analysts said 
8786 Despite the current difficulties however analysts were convinced that Cofinec 's outlook was strong 
8787 The eastern European market offers good chances said Erdei 
8788 Just like many other companies on the bourse Cofinec has big growth opportunities 
8789 At the same time it 's an advantage for Cofinec that it has a foreign management which perhaps understands the market better Erdei added 
8790 Cofinec is a very good story in the long-term as the per capita packaging consumption is still so low in east Europe that a very strong increase can be expected long-term Sitanyi said saying that several recent moves by Cofinec boosted its position 
8791 Among them he noted that Cofinec had acquired the outstanding stake in its Czech folding company Krpaco a.s. increasing its ownership to 100 percent so in the second half the whole of Krpaco 's figures will be consolidated 
8792 The company also repaid some $ 21 million of debt well above the originally planned $ 8 million to $ 9 million 
8793 In addition its Polish operation began with some six weeks of delay due to cold winter weather and the test run was also longer than planned 
8794 Budapest newsroom 36 1 266 2410

8827 AFTER THE BELL After hours slows in light volume 
8828 NEW YORK 1996-08-27 
8829 Traders said on Tuesday after-hours activity was light 
8830 Both WorldCom Inc and MFS Communications Co Inc were trading but they moved in line with their close 
8831 WorldCom which said it will buy MFS shed 1-3/4 to close at 21 while MFS lost 3-8/16 to close at 41-5/16 
8832 The New York Stock Exchange said its session one volume was 5,700 shares compared to 53,400 shares Monday 
8833 Session two volume was 4,153,800 shares compared to no volume Monday 
8834 The American Stock Exchange said there was no after-hours activity 
8835 CBOE in routine review of MFS options 
8836 CHICAGO 1996-08-27 
8837 The Chicago Board Options Exchange CBOE said on Tuesday it was doing a routine investigation into trading in options on MFS Communications Co Inc shares 
8838 On Monday the company said it had agreed to be acquired by WorldCom Inc in a deal valued at $ 14 billion 
8839 MFS shares surged on the news while WorldCom fell on fears of dilution 
8840 The New York Times said on Tuesday some of the options trading in MFS last Friday may suggest insider trading 
8841 MFS options also trade on the American Stock Exchange and the Pacific Stock Exchange 
8842 A spokesman for the American Stock Exchange would neither confirm or deny whether the exchange was looking into trading 
8843 If there is unusual activity certainly we look at it but that 's not to say we 're doing anything official he said 
8844 Pacific Stock Exchange officials were not available 
8845 One trader said trading in MFS options had increased steadily from about mid-August and doubted whether any of last Friday 's activity was insider trading 
8846 Derivatives desk 312 408-8750 E-mail derivatives@reuters.com 
8847 Faulding target of patent lawsuit 
8848 ELIZABETH N.J. 1996-08-27 
8849 Faulding Inc said on Tuesday Purdue Frederick Co filed a patent infringement lawsuit against Faulding and its Purepac Pharamceutical unit 
8850 The suit was filed because of Purepac 's manufacture of Kadian a sustained release morphine product Faulding said 
8851 Faulding said the claims in the lawsuit are without merit and will not impact upon the launch of Kadian in the United States 
8852 Kadian was approved for sale in the United States last month Faulding said 
8853 Zeneca Group Plc which will market Kadian was named in the lawsuit with F.H. Faulding & Co the majority shareholder of Faulding Inc the company said 
8854 McGrath left out of Ireland World Cup squad 
8855 DUBLIN 1996-08-27 
8856 Ireland 's most experienced player defender Paul McGrath was left out of the national squad for the first time in 11 years on Tuesday when new manager Mick McCarthy named his side to face Liechtenstein in a World Cup qualifier 
8857 The 36-year-old Aston Villa player won the last of his Irish record of 82 international caps against the Czech Republic in Prague in April 
8858 Paul accepted the situation 
8859 He has n't played any first-team games for Villa this season and he 's not the type of player I would have brought on as a substitute McCarthy said 
8860 But he surprised me in training over the last two days because of his involvement 
8861 He 's certainly is still very much part of my plans for the future 
8862 At 24 25 or 26 you could get away with it not having played first-team games 
8863 But at 36 it would be asking too much of Paul he said 
8864 Also omitted from the 20-man squad which will travel to Vaduz for Saturday 's group eight match are central defenders Alan Kernaghan and Liam Daish 
8865 Leeds United defender Gary Kelly is unable to travel because of a knee injury picked up in Monday 's 1-0 victory over Wimbledon at Elland Road 
8866 Since taking over from Jack Charlton in February McCarthy has played largely experimental sides and seen them lose five times draw twice and win just once 
8867 Squad Alan Kelly Shay Given Denis Irwin Phil Babb Jeff Kenna Curtis Fleming Gary Breen Ian Harte Kenny Cunningham Steve Staunton Andy Townsend Ray Houghton Gareth Farrelly Alan McLoughlin Jason McAteer Alan Moore Keith O'Neill Tony Cascarino Niall Quinn David Kelly

8869 S. African apartheid killer convicted of six murders 
8870 PRETORIA 1996-08-27 
8871 South African apartheid killer Eugene de Kock was found guilty of murder and attempted murder on Tuesday a day after he was convicted of five other murders 
8872 De Kock 48 a former police colonel who commanded a hit-squad that wiped out opponents of apartheid is the most senior servant of white rule yet to face justice 
8873 Sudanese rebels say missionaries should be freed 
8874 Peter Smerdon 
8875 NAIROBI 1996-08-27 
8876 The main rebel group in south Sudan said on Tuesday it was trying to arrange the release of six Roman Catholic missionaries including three Australian nuns held for nearly two weeks 
8877 George Garang Nairobi spokesman for the Sudan People 's Liberation Army SPLA said it was urgently trying to contact SPLA commander Nuour Marial at Mapourdit in the south to free the six 
8878 The movement is making arrangements for them to be set free 
8879 This is a decision of the leadership Garang said 
8880 Commander Nuour Marial is a soldier so he must accept the leadership 's decision 
8881 But communications at this time of year are very difficult because of rains and a lack of power he added 
8882 The Catholic Information Office in Nairobi said on Monday that four of the six had been charged by the SPLA with spying spreading Islam and hindering recruitment into the rebel group 
8883 These charges are the interpretation of the church Garang said on Tuesday 
8884 We have no idea why they are being held 
8885 We are still trying to establish contact with the local commander 
8886 Asked whether this meant the commander was out of control Garang said the rebel movement was working on the problem 
8887 He said he believed all six were being held in the mission compound at Mapourdit and were reported to be in good health 
8888 The Catholic Information office in Nairobi said on Monday that Australian Sisters Moira Lynch 73 and Mary Batchelor 68 American Father Michael Barton 48 and Sudanese Father Raphael Riel 48 were held in a prison in south Sudan by the SPLA 
8889 It said Australian Sister Maureen Carey 52 and Italian Brother Raniero Iacomella 28 were held inside the compound 
8890 The church in Australia said on Monday Lynch Batchelor Barton and Riel were held in a prison until the weekend when they were moved to join the other captives at the compound 
8891 The Catholic Information Office said the SPLA in the Kenyan capital had attributed the detentions of the six to a local commander and had promised they would be freed by August 23 
8892 But the church learned in a recent meeting with the local commander that no instructions to release the prisoners were received and they would be held until investigations were completed 
8893 It said last Friday they were visited by Monsignor Caesar Mazzolari apostolic administrator of the diocese of Rumbek in southern Sudan and an SPLA administrator and appeared in good condition 
8894 On August 17 the mission was surrounded by the SPLA and sealed off 
8895 The evening of the same day the missionaries were put in prison or isolation 
8896 Later the mission was looted it added 
8897 An Australian foreign ministry official said the charges against them were fairly bizarre and a matter for concern 
8898 He said Australian diplomats in Nairobi were working with the Roman Catholic church in southern Sudan and with U.S. and Italian diplomats in the region to help free the missionaries 
8899 The SPLA has fought Khartoum 's government forces in the south since 1983 for greater autonomy or independence of the mainly Christian and animist region from the Moslem Arabised north 
8900 OSCE postpones Bosnian municipal elections 
8901 SARAJEVO 1996-08-27 
8902 The U.S. diplomat in charge of elections in Bosnia announced on Tuesday that voting for municipal assemblies would be postponed because of irregularities by the Serbs in registering voters 
8903 Ambassador Robert Frowick representing the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe OSCE told reporters that municipal polls due on September 14 with other Bosnian elections would be put off 
8904 I have made a chairman 's decision that it is not feasible to hold municipal elections on September 14 said Frowick 
8905 He said no exact date had been set but it was possible the local elections would take place in the spring of 1997 
8906 According to OSCE officials Serb authorities have pressed their refugees to register to vote in towns now under Serb control but which used to have Moslem majorities 
8907 Human rights workers say authorities in Serbia and Bosnian Serb territory have conducted a well-organised campaign to coerce refugees into registering only on Serb territory and failed to inform them of their rights under the Dayton peace agreement 
8908 Diplomats say the effect of the electoral engineering would be to establish political control over districts they conquered and ethnically cleansed in war 
8909 The response of the Bosnian Serbs to the OSCE 's announcement was not immediately clear 
8910 But Bosnian Serb leaders have hinted they would boycott the poll if the municipal elections were postponed or go ahead with their own 
8911 The Bosnian Serb cabinet in a letter to the OSCE said on Monday that any delay of local elections would be a direct and flagrant violation fo the Dayton agreement 
8912 The Serbs who administer half of Bosnia in a Serb republic said they had met all conditions for holding the September elections 
8913 Diplomats fear that the crisis could cast doubt over the entire election process which already appears set to confirm Bosnia 's ethnic partition rather than its reintegration as the Dayton peace agreement had planned 
8914 New talks in Chechnya as Lebed waits for Yeltsin 
8915 Dmitry Kuznets 
8916 NOVYE ATAGI Russia 1996-08-27 
8917 Russian and rebel military commanders finally met in Chechnya on Tuesday for delayed talks aimed at finalising a ceasefire arranged last week by President Boris Yeltsin 's envoy Alexander Lebed 
8918 The Russian army commander in the region General Vyacheslav Tikhomirov arrived at the rebel-held village of Novye Atagi some 20 km 12 miles south of the Chechen capital Grozny for discussions with rebel chief-of-staff Aslan Maskhadov 
8919 But Lebed himself the Kremlin security chief is still waiting back in Moscow to meet Yeltsin over his plans for a lasting political settlement in Chechnya 
8920 Itar-Tass news agency quoted the Kremlin press service as saying Yeltsin who left for a state holiday home near Moscow on Monday would hold no working meetings on Tuesday 
8921 Lebed interrupted talks with Chechnya 's separatists on a political deal on Sunday saying he had to consult with Yeltsin 
8922 After a meeting failed to materialise on Monday Lebed 's spokesman said he might meet the president on Tuesday 
8923 But Yeltsin 's spokesman rebuffed the suggestion saying the president had left Moscow for a holiday near the capital 
8924 The Russians postponed the talks after a Chechen band disarmed a column of interior ministry troops on Sunday 
8925 The Chechens said a renegade group seized the weapons and said on Monday they had all been returned 
8926 The Russian command insisted that not all the weapons were the same as those taken 
8927 Tass said the weapons and the practical implementation of the ceasefire signed by Lebed and Maskhadov last Thursday would be on the agenda of today 's talks 
8928 Neither spoke to reporters before the meeting which started around 10.45 a.m. 0645 GMT 
8929 Also in Novye Atagi on Tuesday morning was Tim Guldimann the Swiss diplomat who heads the Chechnya mission of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe OSCE 
8930 Guldimann who helped broker an earlier truce in May was not taking part in the Tikhomirov-Maskhadov talks 
8931 Lebed 's peace mission this month has stopped some of the worst fighting of the 20-month-old conflict 
8932 However tension on the ground indicates that it could falter if the momentum for a settlement is not maintained 
8933 Three Russian servicemen were wounded in a total of six shooting incidents overnight Itar-Tass news agency quoted the Russian military as saying on Tuesday morning 
8934 RIA news agency quoted an army source accusing rebel fighters of failing to turn up for joint Russian-Chechen police patrols in some districts of the capital Grozny on Tuesday 
8935 But the separatist command told Interfax news agency the patrols part of the truce brokered by Lebed last week would begin on Tuesday after delays for technical reasons 
8936 Yeltsin 's spokesman said he might meet officials during his break but indicated Lebed was low on the list by saying Yeltsin would need time to study the proposals before talking to him 
8937 Russian news agencies also quoted the Kremlin spokesman as saying that Lebed 's representatives had not sought a meeting hinting at an attempt by the president to put his popular and outspoken protege in his place with a lesson on protocol 
8938 Yeltsin 65 has kept a low profile since he was reelected in July prompting new speculation that the two heart attacks he suffered last year and a rumoured drinking problem could be taking their toll weakening his grip on affairs of state 
8939 Aides have dismissed such speculation insisting that he simply needs a rest after his energetic election campaign 
8940 Some analysts say the Kremlin leader whose order sending troops and tanks into Chechnya in 1994 started Russia 's ill-fated military campaign could merely be reluctant to put his name to a peace process which might fall apart 
8941 But Lebed who has no real power without his boss and has hinted at dark forces in Moscow working against him appears to think a deal will not stick without strong backing from Yeltsin 
8942 His proposals have not been spelled out but are expected to involve a compromise between the separatists demand for independence and Moscow 's insistence that Chechnya remain part of the Russian Federation 
8943 Slovenia and Poland target EU NATO membership 
8944 LJUBLJANA 1996-08-27 
8945 Slovenia and Poland pledged to intensify cooperation on Tuesday and reinforced their determination to join the European Union and NATO at the earliest possible date 
8946 Polish President Aleksander Kwasniewski and his Slovenian counterpart Milan Kucan met for talks at the start of a two-day visit to Slovenia by Kwasniewski 
8947 It was their fourth meeting this year 
8948 They said in a statement they agreed to have regular telephone contact to discuss progress in strengthening ties with the West 
8949 We expect our cooperation will help both countries towards entering the European Union and NATO Kwasniewski said 
8950 We have similar ambitions as far as our internal development and international life is concerned Kucan said 
8951 Poland and Slovenia are hoping to be among the first group of former eastern bloc countries to join the European Union and NATO 
8952 They have already signed an association agreement with the European Union and are both part of the Central European Free Trade Area which also comprises Hungary Slovakia and the Czech Republic 
8953 Slovenia 's trade with Poland rose to $ 142.3 million in 1995 from $ 118.8 million in 1994 
8954 During his visit to Slovenia Kwasniewski is also scheduled to meet Prime Minister Janez Drnovsek representatives of Slovenian political parties and representatives of the Chamber of Economy 
8955 Nationalists want Iliescu ousted for Hungary pact 
8956 BUCHAREST 1996-08-27 
8957 Junior Nationalist members of Romania 's ruling coalition called on Tuesday for the impeachment of President Ion Iliescu for backing a friendship treaty with neighbouring Hungary 
8958 Iliescu 's Party of Social Democracy the senior coalition partner immediately dismissed the National Unity Party PUNR demand as crude electioneering 
8959 It is a desperate move by the PUNR which is losing its only reason for existing ahead of the electoral campaign said PDSR executive president Adrian Nastase 
8960 This treaty is both necessary and good Nastase said adding that the PUNR 's stance was threatening its position in the government 
8961 The treaty agreed unexpectedly two weeks ago will end years of disputes over the status of Romania 's large ethnic Hungarian minority 
8962 It will also boost both countries chances of admission to NATO and the European Union 
8963 If they the PUNR are so vexed they could leave the government 
8964 We might also help them to do it if they go on like this he said 
8965 The PUNR holds four key ministries justice transport agriculture and communications 
8966 PUNR leader Gheorghe Funar said in a statement Iliescu in power since the fall of communism in 1989 should be impeached for treason for compromising on the issue of ethnic Hungarian minority rights in the treaty due to be signed next month 
8967 Funar 's call came on the eve of the official launch of Iliescu 's campaign for a new term at November 3 polls 
8968 His appeal to the opposition to back his attempt to oust Iliescu was unlikely to succeed analysts said 
8969 Iliescu has invited political leaders to a meeting on Thursday to discuss the final form of the pact which both Romanian and Hungarian nationalists oppose for different reasons 
8970 Presidential officials were not available to comment on the call for Iliescu 's impeachment 
8971 Estonian MPS see little hope of electing president 
8972 Belinda Goldsmith 
8973 TALLINN 1996-08-27 
8974 Estonia 's parliament failed for a second time to elect a president on Tuesday dealing a blow to incumbent Lennart Meri and pushing the country towards stalemate in its choice of a new head of state 
8975 Neither Meri who oversaw Estonia 's first steps into statehood after the collapse of the Soviet Union nor his arch-rival former communist Arnold Ruutel have secured the 68 votes necessary from the 101-member parliament 
8976 Meri garnered 49 votes and Meri 34 in Tuesday 's ballot for the five-year presidency of Estonia 
8977 A third and final vote was due to be held when parliament reconvened on Tuesday but legislators were not expecting a clear result 
8978 If there is no result the decision will be ceded to an electoral college 
8979 The votes are a strong message to Meri that he is not favoured by some politicians any more Reform Party head Heiki Kranich told Reuters 
8980 Under a constitution agreed in 1992 a year after independence the president has no executive powers 
8981 His only political role is to smoothe the functioning of government in periods of crisis 
8982 But Meri 67 has been accused in parliament of taking too much power and not always consulting parliamentarians before making decisions 
8983 His relations with a leftist-led government have sometimes been tense 
8984 His support in the first round of voting on Monday was much lower than expected scoring only 45 votes which political analysts put down as a vote of no confidence in his performance 
8985 This support only inched up to 49 in the second vote 
8986 Support for Ruutel 68 remained constant at 34 votes 
8987 If the third vote fails to give either Meri or Ruutel 68 votes the parliamentary speaker will convene an electoral college of 101 MPs and 273 local goverment representatives to hold a new poll that could include new nominations 
8988 This would be the first time that the former Soviet republic has had to call together an electoral college 
8989 In its first presidential election in 1992 Meri won the necessary votes in in a parliamentary election against Ruutel 
8990 Parliamentary organisers said the exact timetable remained unclear but it would probably take about a month to organise an electoral college which could also hold several rounds of voting before a clear winner emerges 
8991 Estonia assembly fails to elect state president 
8992 TALLINN 1996-08-27 
8993 The Estonian parliament failed for a third and final time to elect a new state president on Tuesday refusing a second mandate for incumbent Lennart Meri 
8994 Neither Meri nor his rival Arnold Ruutel could garner the 68 votes needed from the 101 members of parliament to become president 
8995 In the third vote Meri won 52 and Ruutel won 32 votes 
8996 The final decision will now be made by a larger assembly 
8997 Meri won 49 in a second vote earlier on Tuesday and 45 in the first on Monday 
8998 Ruutel won 34 votes in the first two secret ballots 
8999 Enn Markvart chairman of the National Election Commission said 96 members of parliament cast votes with one ballot paper invalid and 11 abstentions 
9000 The election will now go before an electoral college involving MPs and local government representatives that will be convened by the parliamentary Speaker in the next day or so 
9001 It could take up to a month before a new vote but the timetable is not yet clear 
9002 This is the first time the former Soviet republic has had to convene such a group

9008 Thompson has denied the charges 
9009 He could face up to five years in jail if convicted

9011 The prosecutor 's office said no date had yet been set for a trial to begin as investigations had first to be completed 
9012 The British embassy in Tirana said it had sent an embassy official to talk to Thompson who is being held in jail 
9013 The age of consent for heterosexual and homosexual sex in Albania is 14 
9014 A large number of destitute children can be seen begging in the streets of impoverished Albania especially in towns and resorts visited by foreigners

9016 TALLINN 1996-08-27 
9017 Estonia 's parliament again failed to elect a new state president on Tuesday when neither of two candidates secured a majority in second-round voting 
9018 Incumbent president Lennart Meri won 49 votes compared to 34 won by his rival deputy Parliamentary Speaker Arnold Ruutel 
9019 But Meri 's support was not enough for the 68 needed for election and a third secret ballot will take place later in the day 1300 GMT parliamentary officials said

9022 On Monday in the first round of voting Meri secured 45 votes and Ruutel 34 
9023 Meri 's popularity has suffered in recent years with politicians criticising him for taking too much power and acting without consulting parliament 
9024 If a third round of voting fails to give either candidate 68 votes the parliamentary speaker has to convene an electoral college of all 101 MPs and 273 local government representatives for a new vote that could take up to a month

9074 We have not had contact with the kidnappers nor do we have any leads to take us to where they might be held Chief of Judicial Police Manuel Alvarado told Reuters 
9075 Hurte Sierd Zylstra and his wife Jetsi Hendrika Coers both 50 were abducted from the teak plantation they managed late Saturday or early Sunday by at least two men demanding $ 1.5 million ransom authorities said

9106 Brazil likely to turn Banespa federal bank paper 
9107 SAO PAULO 1996-08-27 
9108 Brazil is likely to turn Sao Paulo state bank Banespa into a federal bank in a prior step to privatization according to unnamed government sources O Globo daily said 
9109 The newspaper said the Central Bank special administration of Banespa ends in December 30 and after that the bank has to be liquidated or turned into a federal bank since there are no conditions to return Banespa to Sao Paulo state government 
9110 A Central Bank spokesman said he could not confirm or deny the report 
9111 Banespa has been under central bank special temporary administration since December 1994 
9112 The central bank management could be lifted if Sao Paulo state decided to take part in the recent federal government 's plan to restructure state banks 
9113 Under the plan the federal government would provide 100 percent of the financing needed to restructure debt of state banks being privatized liquidated or turned into development banks 
9114 It also offers to refinance up to 50 percent of the debt held by state banks whose governments decide to keep control of their banks 
9115 Although the plan was designed under terms proposed by Sao Paulo state governor Mario Covas he has showed no interest in taking part in the plan because Sao Paulo 's debt with Banespa has increased sharply O Globo said 
9116 Sao Paulo state 's debt is now estimated at 19 billion reais 
9117 O Globo also said another delicate case to be solved involves private bank Bamerindus 
9118 The newspaper said Bamerindus has sent to the Central Bank a proposal for restructuring combined with a request for a 90-day credit line paying four percent a year plus the Basic Interest Rate of the Central Bank TBC 
9119 O Globo also said the loan would give Bamerindus time to sell assets 
9120 Bamerindus Brazil 's fourth-largest private bank has been facing liquidity troubles 
9121 Bamerindus declined to comment on negotiations being held with the Central Bank

9129 Former Argentine benevolent dictator Alejandro Lanusse dies 
9130 BUENOS AIRES 1996-08-26 
9131 Alejandro Lanusse the former dictator who ruled Argentina for two years died at age 78 on Monday 
9132 Lanusse died after being brought to a hospital a week ago following a fall at home that resulted in a blood clot in the brain 
9133 He was operated on earlier in the week but failed to recover from surgery 
9134 The former dictator who ruled from 1971 to 1973 was best known for allowing Juan Domingo Peron Argentina 's famed populist leader to return to Argentina after 17 years of forced exile 
9135 Lanusse took over the leadership of the country after five years of dictatorship 
9136 But unlike his two predecessors Juan Carlos Ongania and Marcelo Levingston who ruled Argentina with an iron hand Lanusse steered the country toward democracy 
9137 That resulted in general elections in March 1973 when the Peronists led by Hector Campora and Vicente Solano Lima returned to power 
9138 Lanusse was a candidate in the election but failed to defeat his old adversories and never returned to public office 
9139 He was imprisoned for four years in 1951 for taking part in a coup attempt to overthrow Peron led by General Benjamin Menendez 
9140 Lanusse 's rule saw the gradual rise of left-wing activism which culminated in another period of brutal Argentine dictatorship from 1976 to 1983 during which the military launched its dirty war that resulted in 10,000 missing people 
9141 In his autobiography published in 1990 Lanusse described himself as a military man with democratic ideas 
9142 He was born in Buenos Aires in 1918 and married Ileana Bell with whom he had nine children 
9143 He entered the Military College in 1935

9148 It said the liner was heading to Dalian from the northern port of Tianjin it said 
9149 Dalian port officials contacted by telephone confirmed the collision but gave no further details

9184 Leon Barkho 
9185 BAGHDAD 1996-08-27 
9186 A new U.N. relief coordinator has arrived in Baghdad to take up the task of organising humanitarian goods distribution and to face Iraq 's continuing opposition over the number of international monitors to be involved 
9187 U.N. and diplomatic sources said on Tuesday that Secretary- General Boutros Boutros-Ghali had appointed Italian Gualtiero Fulcheri and sent him to Iraq last week to replace Moroccan Mohamed Zejjari 
9188 One diplomat said Iraq and U.N. were still in disagreement on how many international observers would be required to ascertain the equitable distribution of humanitarian supplies that will be procured under Baghdad 's oil deal with U.N

9191 Baghdad holds that the Iraq-U.N. memorandum of understanding on partial oil sales signed last June does not specify how many foreign observers should be stationed in Iraq 
9192 Observation of food supplies and their distribution are still a major issue and seems the two sides have not yet filled the gap separating them said another diplomat 
9193 Iraq 's partial oil sales pact with U.N. allowing crude exports worth $ 2 billion every six months gives U.N. the right to supervise the purchase and distribution of food supplies in the country 
9194 The deal is a humanitarian exception to the U.N. sanctions imposed on Iraq for invading Kuwait in 1990 which include a ban on its oil exports 
9195 Fulcheri declined comment on the differences between the U.N. and Iraq saying only There are several different things which still need to be done 
9196 Fulcheri started his U.N. career in 1960 and has long experience in U.N. emergency relief in Congo Angola Sudan and Somalia 
9197 Kansas feedlot cattle market quiet no sales USDA 
9198 DODGE CITY 1996-08-27 
9199 Trade was quiet with no sales slaughter steers or heifers confirmed 
9200 Inquiry and demand very light 
9201 Sales confirmed week to date on 4,200 head mostly previously contracted or formulated cattle 
9202 Confirmed none

9204 Anti-abortion speaker praises Democrat tolerance 
9205 Alan Elsner 
9206 CHICAGO 1996-08-27 
9207 An anti-abortion politician addressed the Democratic convention on Tuesday but praised the overwhelmingly pro-abortion rights party for its tolerance of his minority views 
9208 Rep 
9209 Tony Hall of Ohio said he and other Democrats who opposed abortion had always felt left out in their own party 
9210 But this year is different 
9211 For the first time the Democratic Party has included in our platform a conscience clause he said 
9212 The clause recognizes and welcomes Democrats with divergent views on abortion and states they have a full part to play at all levels of the party 
9213 The Democratic Party is indeed the party of true inclusiveness Hall said 
9214 At its convention four years ago organizers prevented then Pennsylvania Gov 
9215 Robert Casey a vehement opponent of abortion from speaking 
9216 Republicans have used their decision as an example of Democrat intolerance ever since 
9217 Casey told a news conference in Chicago on Tuesday he had asked to speak again this year but was turned down 
9218 Democratic leaders said there was not room on the program for every retired governor to speak 
9219 I believe the Democratic party ought to be pro-woman pro-child and pro-life Casey said 
9220 I asked for the opportunity to deliver this message from the podium of the Democrat National Convention 
9221 For the second time in four years my request fell on deaf ears he said 
9222 The Republican Party whose platform calls for making all abortions illegal faced a similar dilemma this year when Massachusetts Gov 
9223 William Weld asked to deliver a speech defending abortion rights and was turned down 
9224 Bob Dole the Republican presidential nominee tried and failed to insert a tolerance clause in his party 's platform recognizing the validity of those within the party who supported abortion rights 
9225 Democrats also heard Tuesday two passionate speeches defending abortion rights 
9226 Kate Michelman president of the National Abortion Rights Action League described how she had an abortion at a time when the procedure was illegal after her husband abandoned her with three young children 
9227 I 'm here to speak up for choice and to speak for truth 
9228 The message from the Republican Party is one of disdain 
9229 Their answer to choice is control and punishment 
9230 Our answer is trust compassion and respect she said 
9231 Georgia Rep 
9232 Cynthia McKinney said You make your moral decisions 
9233 I 'll make mine and let 's leave Republican House Speaker Newt Gingrich out of it 
9234 U.S. Spring White Wheat Bids mostly steady 
9235 CHICAGO 1996-08-27 
9236 Dark northern spring and white wheat bids were mostly steady on Tuesday but a few locations quoted weaker values as newly harvested spring wheat flooded the market several cash grain dealers said 
9237 There 's too much nearby wheat coming into the market so we 're backing off the basis to slow it down a Montana dealer said 
9238 Bids there dropped 10 cents per bushel 
9239 Harvest was also progressing well in parts of North Dakota but one dealer there said new crop movement remained limited to a steady trickle 
9240 We 're seeing some new crop coming in now but it 's slow going the dealer said 
9241 Elsewhere basis values were mostly steady in quiet conditions with little noteworty domestic or export business dealers said 
9242 Durum bids were steady after jumping 50 cents per bushel in some areas on Monday

9294 Stallone fiancee have baby girl 
9295 MIAMI 1996-08-27 
9296 Actor Sylvester Stallone and his fiancee model Jennifer Flavin had a baby girl on Tuesday Stallone 's publicist said 
9297 The 7-pound 4-ounce 3.3 kg girl named Sophia Rose was born shortly after midnight at South Miami Hospital publicist Paul Bloch said

9300 Poll shows Clinton lead over Dole jumps to 15 pts 
9301 CHICAGO 1996-08-27 
9302 An ABC News poll released on Tuesday showed President Bill Clinton 's lead over Republican challenger Bob Dole stretching to 15 points in advance of the Nov. 5 election 
9303 The poll taken on Sunday and Monday as the president engaged in a whistle-stop train trip to the Democratic Convention in Chicago put Clinton at 51 percent Dole at 36 percent and Ross Perot of the Reform Party at 8 percent 
9304 A similar poll conducted on Saturday and Sunday had showed a nine point lead for Clinton ahead by 47-38 percent 
9305 Dole down by around 20 points in early August in ABC polls had closed to within four percentage points immediately after the Republican convention in San Diego earlier in August 
9306 Other polls also showed a strong Dole bounce after San Diego but Clinton then rebuilding his lead 
9307 Tuesday 's poll involved 1,002 registered voters and had a margin of error of 3.5 percentage points 
9308 ABC said a parallel poll of 824 likely voters showed the president ahead by 11 points with Clinton at 50 percent Dole at 39 percent and Perot at 6 percent 
9309 The poll of registered voters showed a shift in favor of the Democrats in the elections for House of Representatives with 51 percent saying that if the vote were today they would go for a Democrat and 41 percent opting for a Republican 
9310 That compared with the previous poll 's 48-43 lead for the Democrats 
9311 The poll gave Clinton a 53 percent to 39 percent lead over Dole if Perot were not in the race 
9312 The poll indicated a fall in the number of people who believed Dole would be able to fulfil his promise to cut the federal budget deficit and cut income taxes by 15 percent at the same time 
9313 It showed 23 percent believed it possible compared to 70 who believed it was n't 
9314 That compared to 26-57 in the previous poll 
9315 U.S. bulk millfeeds Immediate supply tight 
9316 CHICAGO 1996-08-27 
9317 Millfeed supplies for prompt shipment remained tight and prices continued to move higher millfeed dealers said 
9318 High-priced corn and increased demand for livestock feed continued to support millfeed prices in nearly all sectors 
9319 Flour mills sold much of their production through September leaving little available for prompt shipment 
9320 Portland sources said feed mixer demand was keeping pace with millfeed production and driving prices higher 
9321 Portland sources said with corn priced there at $ 200 per ton and barley at $ 140 the millfeeds at $ 125 represent a good value 
9322 In the southeast U.S. dealers said feed mixers continued to be steady buyers with demand increasing for October to March positions 
9323 The closely-watched Kansas City rail market was steady at $ 115 per ton bid and $ 118 offered 
9324 Chicago newsdesk 312-408-8720-- 
9325 Puerto Rico girl has surgery for hairy face 
9326 PHILADELPHIA 1996-08-27 
9327 A two-year old Puerto Rican girl began surgical treatment on Tuesday for a rare condition that has left half of her face covered with a hairy dark-brown patch of skin 
9328 The girl Abyss DeJesus suffers from a hairy nevus on the right side of her face a condition that has only been reported a few times in medical journals the St. Christopher Children 's Hospital said 
9329 In addition to social ostracism the condition also carries a high risk of cancer 
9330 It will be corrected by gradually expanding healthy skin with a surgical balloon then transplanting that skin to the afflicted side of her face 
9331 She is doing well hospital spokeswoman Carol Norris said 
9332 The surgery is under way 
9333 Norris said Tuesday 's surgery involved placing five balloons in DeJesus 's forehead shoulders and the back of her neck and partially filling them with a saline solution 
9334 More saline solution will be inserted in 16 weekly treatments 
9335 The girl who was accompanied to Philadelphia by her parents will need more surgery later to correct the condition on her chest back and legs the hospital said

9342 Massachusetts home sales dip in July report 
9343 BOSTON 1996-08-27 
9344 Home sales across Massachusetts were down 2.3 percent in July compared to a month earlier but up 21 percent for the year according to the Massachusetts Association of Realtors 
9345 The association said a total of 4,464 single-family homes were sold in July compared to 4,570 in June 
9346 The average selling price $ 206,464 was up 10.6 percent over July 1995 
9347 Condominium sales edged up 6.0 percent for July and 24.8 percent for the year the group said while prices for condos nudged up less than 1.0 percent to an average of $ 123,394 
9348 In July the average rate on a 30-year fixed rate mortgage was 8.25 percent below June 's 8.32 percent but still higher than February 's 7.03 percent the report noted

9350 Amtrak train derails three injured officials 
9351 MONTPELIER Vt 
9352 1996-08-27 
9353 At least three people were injured when an Amtrak passenger train slammed into an empty logging truck and derailed Tuesday officials said 
9354 The Vermonter which runs between St. Albans Vermont near the Canadian border and Washington D.C. collided with the truck at 7:51 a.m. EDT near the rural town of Roxbury some 15 miles southeast of the state capital Montpelier Amtrak spokeswoman Maureen Garrity said 
9355 Vermont Central Hospital spokesman Dan Pudvah said two of the injured were treated there the truck driver who was suffering from multiple trauma injuries and a passenger 
9356 Pudvah said he understood other people with minor injuries were being treated at the scene 
9357 Garrity said a train conductor was also injured 
9358 The train 's engine and its six cars derailed but were still standing state police said 
9359 The exact number of passangers on the train was not known 
9360 We had 70 reservations for the train but that does n't mean there were 70 passengers aboard Garrity said 
9361 Uninjured passengers were to be taken by bus to Springfield Massachusetts where they will be put aboard another train to continue their journey to New York City and Washington Garrity said 
9362 She said the train was travelling at 54 mph when it crashed into the truck which was crossing the tracks onto a dirt road in the rural area bordering the Northfield Mountains

9364 PARIS 1996-08-27 
9365 Prime Minister Alain Juppe on Tuesday hailed handicapped athletes who took part in Atlanta 's Paralympic Games as an example for gloom-stricken France 
9366 What we hear every morning is gloom resignation and scepticism 
9367 You are the opposite Juppe told a successful French team at Paris airport as he welcomed them back from the games which followed the July-August Olympics 
9368 If you had been struck 
9369 by the disease of scepticism gloom and resignation you would not be here 
9370 You are a true example for the nation he said 
9371 The French team won 95 medals in Atlanta 35 of them gold 
9372 Opinion polls consistently show French voters pessimistic and fed up as the economy stagnates and unemployement lingers at near-record levels 
9373 French shares end fractionally weaker 
9374 PARIS 1996-08-27 
9375 French shares ended fractionally weaker as unease about union unrest slated for the autumn and a weaker franc got the better of a slight rise on Wall Street 
9376 The blue-chip CAC-40 index ended 2.43 points or 0.12 percent lower at 2,017.99 points after a brief foray into positive territory when the New York stock market opened higher 
9377 The broader SBF-120 index closed 1.19 points or 0.08 percent lower at 1,421.90 points 
9378 Market turnover was 3.8 billion francs about average for the quiet August period including 2.6 billion on the most actively traded CAC-40 shares 
9379 The Socialist CFDT union warned of tension and conflict when France returns to work after the summer break and called for a drive to create up to 500,000 jobs in nine months 
9380 A teachers union the Federation Syndicale Unitaire FSU called for members to protest against job cuts expected in the government 's austerity budget due to be unveiled in September 
9381 Anxieties over the budget niggled the currency markets where the franc lost around half a centime from Monday 's late European levels to 3.4211 per mark 
9382 Index heavyweights Elf and Rhone Poulenc both ended slightly weaker while active Eurotunnel was unchanged on nearly a million shares traded 
9383 People are morose and it 's not the post-holiday period or the budget or company results that are going to lift anyone 's spirits a broker said 
9384 * UIC part of insurer GAN slid 12.19 percent to 55.1 francs after reporting a net attributable first-half loss of 758 million francs after the close on Monday 
9385 Markets were disappointed by a recapitalisation of 800 million francs which commentators said was larger than expected 
9386 * Supermarkets group Carrefour gained 2.19 percent to 2,616 francs after brokers Cheuvreux de Virieu confirmed the stock on their buy list a fund manager said 
9387 * Reinsurance group Scor gained 2.1 percent to 202 francs on news that British insurer Prudential had sold its Mercantile & General reinsurance business to Swiss Re 
9388 * Conglomerate Bollore lost 2.4 percent to 521 francs after a morning trading suspension during which it said it had approved plans to buy out its 73.83 percent owned transport unit Scac Delmas Vileujeux SDV and invited shareholders to tender their shares 
9389 * Alcatel Alsthom fell 1.7 percent to 395.0 
9390 * Opthalmic products manufacturer Essilor gained 2.6 percent to 1,328 francs after Oakley Inc of the United States said it had been granted an option to buy the non-prescription lens production unit of Gentext Optics Inc an Essilor International subsidiary

9418 Mother Teresa turns 86 but still in danger 
9419 Rupam Banerjee 
9420 CALCUTTA 1996-08-27 
9421 Mother Teresa spent her 86th birthday in a Calcutta hospital bed on Tuesday as tributes to the legendary missionary poured in from around the world 
9422 Doctors said that later in the day they would try to wean the Nobel Peace Prize laureate from the respirator that has aided her breathing for the past six days 
9423 Her condition seems to be better but the danger remains as long as she is on respirator an official at Woodlands Nursing Home said 
9424 She is conscious but her breathing is irregular 
9425 The revered Roman Catholic nun was admitted to the Calcutta hospital a week ago with high fever and severe vomiting 
9426 She later suffered heart failure and was diagnosed with malaria 
9427 Her fever has since abated and the heart failure has been brought under control but her heart continues to beat irregularly doctors said 
9428 Unless she breathes on her own I would advise you to keep your fingers crossed said a doctor who was familiar with her case but not part of the six-member team treating Mother Teresa 
9429 The nun 's birthday prompted greetings bouquets and prayers from around the world 
9430 Pope John Paul II and Israeli Foreign Minister David Levy sent her get-well messages the Press Trust of India said 
9431 Ask for a miracle 
9432 Happy Birthday to our Dearest Mother read a placard at the Shishu Bhavan children 's home in central Calcutta run by Mother Teresa 's Missionaries of Charity 
9433 On Monday both houses of India 's parliament wished the nation 's adopted sister a happy birthday and speedy recovery from her illness 
9434 Prayers continued in Calcutta one of the world 's poorest cities where Mother Teresa 's Missionaries of Charity runs several homes for the poor and destitute 
9435 Street children some of them born to prostitutes held prayers on the street 
9436 All of us know about her 
9437 She is like a goddess said Raju 8 who has a mother but no father 
9438 The Statesman newspaper quoted 40-year-old Mangala Das paralysed from her waist down and a resident of the Prem Dan Gift of Love home for the destitute as saying she and her friends had been praying incessantly for Mother Teresa 's recovery 
9439 Tarak Das 70 was picked up from a Calcutta footpath a week ago by passers-by who took pity on him and brought him to Nirmal Hriday Immaculate Home 
9440 I do not know who she is 
9441 I have never seen her but I can only bless her for what she has done for people like me Das told The Statesman 
9442 Mother Teresa 's condition improved on Sunday as her fever abated and on Monday she was able to scribble notes to doctors and nuns 
9443 Thousands in Calcutta where she founded her Missionaries of Charity religious order in 1949 prayed for her recovery 
9444 Ministers of the communist government of West Bengal state and people of different religions joined Catholics to pray for Mother Teresa 's recovery at Mother House 
9445 We joined the prayer to express our solidarity with her work for the cause of the poor and downtrodden said Nanda Gopal Bhattacharya a communist minister in West Bengal 
9446 Islamists can meet in London minister 
9447 ISLAMABAD 1996-08-27 
9448 British Foreign Secretary Malcolm Rifkind said on Tuesday that his government would only take action against a planned conference of Islamist groups in London if British law was broken 
9449 People who wish to hold conferences of course do n't need to seek permission from the government in Britain Rifkind in Pakistan for a visit told Reuters 
9450 As long as they obey our laws then that is not something the government would normally interfere with 
9451 The Islamist conference due to be held in London on September 8 has caused concern in countries such as Algeria and Egypt which are fighting armed Islamic militants 
9452 British Jewish groups have also protested because they say members of Algeria 's Islamic Salvation Front FIS and the Palestinian Islamic group Hamas are on the guest list 
9453 Rifkind said it was for the home secretary interior minister to act by denying visas to participants if he felt there was reason to believe that they might break the law 
9454 Our policy has to be fundamentally based on respect for the rule of law and insistence that it be observed he said 
9455 Rifkind was in Pakistan at the start of an Asian tour that will also take him to India Sri Lanka Japan and Mongolia 
9456 Afghan leader tells U.S. Congressman of peace plan 
9457 Sayed Salahuddin 
9458 KABUL 1996-08-27 
9459 Afghan government military chief Ahmad Shah Masood briefed visiting U.S. Congressman Dana Rohrabacher on Tuesday on a peace plan for his wartorn country 
9460 A spokesman for Masood said he had told the California Republican at a meeting in northern Kabul that President Burhanuddin Rabbani 's government favoured talks with all Afghan factions to set up an interim government 
9461 The factions should agree to appoint a transitional leader draft a new constitution collect heavy weapons create a national army and hold free elections in which the transitional leader would be barred from standing he added 
9462 Rohrabacher flew into Bagram military airbase north of Kabul in a Red Cross plane on Tuesday after meeting northern opposition militia leader General Abdul Rashid Dostum 
9463 Masood 's spokesman Amrollah one name said Rohrabacher had recently visited Italy Saudi Arabia and Pakistan as part of a mission to promote peace in Afghanistan 
9464 We are certainly serious more than before to find a solution to the Afghan problem and support every U.N. plan Amrollah quoted Rohrabacher as saying 
9465 However a spokesman for Prime Minister Gulbuddin Hekmatyar a long-time rival of Masood expressed concern at signs of renewed U.S. interest in Afghanistan 
9466 America wants to block the establishment of a strong Islamic government in Afghanistan and the U.S. intends to neutralise the Afghan peace process initiated by the Afghans themselves said the spokesman Hamid Ibrahimi 
9467 A great game has been started in Afghanistan as America feels that Tehran and Moscow have got stronger in the Afghan picture something Washington wants to change he said 
9468 Rohrabacher was expected to visit neutral faction leaders in the eastern city of Jalalabad and meet leaders of the rebel Islamic Taleban militia in the southern city of Kandahar 
9469 Afghan guerrilla factions have been locked in a bloody power struggle since the fall of the communist government in April 1992 
9470 Hekmatyar once Rabbani 's main rival made a peace pact with him and rejoined the government as prime minister in June 
9471 Pakistan state bank sells 1.38 bln rupees of bonds 
9472 KARACHI Pakistan 1996-08-27 
9473 The State central Bank of Pakistan auctioned three- five- and 10-year federal investment bonds worth 1.38 billion rupees on Tuesday 
9474 The bank said it had accepted bids of 250 million rupees at par for three-year bonds 3.5 million rupees at par for five-year bonds and 1.126 billion at par for 10-year bonds 
9475 The auction is set for settlement on Thursday 
9476 In the previous auction on July 11 it accepted bids worth 300 million rupees at par for three-year bonds 44.5 million rupees at par for five-year bonds and 782.6 million rupees at par for 10-year bonds

9478 Nepal offers to talk to Maoist insurgents 
9479 Gopal Sharma 
9480 KATHMANDU 1996-08-27 
9481 Nepal 's centre-right coalition government has offered to meet the country 's hardline Maoist communists for talks in a bid to end an insurgency in Nepal 's western districts officials said on Tuesday 
9482 The Maoists oppose multi-party democracy and want to establish a communist state 
9483 But the Nepali government said the insurgents must give up violence before it negotiates with them 
9484 They the insurgents should first give up their violent activities Home Interior Minister Khum Bahadur Khadga said 
9485 About 54 people have died in Maoist insurgent activity and in police action against them since February officials said 
9486 Nepali opposition parties have accused the police of having killed more people than the insurgents 
9487 Some human rights groups have criticised the government 's handling of the situation 
9488 In a speech in parliament on Tuesday Khadga challenged the Maoist communists to win the people 's confidence and win election to parliament 
9489 On Monday he had offered to talk to leaders of the United People 's Front Nepal Bhattarai the Maoist faction which leads the insurgency 
9490 The government is ready to guarantee security of the Maoist representatives who want to take part in peaceful dialogue Khadga said 
9491 A multi-party democracy was set up in Nepal six years ago after a popular movement by the centrist Nepali Congress party jointly with the Communist United Marxist-Leninist UML party 
9492 The Nepali Congress leads the three-party coalition government while the UML is the main opposition party

9536 Bangladesh Speaker says he received death threats 
9537 DHAKA 1996-08-27 
9538 The Speaker of Bangladesh 's parliament Humayun Rasheed Choudhury said he had received death threats from anonymous callers after opposition parties threatened to boycott proceedings chaired by him 
9539 He told the Bengali newspaper Banglabazar Patrika on Tuesday that such threats were possibly coming from those who want to push the country into chaos and unrest 
9540 The callers said his life could be cut short the newspaper said 
9541 The speaker was not immediately available for comment 
9542 Choudhury a former foreign minister and veteran diplomat was appointed speaker of the 330-member parliament on July 13 a month after general elections returned the Awami League of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to power after 21 years 
9543 Choudhury also was president of the 41st session of the U.N. General Assembly in 1986-87 
9544 Former prime minister Begum Khaleda Zia now the opposition leader in parliament and head of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party BNP said her followers might boycott assemby sessions chaired by the partisan speaker 
9545 The ruling Awami league is making parliament ineffective and the speaker is contributing to that by not allowing the opposition MPs enough time to speak she told a rally in northern district of Bogra on Monday 
9546 Hasina speaking to a group of engineers in Dhaka on Monday accused the BNP of resorting to terrorism as part of its plan to create instability and chaos in the country 
9547 This is not desireable 
9548 and we will deal with such designs sternly the prime minister said

9571 Barrick gets 93 pct of Arequipa 
9572 TORONTO 1996-08-27 
9573 Barrick Gold Corp said on Tuesday its takeover offer for Arequipa Resources Ltd was successful with 93 percent of the 36.3 million shares not already owned tendered under the bid which expired overnight 
9574 We are pleased that Arequipa shareholders ahave chosen so overwhelmingly to accept this offer 
9575 We now have the opportunity to realize the potential of Arequipa 's excellent assets Barrick chairman and chief executive Peter Munk said in a statement 
9576 The C$ 30-a-share deal means Barrick will own Arequipa 's attractive Pierina gold deposit in Peru 
9577 Barrick said details involving the allocation between Barrick shares and cash will be available shortly 
9578 Barrick 's offer of C$ 30 a share or part cash part share offer was Barrick 's second attempt to swallow the small Vancouver-based gold prospector 
9579 Toronto-based Barrick the world 's third largest gold producer sweetened its July 11 bid to C$ 30 a share from C$ 27 on August 16 after a fresh batch of drill results from the Pierina deposit 
9580 Experts have speculated the deposit has potential reserves of up to 12 million ounces 
9581 More drilling results are expected soon 
9582 The Barrick bid took observers by surprise since Arequipa 's exploration was still in its early stages 
9583 Arequipa shareholders had the option to choose C$ 30 cash or 0.79 Barrick shares plus 50 cents for each Arequipa share 
9584 Shares were to be pro-rated if more than 14.4 million were requested

9608 AOL Europe forms online advertising agency 
9609 HANOVER Germany 1996-08-27 
9610 The joint venture between America Online AOL and Bertelsmann AG has formed a new company to sell advertising space on AOL in Europe a Bertelsmann official said on Tuesday 
9611 The new company is called AdOn GmbH and is located in Hamburg Bernd Schiphorst president and chief operating officer of Bertelsmann 's New Media business division said on the sidelines of an AOL news conference at the CeBIT Home consumer electronics fair in Hanover 
9612 Jan Buettner managing director of AOL Germany said AdOn was in the formation phase and would get off the ground next year bringing in advertising from around Europe 
9613 He would give no forecasts on advertising revenue 
9614 AOL is the leading global commercial online service with some six million subscribers worldwide 
9615 It has around 200,000 subscribers in Europe with two thirds of that number in Germany alone 
9616 In Europe the service is available in Germany France and Britain 
9617 It will be available in Austria and Switzerland later this year and in Scandanavia and the Benelux countries next year

9646 Turkey 's Kurd rebels kill two take three hostage 
9647 ANKARA 1996-08-27 
9648 Kurdish guerrillas killed two people and took three hostage after stopping two intercity buses at a roadblock in eastern Turkey security officials said on Tuesday 
9649 They told reporters a group of Kurdistan Workers Party PKK guerrillas stopped the buses at a roadblock on the road linking the eastern provinces of Erzincan and Sivas on Monday night and forced the passengers to get out 
9650 The rebels killed one of the drivers and a passenger after checking the identities of the passengers they said 
9651 The officials said the rebels set ablaze two buses and released all but three passengers 
9652 More than 20,000 people have been killed in the 12-year-old conflict between Turkish troops and PKK guerrillas fighting for autonomy or independence from Turkey 
9653 Egypt confiscates paper for mad rulers article 
9654 CAIRO 1996-08-27 
9655 Egypt has banned and confiscated 10,000 copies of the Cyprus-based Arabic monthly newspaper al-Tadamun because of an editorial suggesting mental health tests for Arab leaders the editor-in-chief said on Tuesday 
9656 Mohamed Abu Liwaya said Information Ministry censors had told him to send all the copies of the August edition back to Cyprus at his own expense 
9657 He told Reuters the reason was his own front-page editorial entitled A Chronic Mental Illness in which he attacks compliant Arab leaders for serving U.S. and Israeli interests 
9658 The Arabs demand that our Arab leaders undergo a compulsory examination by a team of psychiatrists to see how sound their mental capacities are the editorial said 
9659 Because our leaders have started to behave with extreme hostility towards the interests of their peoples to court the goodwill of the Americans and the Zionists he added 
9660 The censorship office denied they had confiscated the newspapers but declined to say when they could go on sale

9681 Wife of gun victim Brady praises Clinton 
9682 CHICAGO 1996-08-26 
9683 Sarah Brady whose Republican husband was severely disabled in an assassination attempt on President Ronald Reagan took centre stage at the Democratic National convention on Monday night to praise President Bill Clinton 's gun control efforts 
9684 With her husband James sitting in a wheelchair to the side of the podium Mrs. Brady called the handgun control bill that a Democratic Congress passed and Clinton signed in 1994 a major step in controlling firearm violence in the United States 
9685 But she said more had to be done 
9686 The Bradys walked on to the stage he on her arm and with the aid of a cane to a rousing reception from the convention 
9687 Their teenaged son sat in a VIP box with first lady Hillary Rodham Clinton and watched as his father returned to his wheelchair 
9688 Jim we must have made a wrong turn 
9689 This is n't San Diego site of the Republican convention Mrs. Brady joked to her husband who was serving as Reagan 's press secretary when he was shot 
9690 Sarah I told you this is the Democratic convention he responded to his wife who before the shooting had worked for two Republican congressmen and the Republican national party 
9691 Since the Brady Law went into effect on February 28 1994 it has stopped more than 100,000 convicted felons and other prohibited purchasers from buying a handgun 
9692 Today and every day the Brady Law is stopping an estimated 85 felons from buying a handgun Mrs. Brady said 
9693 She added But we need to do more 
9694 We should as President Clinton proposed today stop people convicted of domestic violence from buying a handgun 
9695 Jim and I join with you tonight in saluting the great job that President Clinton has done in fighting crime and gun violence 
9696 He 's a hunter and a sportsman but he understands the difference between a Remington rifle and an AK47 
9697 And he knows that you do n't go hunting with an Uzi 
9698 Mr. President you deserve our thanks 
9699 Jim Brady then gave a big thumbs to the audience 
9700 Brady 
9701 was shot in the head in 1981 by gunman John Hinckley who tried to kill Reagan in a deranged bid to impress Jodie Foster an actress he never met but with whom he was obsessed 
9702 The Brady bill calling for a waiting period before someone could buy a gun so a background check could be made was first introduced in Congress in 1987 but it took seven years to pass because of opposition from the National Rifle Association gun lobby

9733 Most hostages freed from hijacked Sudanese plane 
9734 STANSTED England 1996-08-27 
9735 Armed hijackers believed to be Iraqis released 140 people on Tuesday from a Sudan Airways plane carrying 199 passengers and crew that landed in London after being diverted on a flight from Khartoum to Amman police said 
9736 Police spokesman Roger Grimwade said the six or seven hijackers remained on board the aircraft which arrived from Cyprus at 4.30 a.m. 0330 GMT 
9737 He said they had made various requests to police negotiators but stepped back from earlier suggestions that the hijackers had asked to speak to a British-based Iraqi police named as Mr Sadiki 
9738 The hijackers who have said they want to seek asylum in Britain are believed to be armed with grenades and possibly other explosives according to police 
9739 They earlier threatened to blow up the aircraft 
9740 The Airbus A310 was diverted first to Cyprus then to Britain

9742 LONDON 1996-08-27

9749 Hijacked Sudan plane lands at a London airport 
9750 STANSTED England 1996-08-27 
9751 A hijacked Sudan Airways plane carrying 199 passengers and crew landed at Stansted airport just outside London early on Tuesday morning after flying from Cyprus eyewitnesses said 
9752 The Airbus 310 Flight 150 which was hijacked on Monday evening on its way from Khartoum to the Jordanian capital Amman landed at 4.30 a.m. 0330 GMT after a flight of more than four hours 
9753 At least one of the unidentified hijackers was apparently armed with grenades and TNT and threatened to blow the plane up in Cyprus unless it was refuelled so they could fly to Britain to claim political asylum 
9754 They will surrender the passengers there and surrender themselves police spokesman Glafcos Xenos told reporters at Cyprus 's Larnaca airport 
9755 Security was tight at Stansted airport which is about 30 miles 50 km northeast of the capital 
9756 Stansted has been designated as the preferred option for handling hijackings in southern England because it is more remote than Heathrow and Gatwick London 's two major airports and handles less air traffic 
9757 Hijacked Sudan plane expected at London 's Stansted 
9758 LONDON 1996-08-27 
9759 A hijacked Sudan Airways plane with 199 passengers and crew on board was expected to land at London 's Stansted airport later on Tuesday morning a police spokeswoman said 
9760 That is the plan at the moment 
9761 That is where the plane is being directed to Ruth Collin of Essex police the force responsible for Stansted said 
9762 Stansted London 's third-busiest airport after Heathrow and Gatwick is located about 30 miles 48 km northeast of the capital 
9763 British officials said they would much prefer to deal with a hijacking at Stansted because of its relatively remote location and because air traffic would be less badly disrupted there than at Heathrow or Gatwick 
9764 They said police and the emergency services were implementing a well-rehearsed contingency plan to handle the hijacking 
9765 The armed hijackers of the Airbus 310 Flight 150 which is expected to arrive about 4 a.m. 0300 GMT have said they intend to surrender and seek political asylum in Britain 
9766 The plane was hijacked on its way from Khartoum to the Jordanian capital Amman on Monday evening and landed at Larnaca airport in Cyprus to refuel 
9767 The identity and number of the hijackers was not known 
9768 One of them negotiated through the pilot in English 
9769 The pilot said several hijackers appeared to be placed around the plane 
9770 Painted parrot scam lands Australian in jail 
9771 PERTH Australia 1996-08-27 
9772 A conman who painted common Australian parrots with dye to make them look like rare birds worth thousands of dollars was jailed for fraud on Tuesday 
9773 Denham Peiris painted six green parrots worth about A$ 100 US$ 79 a pair with a cinnamon hair dye and traded them as Indian Ringneck Parrots valued at A$ 14,000 a pair 
9774 Peiris 32 of Perth was sentenced in the Western Australian District Court to two years in jail for fraud after trading three pairs of impostor birds for 21 parrots worth a total of A$ 28,000 
9775 Everyone was fooled said pet shop owner Shane Drew who unknowingly traded the disguised birds 
9776 I 'd already had three local breeders have a look at them and sent photos and videos of the birds to the eastern states for authentication they said they 're nice birds Drew told reporters outside court 
9777 After I was told they were dyed I checked them over again 
9778 It was a perfect paint job except for one feather under a wing of one bird that was only half dyed Drew said 
9779 Drew said Peiris a bird enthusiast would have succeeded with the fraud if he had not tried to trade a fourth pair of bogus birds after an associate had told police of the scam 
9780 If not for the informant the painted parrots true colours would not have been known for six months he said 
9781 They moult in the summer so five or six months down the track I would have looked like the guilty party Drew said

9783 WELLINGTON 1996-08-27

9785 The man drew attention to himself in the North Island town of Tauranga while trying to reverse his car out of a pothole on Saturday night 
9786 He spun the wheels so much that the tyres caught alight and smoke began pouring from under the bonnet the New Zealand Press Association reported 
9787 Police arrested the man and charged him with drink-driving but then iscovered he was wanted by the Immigration Service as an overstayer 
9788 The man was due to catch a flight to Nuku'alofa in Tonga later on Tuesday
