9796 Seoul embassies warned of terrorist attacks 
9797 SEOUL 1996-08-27 
9798 South Korea has told its overseas missions to step up security since its embassy in the former Yugoslavia received a threat over Seoul 's crackdown on radical students the foreign ministry said on Tuesday 
9799 A letter to the Belgrade embassy on Monday under the name of the Macedonian Communist Party demanded South Korea release detained student leaders a ministry spokesman said 
9800 The letter said the party would assault the embassy other South Korean-related facilities and Korean nationals unless our authorities released arrested students he said 
9801 Nearly 400 members of an outlawed student group were arrested after violent protests demanding reunification with communist North Korea were crushed by riot police at a Seoul university this month 
9802 Authorities branded the violence in which a police officer was killed as an act of terror 
9803 The ministry has ordered the embassy to take urgent security measures against possible terrorist attacks the official said asking not to be named 
9804 It had called for similar precautions at other overseas missions including those in Canada and Bangladesh where leftist groups have staged protests over the crackdown 
9805 Nuclear pact will be a step to disarmament-China 
9806 BEIJING 1996-08-27 
9807 China on Tuesday reaffirmed its support for a global nuclear test ban treaty blocked by India last week saying the pact would be an important step in achieving total nuclear disarmament 
9808 Although the final draft of the treaty probably did n't totally satisfy any country it was in general balanced the official People 's Daily newspaper said in a commentary 
9809 India blocked the Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty CTBT at the Conference on Disarmament in Geneva saying the pact did not contain a clause committing the five declared nuclear powers to a timetable for nuclear disarmament 
9810 New Delhi 's stance which was seen as effectively thwarting 2-1/2 years of negotiations at the Conference on Disarmament drew widespread but generally muted foreign criticism 
9811 India has also pledged to oppose any forwarding of the draft treaty to the United Nations General Assembly 
9812 China said many countries had compromised to complete the treaty and that the issue of a disarmament schedule could be discussed in future negotiations 
9813 The completion of the test ban treaty would be an important and practical step in the gradual process of achieving total nuclear disarmament it said 
9814 China has pledged support for the pact since reaching a deal with the United States that made international inspections of nuclear sites more difficult than in earlier drafts of the accord 
9815 The newspaper said China advocated the complete ban and destruction of nuclear weapons but that there was little hope other nuclear powers would soon adopt the same stance 
9816 Some nuclear powers stubbornly uphold policies of nuclear deterrence based on first use of nuclear weapons it said 
9817 China held on July 29 what it said would be its last nuclear test before a self-imposed moratorium that took effect the following day 
9818 China was the last declared nuclear power to announce a halt to testing 
9819 Japan declares food poisoning threat receding 
9820 TOKYO 1996-08-27 
9821 The government said on Tuesday that the threat from a mysterious killer germ while still requiring vigilance appears to be receding in the western Japan city of Sakai where the epidemic hit the hardest 
9822 The food poisoning epidemic caused by the O-157 colon bacillus in Sakai appears to be settling down Health Minister Naoto Kan was quoted by a government spokesman as telling the cabinet 
9823 The O-157 colon bacillus has been found responsible for a widespread food poisoning epidemic that has killed 11 people and made over 9,500 ill this year 
9824 Sakai near the regional commercial centre of Osaka has been hit hardest by the deadly bacteria with nearly 6,500 mostly schoolchildren affected by the disease 
9825 Two children in Sakai have died from complications associated with the bacteria 
9826 Kan told a cabinet meeting on Tuesday that no new victims have been reported since August 8 indicating that the peak has passed at least for Sakai 
9827 Sakai officials agreed with the assessment but said it was too early to feel relieved 
9828 There are still patients hospitalised and problems which must be dealt with a city spokesman said citing the issue of whether to allow children infected with the bacteria but not showing symptoms to attend school from September 
9829 Health authorities believe school lunches were the source of the food poisoning in Sakai but researchers have been unable to pinpoint the exact source of the infection 
9830 The outbreak has prompted authorities to tighten sanitary standards at slaughterhouses and meatpacking plants and sparked calls for an overhaul of the nation 's school lunch programme 
9831 The ministers agreed at Tuesday 's cabinet meeting to step up inspection measures for school lunches in September and October when schools around the country resume 
9832 Japan 's Agriculture Ministry also announced that it will compile hygiene guidelines based on U.S. government methods of checking the safety of farm produce to prevent another outbreak of the epidemic 
9833 As of Monday 31 children were still hospitalised in Sakai city of whom six were in serious condition 
9834 Japan aluminium shipments surge 8.9 pct in July 
9835 TOKYO 1996-08-27 
9836 Japanese shipments of aluminium mill products in July surged 8.9 percent over the same month last year to 224,609 tonnes while production rose 6.4 percent to 222,457 tonnes according to preliminary data released on Tuesday by the Japan Aluminium Federation 
9837 The surge reflected strong demand from the beverage can and housing construction sectors federation officials said 
9838 Figures released two weeks ago from Japan 's seven largest mills already showed that Japan 's can sheet output reached its highest monthly level ever in July reflecting above-average temperatures that sparked a jump in beer consumption 
9839 A federation official added that the half-year through September 1996 also appeared likely to set a new record for can production despite cooler temperatures in August 
9840 July inventories stood at 75,632 tonnes down 2.6 percent from the prior month 
9841 July foil output was off 0.2 percent year-on-year at 11,525 tonnes while foil shipments fell 0.8 percent to 11,244 tonnes 
9842 June mill output data were revised slightly downward to 210,622 tonnes from the preliminary 210,683 while shipments were revised marginally upward to 213,989 tonnes from 213,845 
9843 Final figures for June pegged can stock shipments at 40,144 tonnes up 2.4 percent year-on-year 
9844 Shipments to the auto sector fell 5.5 percent to 15,286 tonnes while the construction sector rose 2.4 percent to 79,390 tonnes 
9845 Exports dipped 3.7 percent to 18,867 tonnes 
9846 Tokyo Commodities Desk 81-3 3432 6179 
9847 China thanks Gabon for support on human rights 
9848 BEIJING 1996-08-27 
9849 China has publicly thanked Gabon for its strong support at the United Nations Human Rights Commission where Beijing has come under attack from Western nations for its human rights record 
9850 China 's President Jiang Zemin offered his gratitude in a meeting on Monday with visiting Gabon President Omar Bongo the official Xinhua news agency said 
9851 Jiang also acknowledged the Central African nation 's support for China 's stance on Taiwan which Beijing views as a renegade province while Bongo was quoted as thanking China for economic and technological aid the agency said late on Monday 
9852 In April China quashed a draft resolution by the U.N. Human Rights Commission expressing concern over continuing reports of Beijing 's violations of fundamental freedoms 
9853 After the defeat of the resolution drafted by the European Union and the United States China 's Foreign Ministry thanked 26 countries for backing its motion for no action on the document 
9854 It was the sixth year in a row that China avoided censure at the U.N. 's main human rights forum 
9855 China has been accused of a wide range of human rights abuses often in violation of its own legal code in an effort to silence dissent 
9856 A Xinhua commentary earlier this year said a plot by the West to force its human rights standards and values on other countries was doomed to failure 
9857 Taiwan 's Cooperative Bank cuts prime lending rate 
9858 TAIPEI 1996-08-27 
9859 Cooperative Bank of Taiwan one of the island 's leading state-run banks said it was cutting its prime lending rate by 0.05 percentage point effective on Tuesday 
9860 The bank said in a statement it was cutting its prime lending rate to 7.35 percent from 7.40 percent 
9861 It also would cut its three-month-to-three-year time deposit rates by between 0.05 and 0.10 percentage points 
9862 The moves made Cooperative the first major bank to cut rates in response to a call on Friday from central bank governor Sheu Yuan-dong 
9863 In the central bank 's latest bid to jumpstart Taiwan 's sluggish economy Sheu ordered a reduction of up to a half-percentage point in banks reserve requirements and called on commercial banks to pass on the savings in the form of interest rate reductions 
9864 Taipei Newsroom 5080815 
9865 Palestinians to strike over Jerusalem demolition 
9866 JERUSALEM 1996-08-27 
9867 Palestinian leaders in Jerusalem called on Tuesday for a two-hour strike to protest what they called Israel 's war on Arab East Jerusalem after police demolished a building there 
9868 Israeli police demolished a 10 metre yard by 20 metre structure in Jerusalem 's Old City they said had been built with funding from the Palestinian self-rule Authority for use as a social club 
9869 Police used a huge crane to lift a bulldozer over the Old City 's walls to reach the building amidst narrow alleys witnesses said 
9870 Bystanders at the scene said work had begun on the building in 1991 and it had yet to be completed when the Israeli police bulldozed it 
9871 The Palestinian Authority was set up under the 1993 PLO-Israel interim peace deal 
9872 There has been a call for a general strike between one 1000 GMT and three o'clock Palestinian lawmaker Ahmed Hashem Zighayer told Reuters 
9873 This is a war that has been declared on us and we want our people to come and see the site where they declared the war 
9874 Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu 's government which took office in June has said it will not allow the Authority set up under a 1993 interim peace deal to control parts of the Gaza Strip and West Bank to operate in Jerusalem 
9875 Israel 's previous government held the same position but in general turned a blind eye to Palestinian Authority activity in the city 
9876 Tuesday 's demolition came a day after PLO officials said they had bowed to Netanyahu 's demand they close offices in Jerusalem 
9877 They said two of the three offices Israel wanted closed had been shut 
9878 Netanyahu has made closure of the three offices a condition for resuming peace negotiations with the Palestine Liberation Organisation PLO 
9879 Israel captured Arab East Jerusalem in the 1967 Middle East war and annexed it 
9880 It says it will never cede any part of the city 
9881 Palestinians want East Jerusalem as capital of a future state 
9882 The city is up for negotiation at final peace talks which have yet to resume under Netanyahu 
9883 SEC adopts rules to improve investor access to best stock prices 
9884 WASHINGTON 1996-08-28 
9885 The Securities and Exchange Commission Wednesday approved rules designed to give stock market investors a better chance at getting the best price available for their orders 
9886 The so-called order handling rules which were proposed last September were approved in a 4-0 vote 
9887 The new rules will require specialists at stock exchanges and market makers on Nasdaq to allow customers to view price quotes from other electronic trading systems that may not be readily available to them 
9888 The rules will also require that customer limit orders be displayed with prices better than those available in quotes publicly available at the time 
9889 Specialists and market makers are companies or individuals recognised as qualified to maintain an orderly market in a stock 
9890 In a limit order investors specify the price at which they are willing to buy or sell as opposed to a market order executed at prevailing prices 
9891 These rules are intended to empower all investors by allowing their orders to compete on a level playing field and by providing the disclosure they need to make informed decisions said SEC Chairman Arthur Levitt 
9892 The SEC 's goal he added was to create one system where one price could be available to everybody 
9893 The director of the SEC 's division of market regulation Richard Lindsey said Wall Street firms will probably need to spend about $ 7 million to carry out the improvements called for by the new rules 
9894 In proposing the rules last year the SEC noted that while technology has improved commonplace practices still existed that worked against investors best interests 
9895 It noted that customers whose orders were not displayed lost the chance of getting the best possible price available in the market 
9896 It also cited the potential problem of a two-tiered market in which market makers quote one price to public investors while quoting better prices in private systems thus robbing investors without access to hidden quotes the benefit of the best available prices 
9897 Earlier this month the SEC settled charges of alleged malpractices on Nasdaq when the parent of the Nasdaq market the National Association of Securities Dealers agreed to spend $ 100 million over five years to upgrade its oversight of brokers trading practices 
9898 The SEC dropped a third proposal that would have allowed investors with market orders to trade at a better price if there were shifts in prices before their orders were executed 
9899 The agency said it would monitor effects of the two new rules before considering the price improvement proposal again 
9900 The agency also proposed rule changes that would require continuous bid and ask quotations from exchange specialists and market makers who trade more than 1 percent of a stock during any quarter on Nasdaq 
9901 The SEC 's limit order display rule will mean a major change for Nasdaq where such orders have never been displayed 
9902 The president of the Nasdaq Alfred Berkeley was to hold a news conference Wednesday afternoon to elaborate on the new rules effects on the market the second largest in the world 
9903 ITALIAN CABINET APPROVES TELEVISION DECREE 
9904 ROME 1996-08-28 
9905 The Italian cabinet on Wednesday granted a reprieve for media mogul Silvio Berlusconi 's Mediaset television empire with a decree extending the current legal framework for television stations until January 31 1997 
9906 The decree plugs a legal void in which magistrates could have forced the former prime minister to take one of the three stations he controls off the air because of a court ruling that no single proprietor should be allowed to keep three channels 
9907 Passengers injured in train collision in Linz 
9908 LINZ Austria 1996-08-28 
9909 A passenger train collided with a locomotive at a main railway station in Linz on Wednesday and police said around 10 people were injured 
9910 Austrian television reported earlier that more than 20 had been hurt in the accident at the station in Linz 300 km 180 miles west of Vienna 
9911 One locomotive was stationary and the passenger train collided into the back of it a police spokesman in Linz told Reuters by telephone 
9912 The express passenger train travelling from Steyr southeast of Linz with around 80 people on board hit the back of a service locomotive used to shunt wagons into sidings 
9913 The police spokesman said he was not sure whether any more passengers were still trapped in the wreckage 
9914 Doctors and medical staff from a hospital across the road from the station were at the scene of the accident within minutes and were able to treat the injured quickly he added 
9915 Greater damage was averted as the driver of the passenger train had time to apply his emergency brakes before the collision occurred a state railways spokesman told Austrian news agency APA 
9916 Saskatchewan Wheat Pool eyes hog market 
9917 WINNIPEG 1996-08-28 
9918 Canada 's largest grain handling firm said Wednesday it expects to forge a partnership with hog farmers by 1997 with a view to expanding the company 's scope into pork production 
9919 Saskatchewan is well positioned to take advantage of growing world markets for pork Saskatchewan Wheat Pool chief executive Don Loewen said in a company statement 
9920 SWP said it was analyzing potential partnerships with hog farmers and expected the first deal to be in place in 1997 
9921 The end of Canada 's rail freight subsidy last year caused a shift in feed grain production to the eastern Prairie 
9922 Analysts said livestock production would likely shift to the eastern Prairie rather than feed grains being shipped to the western Prairie 
9923 SWP said it may develop pork production systems that provide farmers with large integrated units and it may consider contracting programs between producers and packers which would operate within the existing hog market framework 
9924 Saskatchewan Pork International Marketing Group has an export monopoly but some Saskatchewan farmers earlier this month called for an open market in hogs

10013 CYCLING KELLY WINS WORLD TIME TRIAL TITLE 
10014 MANCHESTER England 1996-08-28 
10015 Shane Kelly of Australia retained the world one-kilometre time trial title at the world track championships on Wednesday with a track record time of one minute 2.777 seconds 
10016 Kelly averaged 57.345 kph to beat Soren Lausgberg of Germany by eighteen hundredths of a second 
10017 The bronze medal went to another German Jan Van Eijden in 1:04.541

10121 CYCLING BOARDMAN FULFILS WORLD RECORD PREDICTION 
10122 Martin Ayres 
10123 MANCHESTER England 1996-08-28 
10124 Britain 's Chris Boardman fulfilled his prediction that he would break the world 4,000 metres world record in the world track cycling championships on Wednesday 
10125 Boardman clocked four minutes 13.353 seconds to slice more than six seconds from the previous world mark of 4:19.699 set by Olympic champion Andrea Collinelli of Italy in Atlanta in July 
10126 Collinelli qualified in second place also beating his old record in 4:17.696 
10127 I was very nervous before the start but then I was amazed by the speed of my ride Boardman said 
10128 I do n't know if I can go any faster 
10129 Who knows what will happen in the later stages ? 
10130 Boardman 28 did not contest the Olympic pursuit because of its proximity to the Tour de France in which he led the French GAN team 
10131 However he took a bronze medal in the Olympic road time-trial and then returned home to prepare for the world track series in the Manchester indoor velodrome 
10132 He adopted the superman riding position with arms at full stretch perfected by fellow Briton Graeme Obree the 1995 world champion and taken up in Atlanta by Collinelli 
10133 Obree was forced to pull out of his title defence because of a viral infection

10190 SOCCER FOWLER AND MCMANAMAN OUT OF ENGLAND SQUAD 
10191 LONDON 1996-08-28 
10192 England soccer manager Glen Hoddle confirmed on Wednesday that the Liverpool pair of Steve McManaman and Robbie Fowler would miss England 's World Cup qualifying match against Moldova on Sunday 
10193 The two men both suffering from back injuries joined the England squad at training but it was soon clear they had no chance of making the flight to Kishinev on Friday 
10194 They had some scans and X-rays yesterday and they 're out said Hoddle 
10195 The more important thing for me was to get them down here and have a chat 
10196 To go another five weeks without that chance would have been foolish he added 
10197 Hoddle who has already lost the services of midfielder Darren Anderton and defender Steve Howey delayed naming any replacements 
10198 There was also concern over injuries to Paul Gascoigne Les Ferdinand and David Batty 
10199 HORSE RACING JOCKEY WEAVER RECEIVES 21-DAY BAN 
10200 LONDON 1996-08-28 
10201 Leading rider Jason Weaver received a 21-day ban from the disciplinary committee of the Jockey Club on Wednesday 
10202 Weaver had been reported after being found guilty of irresponsible riding at the provincial track of Pontefract 10 days ago 
10203 It was his fourth riding offence this season 
10204 Although five days of the ban were suspended until January 1 Weaver will miss next month 's big St Leger meeting including the ride on top stayer Double Trigger in the Doncaster Cup 
10205 Weaver shot to prominence in 1994 when he won the English 2,000 Guineas on Mister Baileys in his first ride in a classic 
10206 ROWING REDGRAVE MAY SEEK FIFTH OLYMPIC GOLD 
10207 LONDON 1996-08-28 
10208 Britain 's Steven Redgrave said on Wednesday he might change his mind and go for a fifth consecutive Olympic gold medal at the 2000 Games in Sydney 
10209 Redgrave is one of only five athletes who have won gold medals at four successive Olympics 
10210 He shared victory with Matthew Pinsent in the coxless pairs at the Atlanta Games and said at the time that would be his last shot 
10211 But he has had second thoughts since then 
10212 I 'm only 34 
10213 Some say that 's too old for an athlete he said 
10214 But I 'll be 38 by Sydney and that 's not too old 
10215 It 's whether I have got the enthusiasm for the training over the next four years 
10216 Rowing is an endurance sport 
10217 CRICKET BOTHAM DISMISSES GATTING IN FIRST CLASS DEBUT 
10218 LONDON 1996-08-28 
10219 Liam Botham demonstrated his father Ian 's golden touch on Wednesday shortly after making his county debut for Hampshire 
10220 Botham dismissed Mike Gatting with his seventh ball when the former England captain pushed a half-volley to square-leg on the first day of the four-day match against Middlesex at Portsmouth 
10221 Earlier Botham arrived in Portsmouth from Southampton only to be told his services would not be required 
10222 He then drove 40 kms back to play for the second XI to learn that John Stephenson had dropped out of the Middlesex match in the meantime with a shoulder injury 
10223 Botham dashed back to Portsmouth and took the field as the thrid over began 
10224 Ian Botham began his test career in 1977 by dismissing Australian captain Greg Chappell with a long hop and went on to become his country 's most successful all-rounder ever with 5,200 runs 383 wickets plus 120 catches in 102 tests

10228 The quartet who possess 244 international caps between them were also omitted from a summer training camp but will still be in contention when the northern international season starts later this year 
10229 Their qualities are well known to the selectors and they will of course be considered when the season gets underway the Rugby Football Union said in a statement on Wednesday 
10230 BASEBALL DODGERS WIN FIFTH STRAIGHT 
10231 MONTREAL 1996-08-28 
10232 Hideo Nomo allowed a run in seven innings for his fifth win in seven road starts and Greg Gagne capped a three-run fourth with a two-run homer as the Los Angeles Dodgers claimed a 5-1 victory the Montreal Expos on Tuesday 
10233 With their fifth straight win the Dodgers moved a half-game ahead of the Expos at the top of the wild card hunt behind Nomo 13-10 who allowed six hits and walked four with six strikeouts 
10234 In San Francisco Mike Williams allowed two runs in 7-1/3 innings and Benito Santiago and Ruben Amaro had RBI hits in the first inning as the Philadelphia Phillies edged the San Francisco Giants 3-2 
10235 Williams 5-12 who snapped a personal three-game losing streak allowed five hits walked two and struck out five 
10236 It was also Williams first win in three career decisions against San Francisco 
10237 In Pittsburgh Al Martin 's run-scoring single snapped a fifth-inning tie and Denny Neagle outdueled John Smoltz as the Pittsburgh Pirates edged the Atlanta Braves 3-2 
10238 The Braves led 2-1 entering the fifth but the Pirates pushed across two runs against Smoltz 20-7 
10239 Neagle 14-6 beat the Braves for the third time this season allowing two runs and six hits in eight innings 
10240 In St Louis Gary Sheffield and Devon White each drove in two runs and Mark Hutton scattered four hits over six innings to lead the Florida Marlins past the St. Louis Cardinals 6-3 
10241 White added a solo homer his 11th off reliever Mark Petkovsek with one out in the fifth giving the Marlins a 6-0 lead 
10242 In New York Steve Finley 's three-run homer capped a four-run eighth inning and gave the San Diego Padres a 4-3 victory over New York spoiling Bobby Valentine 's debut as Mets manager 
10243 The rally made a winner out of reliever Willie Blair 
10244 Tony Gwynn and Wally Joyner had two hits apiece helping the Padres to their third straight win 
10245 First-place San Diego has won seven of its last eight games and improved to 34-20 against NL East opponents 
10246 In Houston Tony Eusebio 's eighth-inning sacrifice fly capped a comeback from a five-run deficit that gave the Houston Astros a 6-5 victory over the Chicago Cubs 
10247 The Astros trailed 5-0 after three innings but scored three runs in the fourth and one in the sixth before taking the lead in the eighth 
10248 In St Louis Gary Sheffield and Devon White each drove in two runs and Mark Hutton scattered four hits over six innings to lead the Florida Marlins past the St. Louis Cardinals 6-3 
10249 Sheffield who was benched Monday delivered a double down the left-field line in the first scoring Luis Castilla and Alex Arias to put the Marlins ahead to stay 
10250 At Colorado Hal Morris and Eric Davis each homered and John Smiley scattered six hits over 6 2/3 innings as the Cincinnati Reds defeated the Colorado Rockies 4-3 snapping a four-game losing streak 
10251 The Reds took a one-run lead in the second inning when Morris led off with his 10th homer off starter Armando Reynoso 8-9 
10252 They increased their bulge to 4-0 in the third when Barry Larkin drew a one-out walk Kevin Mitchell singled and Davis launched his 22nd homer over the right-field wall 
10253 RUGBY UNION NEW ZEALAND RECALL MEHRTENS FOR FINAL TEST 
10254 JOHANNESBURG 1996-08-28 
10255 The New Zealand rugby selectors recalled fly-half Andrew Mehrtens on Wednesday when they announced their team for the third and final test in Johannesburg on Saturday 
10256 He returns in place of Simon Culhane who broke a wrist in the All Blacks series-clinching victory in Pretoria on Saturday 
10257 Mehrtens played in the last TriNations test in Cape Town but missed the first two tests in the current series after tearing a cartilage in his knee while training an injury which needed a small operation 
10258 Lock Ian Jones and wing Jeff Wilson have also been named in the team despite doubts over their fitness 
10259 Jones has a knee injury while Wilson is suffering from a viral infection 
10260 Blair Larsen or the uncapped Glenn Taylor are on standby to replace Jones and with Jonah Lomu out of action with a shoulder injury picked up in Tuesday 's drawn match against Griqualand West Eric Rush is favourite to play should Wilson fail to recover 
10261 Team 
10262 15 Christian Cullen 14 Jeff Wilson 13 Walter Little 12 Frank Bunce 11 Glen Osborne ; 10 Andrew Mehrtens 9 Justin Marshall ; 8 Zinzan Brooke 7 Josh Kronfeld 6 Michael Jones 5 Ian Jones 4 Robin Brooke 3 Olo Brown 2 Sean Fitzpatrick captain 1 Craig Dowd 
10263 HOCKEY BONNET TAKES OVER AS SOUTH AFRICAN COACH 
10264 JOHANNESBURG 1996-08-28 
10265 Former South African captain Giles Bonnet was named by the South African Hockey Association on Wednesday as the new coach of the men 's national side 
10266 Bonnet who has been coaching the Kwazulu-Natal provincial team takes over from Englishman Gavin Featherstone who took South Africa to 10th place in the Olympic Games in Atlanta 
10267 Featherstone a former Britain captain has accepted a coaching position with a women 's team in Ireland 
10268 CRICKET GIBBS GETS INTERNATIONAL CALL UP 
10269 JOHANNESBURG 1996-08-28 
10270 Western Province batsman Herschelle Gibbs was the only uncapped player in South Africa 's 14-man squad named on Wednesday for a quadrangular one-day series in Kenya next month 
10271 Kenya South Africa Pakistan and Sri Lanka will take part in the series 
10272 National coach Bob Woolmer said Gibbs 22 had been rewarded for a tremendous tour of England with the South African A team earlier this year 
10273 I 've known Herschelle since he was 11 years old and he showed in England how he has matured 
10274 His 170 against the MCC was an innings of supreme class against the best bowling attack we faced all tour Woolmer told a news conference 
10275 We were not able to consider Jacques Kallis Paul Adams and Shaun Pollock due to injury and the replacements have all come from the A tour and it 's great that they are all in form 
10276 Spin-bowling all-rounders Nicky Boje and Derek Crookes replace Pollock and Adams while Gibbs comes in for his Western Province colleague Kallis 
10277 Squad Hansie Cronje captain Craig Matthews vice-captain Dave Richardson Brian McMillan Gary Kirsten Andrew Hudson Pat Symcox Jonty Rhodes Allan Donald Fanie de Villiers Daryll Cullinan Derek Crookes Herschelle Gibs Nicky Boje

10329 TENNIS SELES HAS WALKOVER TO U.S. OPEN THIRD ROUND 
10330 NEW YORK 1996-08-28 
10331 Second seed and co-world number one Monica Seles advanced to the third round of the U.S. Open Tennis Championships without hitting a ball on Wednesday 
10332 Seles the 1991 and 1992 champion who dropped just one game in her opening match was scheduled to play Laurence Courtois of Belgium Wednesay night 
10333 But tournament officials announced about four-and-a-half hours before the match that Courtois had pulled out due to a left knee bone inflammation moving Seles into the next round on a walkover 
10334 TENNIS SERIOUS MEDVEDEV IS HAVING FUN AGAIN 
10335 Richard Finn 
10336 NEW YORK 1996-08-28 
10337 Outspoken Andrei Medvedev exchanged his reputation as the clown prince of tennis on Wednesday for a new no-nonsense attitude that has made life on the courts fun again 
10338 I think I 'm much more focused on what I have to do and that 's playing tennis Medvedev said after routing Frenchman Jean-Philippe Fleurian 6-2 6-0 6-1 in the opening round of the U.S. Open 
10339 It was Medvedev 's sixth victory in a row after winning his first tournament of the year last week at the Hamlet Cup 
10340 I realised this year that without putting 99.9 percent of your mind into tennis I do n't think you can successful said the 22-year-old Medvedev 
10341 The whole day I 'm thinking abnout tennis 
10342 I felt that all the other things I was doing the years before they were distracting me they were not helping me at all 
10343 For Medvedev that meant confining his post-match comments to tennis and not going off on tirades about about peripheral issues such as the poor quality of food in the players lounge an entertaining rant that took his mind off the task at hand 
10344 I know what I 'm here for said Medvedev who lost in the second round of the Open the last two years after reaching the quarters in 1993 the same year he tried his hand as a restaurant critic 
10345 I 'm not here to fight the press or talk about the food or entertain the people off the court 
10346 I 'm here to play tennis and to win 
10347 I have much less fun off the court 
10348 I have much more fun on the court he said 
10349 Just three years ago Medvedev was one of the world 's best with a ranking of six after reaching the French Open semifinal and winning three tournaments 
10350 But Medvedev 's ranking slowly began to drop last year as he struggled with a wrist injury 
10351 The Ukrainian finally hit a low of 44th two months ago 
10352 It 's somewhere where I would n't like to stay very long Medvedev said of his current ranking of 36 
10353 It 's a part of the penalty that I have to accept 
10354 As part of his new businesslike approach Medvedev hired Australian coach Bob Brett at the start of this year and the partnership is beginning to pay off 
10355 At the beginning of the year we started from zero said Medvedev 
10356 Winning in Long Island last week was like winning for the first time 
10357 While Medvedev 's 77-minute romp past Fleurian was rather ordinary the fact that the two were playing each other was rather remarkable 
10358 In the original draw Medvedev and Fleurian were slotted to play each other 
10359 When controversy forced the draw to be done over against odds of 151-to-1 Medvedev and Fleurian drew each other a second time 
10360 When I saw the new draw I did n't have to change my preparation Medvedev said 
10361 I think it 's destined that it turned out for me

10485 TENNIS GRAF WORKS HARD FOR FIRST-ROUND WIN 
10486 Bill Berkrot 
10487 NEW YORK 1996-08-27 
10488 It was n't supposed to be this hard for defending champion Steffi Graf to win her opening match at the U.S. Open on Tuesday night 
10489 But the script that called for the usual first-round demolition by the top-ranked top seed was rewritten by 29th-ranked Indonesian Yayuk Basuki playing with nothing to lose abandon 
10490 Graf of course prevailed 6-3 7-6 but not before some tense moments that even had the German superstar thinking the match was going three sets 
10491 I won the second set which I did n't think I would do being down 5-2 and the chances she had at 6-5 Graf recalled 
10492 Several of the other women 's seeds eased into the second round with more typical Graf-like efficiency Tuesday 
10493 As afternoon turned to evening fourth-seeded Spaniard Conchita Martinez took apart Romanian Ruxandra Dragomir in 58 minutes with the loss of just two games one more than second seed Monica Seles who opened the second-day programme by crushing American Anne Miller 6-0 6-1 
10494 Third seed Arantxa Sanchez Vicario the 1994 champion and eighth-seeded Olympic gold medalist Lindsay Davenport dropped three game each en route to the second round 
10495 But the day was not without its seeded casualties on the women 's side 
10496 Fifth-seed Iva Majoli of Croatia was picked off by Austrian Judith Wiesner and Wimbledon semifinalist Kimiko Date of Japan the 10th seed fell 6-2 7-5 to 53rd-ranked American Kimberly Po 
10497 Date 's defeat left no other seeded players in Seles 's quarter of the draw which lost Anke Huber 6 and Maggie Maleeva 12 on Monday 
10498 But Graf winner of 20 Grand Slam titles was not about to join that list 
10499 At some points I felt a little nervous she admitted 
10500 When it came down to the important points I felt more confident 
10501 Basuki a first-round loser here for the fifth consecutive year was clearly going for winners hitting the lines and running Graf around the court as she broke the top seed twice in the second set to grab that shocking 5-2 lead 
10502 Graf ran off the next three games to restore some semblance of order 
10503 But Basuki her long black ponytail flying as she raced for shots held her serve and twice had set point on Graf 's serve at 6-5 before the German unleashed a forehand pass to force the tie-break 
10504 I lost the moment lamented Basuki who has reached the fourth round at Wimbledon four times and was a semifinalist in Montreal earlier this month 
10505 Still the feisty Indonesian got off to a 3-0 lead in the tie-breaker before a pair of costly double faults gave Graf her chance to avoid a third set 
10506 Usually in the first one or two matches you want to find your rhythm and want to get into it said Graf who won seven of the last eight points in the breaker 
10507 To be in that situation today a couple of times having to play well get down and play point-by-point definitely is a good start 
10508 BASEBALL SOSA HAS SURGERY OUT UP TO SIX WEEKS 
10509 CHICAGO 1996-08-27 
10510 Chicago Cubs right fielder Sammy Sosa underwent surgery on Monday to remove a fractured bone from his right hand and will miss four to six weeks the club announced Tuesday 
10511 Sosa a leading candidate for National League Most Valuable Player honours was injured August 20th when he was hit by a Mark Hutton pitch in the first inning of an 8-1 victory over the Florida Marlins 
10512 The 27-year-old Sosa leads the league with 40 homers and is tied for 10th with 100 RBI 
10513 The loss of Sosa who appeared in all 124 games this season is a huge blow to the Cubs playoff hopes 
10514 SOCCER MARCELO HAT-TRICK KEEPS PSV AT TOP OF DUTCH LEAGUE 
10515 AMSTERDAM 1996-08-28 
10516 Brazilian striker Marcelo scored a hat-trick as PSV Eindhoven maintained their 100 percent record and stayed on top of the Dutch first division with a 3-1 win at Volendam on Wednesday 
10517 PSV 's main rivals for the title defending champions Ajax Amsterdam celebrated the novelty of having the roof of their new 51,000 seat stadium closed against the rain with a 1-0 win over AZ Alkmaar 
10518 Ajax were missing six first-team players but Frank de Boer shot home the winner from a 20-metre free kick in the 30th minute of a dull game 
10519 Marcelo signed in close season to replace compatriot Ronaldo who left to play for Barcelona opened the PSV scoring in the 19th minute when he fired home after good work from Rene Eijkelkamp 
10520 The Brazilian found the mark again two minutes after halftime and again in the 56th minute before midfielder Pascal Jongsma scored a consolation goal for Volendam five minutes from time 
10521 Feyenoord Rotterdam suffered an early shock when they went 1-0 down after four minutes against de Graafschap Doetinchem 
10522 The equaliser came in the 73rd minute when Swedish international Henke Larsson scored from close range and 10 minutes later Jean-Paul van Gastel gave Feyenoord a 2-1 victory from the penalty spot 
10523 After three matches PSV lead the first division with nine points three points clear of fifth-placed Ajax 
10524 SOCCER ROBSON WINS FIRST TROPHY WITH BARCELONA 
10525 MADRID 1996-08-28 
10526 Former England manager Bobby Robson enjoyed his first success in charge of Barcelona as his team weathered 90 minutes of non-stop Atletico Madrid pressure to win the Spanish Super Cup 6-5 on aggregate on Wednesday 
10527 Barcelona had won the first leg 5-2 but the second leg was a different story 
10528 Atletico came within a whisker of taking the Cup on the away-goal rule but squandered several chances after going 3-1 ahead 15 minutes from the end 
10529 Juan Lopez gave Atletico the lead midway through the first half after Barcelona fullback Albert Ferrer and substitute goalkeeper Julen Lopetegui failed to clear a Milinko Pantic cross 
10530 Barcelona 's Hristo Stoichkov made his only significant contribution of the evening 10 minutes after halftime when Sergi Barjuan broke down the right to set up the fiery Bulgarian with a simple equaliser 
10531 But Atletico struck back almost immediately through new signing Juan Eduardo Esnaider and then Serbian set-piece specialist Pantic made it 3-1 with a superb free-kick in the 75th minute 
10532 Robson praised Atletico after the game which was played in the Community of Madrid athletic stadium because of pitch problems at the Vicente Calderon ground 
10533 The venue of Atletico 's first league game scheduled for Sunday is still in doubt with the Real Madrid 's Santiago Bernabeu a distinct possibility

10551 SOCCER PARMA ROMA AND UDINESE OUT OF ITALIAN CUP 
10552 ROME 1996-08-28 
10553 UEFA Cup hopefuls Parma and Roma under new coaches this season crashed out of the Italian Cup to second division opponents on Wednesday while league champions Milan could only draw 1-1 at humble Empoli 
10554 Wealthy Parma now coached by the former Italian international Carlo Ancelotti were without new striker Enrico Chiesa and went down 3-1 at serie B club Pescara in their second round clash 
10555 Pescara 's Ottavio Palladini shattered Parma with goals in the second and fourth minutes 
10556 Midfielder Marco Giampaolo made it 3-0 in the 38th minute and Parma 's Alessandro Melli pulled back a late goal six minutes from time 
10557 The second round was the entry point for the bulk of the serie A sides with the winners going through 
10558 The later stages of the cup are played over two legs 
10559 Parma 's defeat was a repeat of last season 's fiasco when they lost their opening cup match 3-0 to Palermo 
10560 Roma now coached by Argentine Carlos Bianchi and watched by Italian national coach Arrigo Sacchi lost 3-1 to Cesena another repeat of last season when the Rome club also went out at the first hurdle 
10561 Udinese with Germany 's Euro 96 hero Oliver Bierhoff in their lineup completed the hat-trick of beaten serie A sides when they went under 2-1 to newly relegated Cremonese 
10562 Milan 's new Uruguayan coach Oscar Tabarez avoided the nightmare of defeat but faces a replay at home next Sunday 
10563 Cup holders Fiorentina easily beat Cosenza 3-1 while European Cup holders Juventus also cruised through with a 2-0 win at small southern club Fidelis Andria 
10564 Two other serie A sides lost at the weekend Piacenza and last year 's losing finalists Atalanta 
10565 Two cup matches could not be played on Wednesday due to argument over first round results 
10566 Lecce 's 3-0 weekend defeat of Genoa was expected to be overturned by a sporting judge on Thursday after the home club fielded an ineligible player 
10567 That would set Genoa up for a second round match against local rivals Sampdoria 
10568 Nocerina 's 4-3 defeat of Piacenza was also subject to a complaint later removed that forced their second round match against serie A newcomers Perugia to be delayed 
10569 SOCCER BAYERN HIT FOUR TO TAKE BUNDESLIGA TOP SPOT 
10570 BONN 1996-08-28 
10571 Goals from Thomas Helmer and Juergen Klinsmann helped Bayern Munich to a 4-2 home win over Bayer Leverkusen on Wednesday and powered them to the top of the Bundesliga 
10572 The comfortable victory gave Bayern 10 points from their first four games a point ahead of second-placed Stuttgart who have a game in hand 
10573 Brazilian midfielder Paulo Sergio put Leverkusen ahead in the 25th minute but Alexander Zickler equalised just a minute later 
10574 A header from Helmer and an acrobatic strike from Klinsmann gave Bayern a two-goal cushion at halftime 
10575 But the pick of the 13-times champions goals came from Ruggiero Rizzitelli who beat three defenders to put Bayern 4-1 up 
10576 Markus Feldhoff hit a consolation goal for Leverkusen 
10577 Hansa Rostock brought Cologne 's 100 percent record to an end with a 2-0 win over the Rhineside club while a Sean Dundee hat-trick inside seven minutes stood out in Karlsruhe 's 4-0 demolition of St Pauli

10627 SOCCER SMICER 'S LAST-GASP GOAL KEEPS LENS IN THE LEAD 
10628 PARIS 1996-08-28 
10629 Euro 96 star Vladimir Smicer of the Czech Republic scored at the last second for Lens allowing them to retain the lead in the French soccer league on Wednesday 
10630 Smicer pushed the ball home in injury time to lead his team to a 3-2 victory over Montpellier who were leading 2-1 until Cameroon 's Marc-Vivien Foe equalised on a header in the 85th minute 
10631 The win was the fourth in as many matches this season for Lens who lead the table on 12 points 
10632 In-form Paris St Germain who dismissed Nantes 1-0 are second with 10 points 
10633 Along with Smicer Robert Pires was the star of the night in France scoring the first hat-trick of the league season in Metz 's 3-1 home victory over neighbouring Strasbourg 
10634 Pires one of the most promising strikers in the country was called up for the first time this week by French manager Aime Jacquet for a friendly against Mexico on Saturday at the Parc des Princes 
10635 Pires scored first with a powerful shot in the 35th minute before striking again from close range just before the break 
10636 A solitary raid allowed him to score his third in the 74th 
10637 Smicer 's goal was as hard-won as his team 's victory 
10638 Spurred by Foe 's leveller five minutes before Lens pressed hard and Foe hit the crossbar in the dying seconds on another header 
10639 The ball bounced back to Smicer 's feet and he scored 
10640 Montpellier seized an unexpected lead thanks to Kader Ferhaoui in the fourth minute after a blunder from Lens goalkeeper Jean-Claude Nadon 
10641 The side from northern France forced to fight an uphill battle from then on pulled level thanks to Tony Vairelles in the eighth minute but young striker Fabien Lefevre made it two for Montpellier five minutes later 
10642 League favourites PSG scored a convincing 1-0 win over Nantes and confirmed they would again be the team to beat this season 
10643 Ironically PSG 's victory owed a lot to two former Nantes players striker Patrice Loko who scored on a brilliant shot in the 33rd minute and defender Benoit Cauet who started the one-two which allowed Loko to score 
10644 The Parisians who have yet to concede a goal were without Brazil 's Leonardo and Panama 's Julio Cesar Dely Valdes both called up by their national sides 
10645 For Nantes who shocked PSG to win the league crown two years ago the fall is very painful 
10646 The Canaries who lost most of their key players within two years have yet to win a match this season 
10647 Reigning champions Auxerre had to settle for a goalless draw against Marseille on Tuesday

10784 ATHLETICS CHRISTIE AND JOHNSON ASKED TO JOIN OWENS TRIBUTE 
10785 Adrian Warner 
10786 BONN 1996-08-28 
10787 Organisers hope to persuade Britain 's former Olympic 100 metres champion Linford Christie to join a Dream Team sprint relay in a special tribute to Jesse Owens at Friday 's Berlin grand prix 
10788 Christie who is retiring from international competition at the end of the season was not due to compete in the German capital but Berlin promoter Rudi Thiel said We are still hopeful of getting him to come 
10789 Thiel has managed to get most of the Olympic 100 metres champions since 1948 to attend the meeting which is being held in the stadium where Owens won four gold medals 60 years ago at the Berlin Olympics 
10790 Canada 's Donovan Bailey the Olympic 100 metres champion and world record holder and Namibian Frankie Fredericks the silver medallist at the recent Atlanta Games have already agreed to run in the 4X100 metres team 
10791 Thiel said on Wednesday that he had also asked Olympic 200 and 400 champion Michael Johnson to run as well as Christie 
10792 Most of the Olympic champions of the past are coming including Britain 's 1980 champion Allan Wells 
10793 Christie belongs to them 
10794 It would be great to have him here 
10795 There is a good offer .... 
10796 My minimum would be that he just ran the relay he said 
10797 The 36-year-old Briton is still considering the offer and is expected to announce his decision later on Wednesday 
10798 Owens 's widow Ruth is not well enough to attend but a message from her will be read out during the meeting and one of the sprinter 's relatives is expected to attend 
10799 The relay race which will include squads from Africa the United States and Europe as well as the Owens quartet will be held at the end of the meeting 
10800 Organisers had hoped to include 1984 and 1988 champion Carl Lewis in the squad but he injured himself in Brussels last Friday 
10801 CRICKET NEW CAPTAIN TENDULKAR UPSTAGED BY 120 FROM JAYASURIYA 
10802 COLOMBO 1996-08-28 
10803 Sachin Tendulkar marked his debut as Indian captain with a patient 110 on Wednesday but was upstaged by dashing Sri Lankan opener Sanath Jayasuriya whose 120 steered the world champions to a nine-wicket Singer Cup win 
10804 Sri Lanka playing in front of their home crowd for the first time since winning the World Cup last March comfortably passed India 's modest 226-5 from 50 overs in 44.2 overs 
10805 The devastating opening pair of Jayasuriya and Romesh Kaluwitharana shared a fine first wicket stand of 129 to the delight of the 25,000 fans 
10806 Jayasuriya whose first 50 included three sixes and three fours went on to an unbeaten 120 and the man-of-the-match award 
10807 Kaluwitharana slow in comparison was bowled by Tendulkar for 53 but Aravinda de Silva with 49 not out helped see Sri Lanka home 
10808 Earlier Tendulkar completed his ninth century in one-day cricket taking 138 balls to do it before being run out 
10809 The rest of the Indian batting was generally tied down by brilliant fielding and some fairly tight bowling although ex-captain Mohamed Azharuddin chipped in with 58 adding 129 with Tendulkar off 28 overs before being stumped 
10810 The next match in the four-nation tournament is on Friday when Sri Lanka play Australia in a repeat of the World Cup final in Lahore where Sri Lanka won by seven wickets

10856 PRESS DIGEST ANGOLA AUG 28 
10857 LUANDA 1996-08-28 
10858 These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Wednesday 
10859 Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy 
10860 JORNAL DE ANGOLA 
10861 Princeton Lyman the U.S. Under-Secretary of State for International Organisations will on Wednesday continue his work in Angola visiting Bailundo where he should be received by Jonas Savimbi leader of Unita 
10862 On Tuesday Lyman participated in a meeting of a joint-commission where he considered that the Angolan politicians should advance faster and find a way to cooperate 
10863 In his opinion the quartering of Unita forces must be concluded in all the Angolan territory and the troops must be selected and integrated in the armed forces the government forces must be concentrated in the principal units and the free circulation of people and goods must be reality in all the country 
10864 S.AFRICAN TRUTH BODY TO SUMMON APARTHEID POLICE 
10865 CAPE TOWN 1996-08-28 
10866 South Africa 's Truth and Reconciliation Commission said on Wednesday it would subpoena persons accused of human rights violations to appear before it 
10867 We can subpoena anyone we want to even the president of the country spokesman John Allen told Reuters 
10868 Subpoenas are due to be served on a number of people this week 
10869 Media reports have speculated that the commission which is trying to heal the wounds of apartheid by confronting the past could subpoena apartheid-era President P.W. Botha and former police generals Basie Smit and Johan Van Der Merwe 
10870 In submissions last week to the commission National Party leader and former president F.W. De Klerk said he had received no co-operation from Botha in compiling his party 's report 
10871 Since it began work in April the commission has been hearing harrowing tales from the victims of apartheid-era abuses by both the white minority regime and its opponents 
10872 It also wants to hear from those who committed the abuses to whom it can offer amnesty in return for frankness 
10873 Hopes that reformed perpetrators would come forward voluntarily have faded but the commission has the legal power to force them to appear 
10874 Allen declined to give say who would be subpoenaed 
10875 At the moment we have a preliminary list of less than 10 people but this is just the beginning he said 
10876 The commission was set up last year to probe 30 years of human-rights violations during the apartheid era 
10877 It is chaired by Nobel Peace winner retired Archbishop Desmond Tutu 
10878 Allen said the commission could announce the names of subpoenaed persons on Monday next week 
10879 TURKISH AIRPLANE LANDS IN SOFIA ON BOMB THREAT 
10880 SOFIA 1996-08-28 
10881 A Turkish airliner on flight from Istanbul to Vienna on Wednesday landed in emergency at Sofia airport after receiving a bomb threat said an airport official 
10882 The plane landed at Sofia airport at 1503 1203 GMT after receiving a signal that there is an explosive on board the official who declined to be named told Reuters 
10883 The plane surrounded by 11 fire-engines is being checked for explosives at the moment 
10884 Nothing has been found so far added the official 
10885 In March a Turkish Cypriot airliner hijacked while on a flight from northern Cyprus to Istanbul landed in Sofia airport to refuel before landing in Munich where the hijacker was arrested 
10886 Arch Alberta well tests 1,100 bbl day 
10887 FORT WORTH Texas 1996-08-28 
10888 Arch Petroleum Inc said Wednesday an exploratory well in Alberta 's Morinville area tested in excess of 1,100 barrels daily and will begin production immediately 
10889 The company said the 90 percent owned Trax et al Morinville 10-23 logged 28 feet of productive Leduc Reef at 5,350 feet 
10890 Reserve estimates from this well are at 250,000 gross barrels of oil 
10891 The Trax well is one of the prospects developed by Arch through its early 1996 purchase of Trax Petroleums Ltd the company said 
10892 It said another the Cometra et al Morinville 11-13 has logged 128 feet of productive Leduc Reef at 5,400 feet and is flowing water free at the rate of 590 barrels of oil per day on a 15 64ths-inch choke 
10893 Arch owns a 16 percent working interest in this well with most of the rest held by the privately owned operator 
10894 Arch said full production has begun and initial estimates of gross reserves attributable to this well range up to one million barrels of oil 
10895 A third well drilled in this area the Trax et al Morinville 2-25 encountered the Leduc Reef but tested wet 
10896 At the company 's Nordegg prospect the Apache et al Saunders 14-28 has reached total depth in the Leduc Reef at approximately 3,800 feet and has been abandoned Arch said 
10897 It said this acreage earning well brought an interest in an additional 5,120 acres building the company 's gross land position in this area to 8,320 acres 
10898 At the Butte prospect the Garrington 4-8 has reached total depth of 11,500 and has logged 278 feet of Leduc Reef 
10899 Testing has begun and results will be announced within the next several days Arch said 
10900 Including the costs of the two abandoned wells the company said these first prospects have added to reserves at a finding cost of about U.S. $ 2 per barrel of oil equivalent 
10901 Jim Brumm 212-859-1710 
10902 U.S. judge orders Biogen Berlex officials deposed 
10903 Leslie Gevirtz 
10904 BOSTON 1996-08-28 
10905 In order to help him decide whether he should hear the case a U.S. District Court judge Wednesday ordered the legal counsels of Biogen Inc and Berlex Laboratories a subsidiary of Schering AG deposed 
10906 The tempest beyond the test tube involves allegations that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration violated the Orphan Drug law by allowing Biogen the right to sell its multiple sclerosis drug Avonex 
10907 Berlex also charges that Avonex is so similar to its MS drug Betaseron that it is a patent infringement 
10908 Both drugs are types of interferon 
10909 One analyst said sales of Avonex had already cut into Betaseron market share 
10910 BioVest Research Inc 's analyst Eddie Hedaya said Berlex sales are losing share like mad 
10911 my understanding of the marketplace is that they 're below expectations 
10912 He added Chiron Corp reported its sales of inventory to Berlex was down 
10913 Chiron makes Betaseron ; Berlex markets it he said 
10914 Biogen in its Securities and Exchange Commission quarterly report for the period ending June 30 said it had earned $ 6.1 million from Avonex sales during the drugs first six weeks on the market 
10915 When it approved Avonex in May the FDA said both Biogen 's product and Betaseron were developed under the incentives of the Ophran Drug Act which provides seven years of marketing exclusivity for products that treat rare diseases 
10916 Avonex has been allowed to enter the market because it differs from interferon beta-1b Betaseron .. 
10917 the FDA said 
10918 Now U.S. District Judge Mark Wolf has ordered the chief counsel for Biogen Michael Astrue and Robert Chabora his counterpart at Berlex be deposed about a May 21 meeting the two men attended to help him determine whether the lawsuit filed by Biogen against Berlex should be heard in Massachusetts 
10919 Berlex filed a lawsuit against Biogen in U.S. District Court in Newark N.J. in July but Biogen had already filed a suit against Berlex in Massachusetts in May 
10920 Wolf ordered the depositions to determine if he or U.S. District Judge John Bissell of Newark should preside over the case

10932 COMEX copper ends higher after late recovery 
10933 NEW YORK 1996-08-28 
10934 COMEX copper ended higher after a late modest recovery dragged the market from the lows but traders shrugged-off an imminent strike at Codelco 's Salvador mine in Chile 
10935 The market was also waiting for Friday 's LME stock report which will include figures delayed from Tuesday because of the U.K. public holiday on Monday when the LME was closed 
10936 We are in the late stages of the weaker period of the market and as we get to the post Labor Day market we will start to see more consumer interest and the demand side of the market will start to firm prices up said William O'Neill of Merrill Lynch 
10937 December COMEX settled 0.35 cent higher at 90.20 cents traded 90.50 to 89.40 cents 
10938 September went out 0.05 cent lower at 91.05 
10939 The August contract expired at 0.85 cent down at 90.85 cents 
10940 Volume was estimated at 8,000 lots 
10941 Workers at Salvador voted to strike from Saturday and it was not clear when further talks between the unions and management would take place 
10942 Salvador is a small facility and the prospects are that if there will be a strike it will not be a long strike O'Neill said 
10943 Huw Jones New York Commodities 212-859-1646 
10944 U.S. copper service center shipments stable CBSA 
10945 NEW YORK 1996-08-28 
10946 Average daily shipments from U.S. copper service centers in July fell three percent from the previous month but were higher than in July 1995 the Copper and Brass Servicenter Association reported 
10947 July was still above the historic average for that month the CBSA said 
10948 In the first seven months of 1996 shipments of copper sheet coil and strip were 2.2 percent ahead of the same period last year 
10949 Alloy shipments however were 7.5 percent down 
10950 Several service centers indicated that while their volume of orders remains constant the size-per-order continues to be smaller than what was realised during the first five months of the year the CBSA said 
10951 Service centers continued to lower their inventories in July when total copper stocks were off two percent and alloy products down 1.9 percent 
10952 New York Commodities 212-859-1646

10961 Chile 's ENAP buys Oriente Escravos crude for Oct 
10962 NEW YORK 1996-08-28 
10963 Chile 's state oil company Empresa Nacional del Petroleo ENAP bought a second spot cargo of Oriente and nearly one million barrels of Escravos in a recent tender traders said Wednesday 
10964 A 400,000 barrel cargo of Ecuadorian Oriente and 960,000 barrels of Nigerian Escravos was awarded in a tender for Oct 15-18 late last week but price information remains vague 
10965 The Oriente will be supplied by the same seller at a small premium to formula a trade source said referring to the first October cargo sold two weeks ago at Petroecuador 's sale formula plus five cents fob 
10966 Escravos was sold on a Dated Brent related basis with premiums for the light grade seen in the low 50-cent range 
10967 The next purchase tender from ENAP is expected for late October or early November crude traders said 
10968 Jacqueline Wong New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1620 
10969 Reuters historical calendar September 4 
10970 LONDON 1996-08-28 
10971 Following are some of the major events to have occurred on September 4 in history 
10972 1241 Alexander III King of Scotland born 
10973 King from 1249-1286 he consolidated royal power leaving Scotland united and independent 
10974 1260 The Ghibellines retook the city of Florence from the Florentine Guelfs at the battle of Monte Aperto 
10975 1768 Francois-Rene Vicomte de Chateaubriand born 
10976 He was a politician one of the first French romantic writers and ambassador to the British court 
10977 He wrote Rene a seminal work in the French romantic movement and a famous autobiography Memoires d'Outre Tombe 
10978 1781 Los Angeles was founded by Spanish settlers and named El Pueblo de Nuestra Senora La Reina de Los Angeles The Town of Our Lady the Queen of the Angels 
10979 1824 Anton Bruckner born 
10980 Austrian composer and organist he wrote nine symphonies on a huge scale and three grand masses in the romantic tradition 
10981 1870 In France the Second Empire was ended and Napoleon III was deposed after his surrender two days earlier in the Franco-Prussian war 
10982 1886 At Skeleton Canyon in Arizona Geronimo Apache chief and leader of the last great Red Indian rebellion finally surrendered to General Nelson Miles 
10983 1892 Prolific French modernist composer Darius Milhaud born 
10984 He wrote a jazz ballet La Creation du Monde and scores for many films including an early version of Madame Bovary 
10985 1906 German-born U.S. biologist Max Delbruck born 
10986 Winner of the 1969 Nobel Prize for physiology or medicine for work on the genetic structure of viruses that infect bacteria 
10987 1907 Edvard Grieg Norwegian composer best known for his Peer Gynt Suite and his Piano Concerto died in Bergen 
10988 1908 U.S. film director Edward Dmytryk born 
10989 Best known for his films Crossfire one of Hollywood 's first attempts to deal with racial discrimination and Farewell My lovely 
10990 1909 The world 's first Boy Scout Rally was held at Crystal Palace near London 
10991 1944 Brussels and Antwerp in Belgium were liberated by British and Canadian troops in World War Two 
10992 1948 Wilhelmina Queen of the Netherlands from 1890 and throughout World Wars One and Two abdicated in favour of her daughter Juliana 
10993 1963 Robert Schuman French statesman Prime Minister 1947-48 and Foreign Minister 1948-52 died 
10994 He was responsible for the establishment of the European Coal and Steel Community 
10995 1964 The Forth Road Bridge in Scotland measuring 6156 ft and with a centre span of 3300 ft was opened by Her Majesty the Queen 
10996 1965 Albert Schweitzer theologian philosopher and organist died in Gabon where he had set up a hospital in 1913 
10997 Acclaimed for his interpretations of J.S. Bach 's works he also won the Nobel Peace Prize for his efforts on behalf of the Brotherhood of Nations in 1952 
10998 1972 At the Olympic Games U.S. swimmer Mark Spitz won his seventh gold medal a record for a single Olympiad 
10999 1974 East Germany and the United States established formal diplomatic relations for the first time 
11000 1977 E.F. Fritz Schumacher economic guru and author of the best seller Small is Beautiful died on his way to a conference in Switzerland 
11001 1989 Georges Simenon writer of 84 books based on the detective character Inspector Maigret died 
11002 1992 Bulgaria 's former Communist leader Todor Zhivkov deposed in 1989 was sentenced to seven years in prison after being found guilty of embezzling state funds 
11003 1995 Declaring united Jerusalem is ours Israel launched a 15-month celebration of the 3,000th anniversary of King David 's proclamation of the city as the capital of the Jewish people

11005 UK lowers noise limits for three London airports 
11006 LONDON 1996-08-28 
11007 The British government on Wednesday lowered the noise limits for London 's Heathrow Gatwick and Stansted airports and announced it would make a bigger effort in detecting and fining violators 
11008 The limits effective from January 1 1997 are reduced as much as possible while still complying with international obligations a spokesman for the Department of Transport said 
11009 The maximum noise level during the day is trimmed by three decibels to 94 while the night time level is reduced by two decibels to 87 
11010 It is a smaller reduction in terms of loudness than was sought by local people 
11011 Nevertheless I am satisfied that the overall benefits will be worthwile Lord Goschen minister for aviation said in a statement 
11012 The ministry said it believed the new limits could be met with existing aircraft 
11013 They can be flown in quieter ways a spokesman said 
11014 The reduction in noise levels is the same as proposed in a consultation paper which was published in October 1995 
11015 The present noise levels have applied at Heathrow one of the world 's busiest airports since 1959 and at Gatwick since 1968 
11016 The number of monitors will be increased and some will be repositioned to detect noisy planes 
11017 London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717

11050 Canada fast-tracks Chinese asylum-seekers report

11052 Canada is fast-tracking immigration applications from Chinese dissidents in Hong Kong before the British colony reverts to China 's control next year the Vancouver Sun reported on Wednesday 
11053 The applications are being fast-tracked in the sense that we are processing them and the ones who have been referred to us have been interviewed the newspaper quoted Garrett Lambert Canada 's high commissioner in Hong Kong as saying 
11054 A small number already have preliminary indications as to what the disposition of their cases are and so I suppose in that sense I guess we have given them some preferential treatment Lambert said 
11055 He declined to say how many people were being considered for asylum 
11056 Canada 's ministry of foreign affairs in Ottawa had no immediate comment on the report 
11057 About 80 Chinese dissidents are believed to be living in exile in Hong Kong 
11058 Their fate after the territory reverts to Chinese rule is unclear 
11059 Britain hands Hong Kong back to China at midnight on June 30 1997 after 150 years of colonial rule 
11060 Canada 's Minister of Foreign Affairs Lloyd Axworthy said after meeting Hong Kong Gov 
11061 Chris Patten last month that Canada may grant asylum to dissidents who have fled to Hong Kong from China 
11062 Chinese officials have said such dissidents may not become Hong Kong permanent residents since they entered the territory illegally but have also said their status would be decided by the post-1997 local Hong Kong administration

11099 Kaba told reporters the annual wage bill of 171 billion Guinean francs represented 50 percent of current state expenditure whereas the acceptable proportion in countries similar to ours is one third

11126 Dutroux suspected in murder of Slovak woman 
11127 Peter Laca 
11128 BRATISLAVA 1996-08-28 
11129 Marc Dutroux the chief accused in a Belgian child murder and sex abuse scandal is suspected of murdering a young Slovak woman the Slovak office of Interpol said on Wednesday 
11130 Rudolf Gajdos head of Slovak Interpol told a news conference Dutroux was also believed to have planned the kidnapping of at least one Slovak woman 
11131 One of the police versions in the case of the murder of young gypsy woman in Topolcany western Slovakia this July is a suspicion that Mark Dutroux could have been involved in the murder Gajdos said without elaborating on the age of the victim and on the other versions 
11132 Slovak police Interpol and Belgian police have been following leads on Dutroux 's activities in Slovakia and the neighbouring Czech Republic where he is known to have made frequent visits 
11133 Gajdos said the police sketch of the suspected murderer was 60 percent identical with Dutroux 's portrait and that Dutroux was known to have been in Topolcany around the time of the woman 's murder 
11134 Topolcany and the area around this town were reported to have been the most visited places by Dutroux and his accomplices in Slovakia Gajdos said 
11135 Dutroux a convicted child rapist and unemployed father-of-three led police 11 days ago to the bodies of eight-year-olds Julie Lejeune and Melissa Russo in the garden of another of the six houses he owns around the southern Belgian city of Charleroi 
11136 The Belgian police also informed us that Dutroux together with one other man had also planned the kidnapping of at least one Slovak woman Gajdos said 
11137 The plan apparently failed due to difficulties in crossing the border he added but did not elaborate 
11138 The Slovak police are also investigating visits by about 10 Slovak women aged 17 to 22 to Belgium at the invitation of Dutroux 
11139 The women said they went to Belgium voluntarily and police suspect they were used to act in pornographic films Gajdos said earlier this week 
11140 But he added they had difficulty remembering what happened during their visits to Belgium perhaps because of drugs and were unsure whether they were filmed for pornography 
11141 Dutroux 39 who was charged last week with the abduction and illegal imprisonment of two girls aged 14 and 12 is also suspected in the disappearance of Belgians An Marchal 19 and Eefje Lambrecks 17 who went missing a year ago

11188 Exiled Bosnians protest confusing voting rules 
11189 Duncan Shiels 
11190 NAGYATAD Hungary 1996-08-28 
11191 Bosnian refugees in Hungary the first to vote last weekend in their country 's first post-war election found the rules confusing and some had no idea who they voted for refugees and officials said on Wednesday 
11192 For the most part they really did n't understand what was going on the director of the Nagyatad camp Lajos Horvath told Reuters on Wednesday 
11193 It was confusing they had no experience of voting many of the refugees are only semi-literate and none of them knew anything about the candidates he said 
11194 They just voted along ethnic lines where they could 
11195 The Bosnian election is set for September 14 and voting began on Wednesday for most of the 600,000 Bosnians living abroad 
11196 The Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe which is running the election allowed the ballot to be held on Sunday in four Hungarian refugee camps 
11197 Some Moslem refugees among the 385 registered voters Hungary 's largest camp Nagyatad have written to the OSCE complaining that they were unable to vote in contests for the president or assembly of the Bosnian-Croat Federation where most Moslems live 
11198 This was because their pre-war homes are now in the Serb-controlled territory so they were voting for the national assembly of the Republika Srbska most of the candidates for which are Serbs 
11199 For the foreign powers which back last year 's Dayton peace agreement the main point of the election rules is that by voting as though they were still in their pre-war homes Bosnians should override the effects of ethnic cleansing and reassert the concept of a single multi-ethnic state 
11200 But Adem Hodzic one of the refugees who signed the letter of complaint told Reuters 
11201 We only realised after voting that we were being denied the rights of other Bosnian Moslems to choose our president 
11202 This vote seals the division of my country 
11203 Under the election rules citizens vote for a three-man presidency and House of Representatives for all Bosnia-Hercegovina and for assemblies and cantonal seats in either the Moslem-Croat Federation or the Republika Srbska 
11204 On Sunday voters in Hungary also cast ballots for municipal councils but these will be invalidated following the cancellation of local elections by the OSCE on Tuesday 
11205 Husein Micijevic who also signed the letter alleged that elderly voters were directed who to vote for by Hungarian translators who stood in the polling booth to help them 
11206 Probably 100 refugees were shown where to put their cross he said 
11207 Seventy eight-year-old Mandolina Zelic a Bosnian Croat who has spent the last five years in Nagyatad told Reuters she had cast her ballot because she 'd been told to by the camp authorities but had no idea who she voted for 
11208 At first the organisers would n't let anyone help me but when they saw I did n't understand a young translator ringed the names I had to mark she said 
11209 I do n't know who I voted for 
11210 Maria Szabo of the Hungarian office organising the elections on behalf of the OSCE told Reuters on Wednesday her office was studying the letter but said they had followed OSCE instructions very carefully 
11211 The envelopes each with the five different voting slips were sealed until voting and had written instructions on how to vote she said 
11212 But of course those who could not read had to be shown 
11213 Estonia presidential race next round on Sept 20 
11214 TALLINN 1996-08-28 
11215 Estonia will hold the next round of an inconclusive state presidential race on September 20 parliamentary officers of the Baltic state ruled on Wednesday 
11216 This comes after three votes in the 101-strong parliament on Monday and Tuesday failed to give either incumbent Lennart Meri or rival candidate Arnold Ruutel the necessary 68 votes for a clear mandate 
11217 The outcome was a rebuff for Meri failing three times to win backing in his bid for a second term as head of state of the former Soviet republic 
11218 Parliament 's press officer told Reuters that Speaker Toomas Savi will convene an electoral college involving 101 MPs and and 273 local government representatives on September 20 
11219 Both Meri 67 and Ruutel 68 will automatically be listed as candidates but the election will also be open to new nominations with the backing of any 21 members of the college 
11220 The winner has to secure a majority from the college within two rounds of voting otherwise the election will go back before the parliament

11238 BUCHAREST 1996-08-28 
11239 Romania 's state budget deficit jumped sharply in June to 1,242.9 billion lei for the January-June period from 596.5 billion lei in January-May official data showed on Wednesday 
11240 Six-month expenditures stood at 9.50 trillion lei up from 7.56 trillion lei at end-May with education and health spending accounting for 31.6 percent of state expenses and economic subsidies and support taking some 26 percent 
11241 January-June revenues went up to 8.26 trillion lei from 6.96 trillion lei in the first five months this year 
11242 Romania 's government is expected to revise the 1996 budget on Wednesday to bring it into line with higher inflation new wage and pension indexations and costs of energy imports that have pushed up the state deficit 
11243 Under the revised version state spending is expected to rise by some 566 billion lei 
11244 No new deficit forecast has been issued so far 
11245 In July the government gave a 6.0-percent wage and pension indexation to cover energy fuel and bread price increases which quickened inflation to 7.5 percent last month 
11246 In the original state budget approved in March revenues were envisaged at around 16.98 trillion lei and expenditures 20.17 trillion lei for 1996 
11247 The state budget deficit was originally forecast to be 3.19 trillion lei for the whole year 
11248 On Wednesday the leu 's official rate was 3,161 to the dollar

11262 A top judicial official and critic of President Ernesto Samper accused the government of indifference on Wednesday over efforts to lift Colombia 's five-year-old ban on extradition

11264 Constitutional reforms were proposed on Tuesday by two senators one of them a member of Samper 's own Liberal Party aimed at lifting the ban on extradition introduced in 1991 
11265 U.S. Ambassador Myles Frechette applauded the move saying it could prompt the Clinton administration to remove Colombia from a list of outcast nations that have failed to cooperate in U.S. counternarcotics efforts

11267 Extradition is not on the government 's legislative agenda he told reporters on Tuesday

11269 But he fell far short of endorsing the idea of putting Colombian drug lords onto U.S.-bound flights to serve stiff penalities in American prisons

11275 The quake was felt for about seven seconds in most of the country but preliminary reports said no one was hurt it added

11281 Officials said the Senate vote removed all existing legislative hurdles in the way of CVRD 's sell-off 
11282 The motion was put forward by Sen 
11283 Jose Eduardo Dutra who had drawn up the bill 
11284 The Senate vote also annulled a substitute version of Dutra 's bill which had sought to dedicate revenue from Vale 's privatization to regional infrastructure projects
