13619 Finnish police said on Thursday they had arrested two men suspected of sexually abusing a captive 13-year-old girl but did not believe the case was linked to others in Europe 
13620 The men both Finns aged about 40 were arrested last Saturday in the western town of Tampere in a raid on a luxury boat owned by one of them 
13621 The girl was being held on the boat and had sought help from a passer-by police chief inspector Ilkka Laasonen said 
13622 This is an individual case and I do n't have any evidence linking the suspects to any other cases Laasonen said 
13623 The girl was taken to hospital 
13624 The men could face charges carrying up to six to 10 years in prison he said 
13625 Witnesses had reported seeing many young women and some girls who looked clearly underage at parties around the boat in recent weeks the daily newspaper Iltalehti said 
13626 Audi CEO says expects no 96 currency impact 
13627 INGOLSTADT 1996-08-29 
13628 Audi AG management board chairman Herbert Demel said on Thursday that the German luxury carmaker a unit of Volkswagen AG did not expect any burden on its 1996 results from currency market volatility 
13629 We do not expect any burden on our 1996 results from currency markets Demel told Reuters in an interview 
13630 Audi would have been able to report a profit 300 million marks higher in 1995 if exchange rates had stayed the same as in 1994 Demel had told a shareholder meeting last April 
13631 Demel said the carmaker had hedged about half of its currency risk for 1996 
13632 John Gilardi Frankfurt Newsroom +49 69 756525 
13633 KEKKILA SEES FULL-YR 1996 PROFIT VS LOSS 
13634 HELSINKI 1996-08-29 
13635 Fertilisers and saplings maker Kekkila Oy said on Thursday in a statement it expected a falling result trend in the latter half of the year but a full-year profit was nevertheless likely 
13636 Due to natural seasonal fluctuations in operations the end-year result trend will be falling but based on the early year result trend a profitable result is likely to be achieved Kekkila said in its January-June interim report 
13637 In 1995 Kekkila reported a 5.6 million markka loss before extraordinary items and tax 
13638 In the first half Kekkila posted a 6.1 million markka profit up from 0.7 million 
13639 Helsinki Newsroom +358 0 680 50 245 
13640 INTERVIEW-T&N untroubled by margin pressure 
13641 LONDON 1996-08-29 
13642 The chairman of British-based components and engineering group T&N Plc said on Thursday the firm remained confident about the general prospects for its operating margins despite pressure from unsettled markets 
13643 In an interview following its first-half results which included a less optimistic forecast for the second half of this year than it had made in the past Sir Colin Hope said T&N had taken defensive action to protect it from patchy markets 
13644 Looking at market prospects he said I think our best judgment at this stage is that it will probably bumble along in the rather mixed way it 's been in the first half 
13645 It 's very difficult to predict the market trend this year 
13646 It could be better or it could be worse Hope added echoing the demand uncertainty across automotive industries 
13647 You can see anxieties in Germany and France in particular beginning to grow and develop 
13648 America however is looking a little better he said 
13649 Compared with the end of last year when T&N predicted a sluggish first half and a rebound later in 1996 Hope said I think the difference now is the first half has not actually been as bad as some felt it was going to be but equally we 're certainly not predicting a recovery in the second half 
13650 Against this background Hope said the group was glad it had rationalised and destocked even though this had pressed margins which had slipped to 9.5 percent from 11.3 percent a year ago 
13651 I think the figure of 9.5 percent on the first half when you consider the fact that we 've been destocking the fairly mixed customer demand and the fact that we sold the southern African mines actually is not bad 
13652 It does show how easily we should be able to bounce back over 10 percent again he added saying We continue to feel very relaxed about our general view that we would average 10 percent profit margins over the cycle 
13653 We 've always taken the view that we are the sort of company that 's quite capable of working in difficult circumstances we 're rather used to it 
13654 And we feel very confident that we 're doing all the right things Hope said 
13655 When the profit figures will bounce back up again is just a function of markets recovering just a fraction he added 
13656 Commenting on the continued struggle to get control of German piston maker Kolbenschmidt which has been hampered by regulatory obstacles Hope said T&N 's confidence continues to improve that it may eventually be able to proceed 
13657 Andrew Huddart London Newsroom +44 171 542 8716 
13658 Earthquake jolts New Zealands South Island 
13659 WELLINGTON 1996-08-29 
13660 An earthquake measuring 5.5 on the Richter scale shook New Zealands upper South Island on Thursday but there were no reports of injuries Television New Zealand said 
13661 It said the quake centred near the small town of Waiau was strongly felt in the cities of Nelson and Christchurch 
13662 Some minor damage had been reported in the spa town of Hanmer 
13663 New Zealand is prone to frequent earthquakes but they rarely cause major damage 
13664 The country has only 3.5 million people in an area about the size of Britain or Japan 
13665 Hong Kong 's Tsang sees growth smooth transition 
13666 Mark Trevelyan 
13667 WELLINGTON 1996-08-29 
13668 Hong Kong Financial Secretary Donald Tsang said on Thursday he expected the territory 's economy to keep growing at around five percent but with some fluctuations from year to year 
13669 Tsang who made the remarks during a visit to New Zealand also spoke strongly in favour of keeping the Hong Kong dollar pegged to its U.S. counterpart and said negotiations with China on next year 's budget were going smoothly 
13670 Hong Kong 's economy grew by only 3.1 percent in the first quarter down from 5.9 percent a year earlier and some private sector economists have revised downwards their predictions for the 1996 year 
13671 Second quarter growth estimates will be released when the Hong Kong government issues its half-yearly economic report on Friday 
13672 Our trend growth rate of five percent in real terms is pretty solid Tsang told a news conference after meeting New Zealand Finance Minister Bill Birch 
13673 There will be fluctuations in individual years but it wo n't be a big margin he said 
13674 He said inflation was under control and the Hong Kong dollar was rock solid 
13675 Its link to the U.S. dollar had proved an engine of growth for the past 12 years 
13676 There 's absolutely no economic or financial or political reason for us to change 
13677 A lot of investment in Hong Kong some of which is by China is predicated on the link continuing 
13678 Britain will hand over Hong Kong to Chinese sovereignty at midnight on June 30 1997 
13679 Tsang said three sets of meetings with Chinese authorities on Hong Kong 's 1997-98 budget which will span the transition period had gone smoothly 
13680 None of our basic precepts have been challenged 
13681 Hong Kong will retain its own currency after the handover run its own financial and monetary policy and have control over its own foreign exchange reserves 
13682 It will have no duty to contribute any taxes to Beijing Tsang said 
13683 He described the condition of the property market as very good indeed 
13684 You know we went through a little climb and a little trough over the last few years 
13685 Because of speculation in the market we introduced certain measures but they are not draconian measures and we brought it down to earth 
13686 Tsang said the market would continue to appreciate because property and land were scarce 
13687 The government would put land on the market to stop rentals going through the roof but this would mean reclamation with possible environmental problems 
13688 There will be on the whole a slightly upward climb consistent with our economic growth rate he said in reference to the property market 
13689 Tsang the third senior figure in the government after the governor and chief secretary said his stated aim was to serve as financial secretary for two years under British rule and three years under China 
13690 Taiwan dollar ends higher narrow trade seen 
13691 TAIPEI 1996-08-29 
13692 The Taiwan dollar closed slightly firmer on Thursday amid tight Taiwan dollar liquidity in the banking system and dealers said the rate was likely to move narrowly in the near term 
13693 The Taiwan dollar fell in early trade on month-end U.S. dollar demand but the downtrend was later reversed as Taiwan dollar liquidity tightened 
13694 Banks do not want to hold big U.S. dollar positions at this moment said one dealer adding that the rate was likely to hover around current levels 
13695 The rate closed at T$ 27.482 against Wednesday 's T$ 27.495 
13696 Turnover was US$ 275 million

13705 Volume was 19,560 contracts

13766 HK civil servants contest ban on China panel 
13767 HONG KONG 1996-08-29 
13768 Senior Hong Kong civil servants were given the go-ahead on Thursday to challenge a government ban on them standing for the Beijing-backed panel to choose the territory 's first post-handover leader and lawmakers 
13769 The Supreme Court ruled that a judicial hearing contesting the ban would be heard on September 11 three days before the nomination period for the Selection Committee closes 
13770 The government maintains the ban announced earlier this month is necessary to avoid a possible conflict of interest because civil servants are involved in determining government policy 
13771 Civil servants argue the ban stymies their political rights 
13772 The 400-strong Selection Committee will select Hong Kong 's future chief executive to replace the British governor and a provisional legislature to take over from the elected chamber which Beijing plans to dissolve 
13773 Hong Kong a British colony for more than 150 years will be handed back to China at midnight on June 30 next year 
13774 China intends to dismantle the territory 's first fully-elected legislature because it opposes Britain 's recent electoral reforms and install an interim appointed chamber a decision that has generated considerable controversy 
13775 The judicial review sought by directorate-grade bureaucrats will apply to only about 1,000 of the approximately 33,000 civil servants affected 
13776 Police unions are not contesting the ban which affects all 27,000 officers and nor are the very top tier of Hong Kong 's mandarin class the policy secretaries 
13777 More than 16,000 application forms for places on the Selection Committee have been handed out since the nomination period opened 
13778 It closes on September 14 
13779 Singapore Refining Company expected to shut CDU 3 
13780 SINGAPORE 1996-08-29 
13781 Singapore Refining Company SRC is expected to shutdown its 60,000 barrel-per-day bpd crude distillation unit CDU in September an industry source said on Thursday 
13782 They think something is stuck the source said 
13783 But nothing has been decided as they are still waiting for an X-ray machine to determine the problem 
13784 The source said the problem was discovered during the past month during which time CDU No.3 's production has varied from maximum capacity of 60,000 bpd to as low as 40,000 bpd depending on the crude being run 
13785 We are having a lot of problems said a source 
13786 An earlier problem with CDU No 
13787 3 arose on July 24 when an industry source said the CDU would be closed down briefly in August for repairs to a heat exchanger 
13788 But by mid-August a company spokesman said repairs had been carried out without any shutdown 
13789 The 285,000 bpd SRC refinery is co-owned by the Singapore Petroleum Company British Petrolem and Caltex the joint-venture of U.S. majors Chevron Corp and Texaco Inc

13865 Lenzing expects negative results in H2 
13866 VIENNA 1996-08-29 
13867 Austrian viscose fibre maker Lenzing AG said on Thursday it expected to post negative group results in the second half of the year after posting losses in the first six months 
13868 A preview of the second half of 1996 does not reveal any signs of a significant improvement in market conditions Lenzing said in a statement released ahead of its earnings conference 
13869 For the first six months of the year Lenzing said it posted a group pre-tax loss of 84.5 million schillings from a profit of 160 million in the year-ago period 
13870 The group attributed the first-half losses to weak demand and falling prices of viscose fibres as well as sluggish economies in the West 
13871 Julia Ferguson Vienna newsroom +431 53112 274 
13872 Algeria faults Britain over Islamists gathering 
13873 PARIS 1996-08-28 
13874 Algeria fighting a vicious war against Moslem fundamentalist guerrillas attacked Britain on Wednesday for allowing Islamist groups to meet in London 
13875 The Islamist gathering due to be held in London on September 8 has triggered concern and anger in several other Arab countries like Egypt which is also fighting armed Moslem fundamentalists 
13876 British Jewish groups have also voiced protest because they said Palestinian Islamist Hamas as well as the banned Algerian Islamic Salvation Front FIS are among those radical Islamists attending the conference 
13877 A foreign ministry spokesman said in a statement read on Algerian television that Algeria has received with concern the information over a meeting of terrorist groups working against the interests of the Arab and Islamic world 
13878 Algeria expresses its sharp rejection of a meeting putting together masterminds and ideologists and financers of terrorism the spokesman said adding the Algerian government has asked the British embassy in Algiers for clarifications 
13879 The Algerian ambassador in London has also asked for clarification from the Foreign Office over the meeting of Islamist groups 
13880 Algeria said they are clearly working to undermine the stability of Arab countries 
13881 British Foreign Secretary Malcolm Rifkind said on Tuesday from Pakistan his government would only take action against the planned Islamists gathering in London if British law was broken 
13882 People who wish to hold conferences of course do n't need to seek permission from the government in Britain he said 
13883 An estimated 50,000 people including more than 110 foreigners have been killed in Algeria 's violence pitting Moslem rebels against government forces since early 1992 when authorities in Algeria cancelled a general election in which FIS had taken a commanding lead

13887 Wall Street ponders Rubin 's role if Clinton wins 
13888 Donna Sells 
13889 NEW YORK 
13890 The outcome of the November elections emerged as a hot topic on Wall Street this week as financial pundits debated whether Robert Rubin might forgo a second term as Treasury secretary if President Clinton is re-elected 
13891 Concern centred on the currency markets since Rubin 's tour de force has been his unflagging support of the dollar 
13892 Speculation that Rubin might not stay in his post grew after he sidestepped questions about any future Cabinet post during television interviews at the Democratic convention in Chicago this week 
13893 Should Rubin leave Wall Street would worry that he might take his strong-dollar policy with him 
13894 Rubin 's predecessor at the Treasury Lloyd Bentsen was viewed with suspicion by some in the financial markets who thought he had tried to push down the dollar to gain an edge in trade negotiations with Japan 
13895 Obviously under the Clinton administration we 've seen two distinctively different dollar policies said Chris Widness an international economist at Chase Securities Inc. Under Rubin the U.S. has certainly looked for a strong dollar 
13896 That strategy backed up by timely instances of joint central bank intervention helped the dollar battle back from post-Second World War lows of 1.3438 German marks on March 8 1995 and 79.75 Japanese yen on April 19 1995 
13897 Currently the dollar stands at about 1.48 marks and 109 yen 
13898 Rubin was widely hailed as the architect of the dollar 's comeback using skills and expertise gained in 26 years on Wall Street part of which were spent as co-chairman of Goldman Sachs and Co 
13899 Inc 
13900 Rubin has done a fine job in that position said Michael Faust a portfolio manager at Bailard Biehl and Kaiser which manages just under $ 1 billion in global stocks and bonds 
13901 Anyone who would come in there to replace him would have awfully big shoes to fill 
13902 Fear that a new Treasury secretary might favour a return to Bentsen-era policy could spell trouble for financial markets 
13903 Some overseas investors might shy away from buying U.S. stocks and bonds or even sell them when the dollar is weakening 
13904 As for U.S. Treasury securities Widness explained that Alan Greenspan 's reappointment as chairman of the Federal Reserve and the outlook for the federal budget were more important than whether Rubin continues at the Treasury 
13905 Although if we did get someone that was seen as looking for a dollar depreciation it would probably hurt capital flows to the United States said Widness adding that could hurt U.S. stocks and to a lesser degree bonds 
13906 Still markets may have little to fear from any Rubin successor because the firm dollar policy has yielded positive results 
13907 If that is true then any new Treasury chief would need to be as effective as Rubin in convincing markets that the White House does indeed want a strong currency 
13908 If he left the first question people would ask the next guy is What 's your view on the dollar ? 
13909 said Michael Perelstein portfolio manager of MainStay International Funds 
13910 And all I can say as a piece of advice is that they 'd better say exactly the same thing as Rubin if not stronger Perelstein said 
13911 Otherwise you get selling out of Tokyo and Frankfurt again

13923 CYCLING BALLANGER KEEPS SPRINT TITLE IN STYLE 
13924 Martin Ayres 
13925 MANCHESTER England 1996-08-30 
13926 Felicia Ballanger of France confirmed her status as the world 's number one woman sprinter when she retained her title at the world cycling championships on Friday 
13927 Ballanger beat Germany 's Annett Neumann 2-0 in the best-of-three matches final to add the world title to the Olympic gold medal she won in July 
13928 France also took third place in the sprint Magali Faure defeating ex-world champion Tanya Dubnicoff of Canada 2-0 
13929 Ballanger 25 will be aiming to complete a track double when she defends her 500 metres time trial title on Saturday 
13930 The other final of the night the women 's 24-kms points race also ended in success for the reigning champion 
13931 Russia 's Svetlana Samokhalova fought off a spirited challenge from American Jane Quigley to take the title for a second year 
13932 Russia the only nation to have two riders in the field made full use of their numerical superiority 
13933 Goulnara Fatkoullina helped Samokhalova to build an unbeatable points lead before snatching the bronze medal 
13934 Quigley a former medallist in the points event led the race at half distance 
13935 I went so close this time but having two riders certainly gave the Russians an advantage she said 
13936 The first six riders lapped the field which left former world champion Ingrid Haringa of the Netherlands down in seventh place despite having the second highest points score 
13937 Olympic champion Nathalie Lancien of France also missed the winning attack and finished a disappointing 10th

13961 SOCCER FRENCH DEFENDER KOMBOUARE JOINS ABERDEEN 
13962 ABDERDEEN Scotland 1996-08-30 
13963 French central defender Antoine Kombouare has completed a 300,000 pounds sterling $ 467,000 move to Aberdeen from Swiss club Sion the Scottish premier division club said on Friday 
13964 Kombouare has signed a two-year contract and will make his debut against Morton in the Scottish League Cup on Tuesday 
13965 But he will be ineligible for the rest of Aberdeen 's UEFA Cup campaign as he has already played for Sion in this season 's Cup Winners Cup 
13966 Aberdeen manager Roy Aitken said It 's unfortunate for us that Antoine cannot play in Europe but he will help us achieve things in domestic competition 
13967 I have been watching him for several weeks now and have no doubts he brings real quality to the side 
13968 He has a great deal of experience and I 'm sure he will quickly establish himself in both the team and the affection of our fans 
13969 The 32-year-old defender played seven seasons with Nantes and was with Paris St Germain for five seasons 
13970 He said former PSG team mate David Ginola who now plays for English premier league Newcastle was influential in his move to Scotland 
13971 I 'm a very good friend of David and spoke to him recently about coming to Aberdeen and he was very positive about it Kombouare said 
13972 He said I would really enjoy life there and that I would settle in in terms of football as well 
13973 That and the fact he is only a few hours drive away influenced my decision to come to Aberdeen

14019 CRICKET LEICESTERSHIRE TAKE OVER AT TOP AFTER INNINGS VICTORY 
14020 LONDON 1996-08-30 
14021 West Indian all-rounder Phil Simmons took four for 38 on Friday as Leicestershire beat Somerset by an innings and 39 runs in two days to take over at the head of the county championship 
14022 Their stay on top though may be short-lived as title rivals Essex Derbyshire and Surrey all closed in on victory while Kent made up for lost time in their rain-affected match against Nottinghamshire 
14023 After bowling Somerset out for 83 on the opening morning at Grace Road Leicestershire extended their first innings by 94 runs before being bowled out for 296 with England discard Andy Caddick taking three for 83 
14024 Trailing by 213 Somerset got a solid start to their second innings before Simmons stepped in to bundle them out for 174 
14025 Essex however look certain to regain their top spot after Nasser Hussain and Peter Such gave them a firm grip on their match against Yorkshire at Headingley 
14026 Hussain considered surplus to England 's one-day requirements struck 158 his first championship century of the season as Essex reached 372 and took a first innings lead of 82 
14027 By the close Yorkshire had turned that into a 37-run advantage but off-spinner Such had scuttled their hopes taking four for 24 in 48 balls and leaving them hanging on 119 for five and praying for rain 
14028 At the Oval Surrey captain Chris Lewis another man dumped by England continued to silence his critics as he followed his four for 45 on Thursday with 80 not out on Friday in the match against Warwickshire 
14029 He was well backed by England hopeful Mark Butcher who made 70 as Surrey closed on 429 for seven a lead of 234 
14030 Derbyshire kept up the hunt for their first championship title since 1936 by reducing Worcestershire to 133 for five in their second innings still 100 runs away from avoiding an innings defeat 
14031 Australian Tom Moody took six for 82 but Chris Adams 123 and Tim O'Gorman 109 took Derbyshire to 471 and a first innings lead of 233 
14032 After the frustration of seeing the opening day of their match badly affected by the weather Kent stepped up a gear to dismiss Nottinghamshire for 214 
14033 They were held up by a gritty 84 from Paul Johnson but ex-England fast bowler Martin McCague took four for 55 
14034 By stumps Kent had reached 108 for three

14049 LONDON 1996-08-30 
14050 Australia will defend the Ashes in 
14051 a six-test series against England during a four-month tour 
14052 starting on May 13 next year the Test and County Cricket Board 
14053 said on Friday 
14054 Australia will also play three one-day internationals and 
14055 four one-day warm-up matches at the start of the tour 
14056 The tourists will play nine first-class matches against 
14057 English county sides and another against British Universities 
14058 as well as one-day matches against the Minor Counties and 
14059 Scotland

14095 SOCCER SHEARER NAMED AS ENGLAND CAPTAIN 
14096 LONDON 1996-08-30 
14097 The world 's costliest footballer Alan Shearer was named as the new England captain on Friday 
14098 The 26-year-old who joined Newcastle for 15 million pounds sterling $ 23.4 million takes over from Tony Adams who led the side during the European championship in June and former captain David Platt 
14099 Adams and Platt are both injured and will miss England 's opening World Cup qualifier against Moldova on Sunday 
14100 Shearer takes the captaincy on a trial basis but new coach Glenn Hoddle said he saw no reason why the former Blackburn and Southampton skipper should not make the post his own 
14101 I 'm sure there wo n't be a problem I 'm sure Alan is the man for the job Hoddle said 
14102 There were three or four people who could have done it but when I spoke to Alan he was up for it and really wanted it 
14103 In four days it 's very difficult to come to a 100 percent conclusion about something like this 
14104 but he knows how to conduct himself his team mates respect him and he knows about the team situation even though he plays up front 
14105 Shearer 's Euro 96 striking partner Teddy Sheringham withdrew from the squad with an injury on Friday 
14106 He will probably be replaced by Shearer 's Newcastle team mate Les Ferdinand

14120 SOCCER ROTOR FANS LOCKED OUT AFTER VOLGOGRAD VIOLENCE 
14121 MOSCOW 1996-08-30 
14122 Rotor Volgograd must play their next home game behind closed doors after fans hurled bottles and stones at Dynamo Moscow players during a 1-0 home defeat on Saturday that ended Rotor 's brief spell as league leaders 
14123 The head of the Russian league 's disciplinary committee Anatoly Gorokhovsky said on Friday that Rotor would play Lada Togliatti to empty stands on September 3 
14124 The club who put Manchester United out of last year 's UEFA Cup were fined $ 1,000 
14125 Despite the defeat Rotor are well placed with 11 games to play in the championship 
14126 Lying three points behind Alania and two behind Dynamo Moscow the Volgograd side have a game in hand over the leaders and two over the Moscow club 
14127 BOXING PANAMA 'S ROBERTO DURAN FIGHTS THE SANDS OF TIME 
14128 PANAMA CITY 1996-08-30 
14129 Panamanian boxing legend Roberto Hands of Stone Duran climbs into the ring on Saturday in another age-defying attempt to sustain his long career 
14130 Duran 45 takes on little-known Mexican Ariel Cruz 30 in a super middleweight non-title bout in Panama City 
14131 The fight Duran 's first on home soil for 10 years is being billed here as the Return of the Legend and Duran still talks as if he was in his prime 
14132 I want a fifth title 
14133 This match is to prepare me 
14134 I feel good 
14135 I 'm not retiring Duran told Reuters 
14136 But those close to the boxer acknowledge that the man who has won championships in four different weight classes lightweight welterweight junior middleweight and middleweight is drawing close to the end of his career 
14137 Each time he fights he 's on the last frontier of his career 
14138 If he loses Saturday it could devalue his position as one of the world 's great boxers Panamanian Boxing Association President Ramon Manzanares said 
14139 Duran whose 97-12 record spans three decades hopes a win in the 10-round bout will earn him a rematch against Puerto Rico 's Hector Macho Camacho 
14140 Camacho took a controversial points decision against the Panamanian in Atlantic City in June in a title fight

14295 TENNIS TARANGO O'BRIEN SPRING TWIN UPSETS UNDER THE LIGHTS 
14296 Larry Fine 
14297 NEW YORK 1996-08-30 
14298 Andre Agassi escaped disaster on Thursday but Wimbledon finalist MaliVai Washington and Marcelo Rios were not so fortunate on a night of upsets at the U.S. Open 
14299 The 11th-seeded Washington fell short of reprising his Wimbledon miracle comeback as he lost to red-hot wildcard Alex O'Brien 6-3 6-4 5-7 3-6 6-3 in a two hour 51 minute struggle on the Stadium court 
14300 Next door on the grandstand 10th seed Rios lost to another player with a Wimbledon connection bad boy Jeff Tarango 
14301 The temperamental left-hander defeated the Chilean 6-4 4-6 7-6 6-2 
14302 The day programme went smoothly although sixth-seeded former champion Agassi had to wriggle out of a dangerous 3-6 0-4 hole winning 18 of the last 19 games against India 's Leander Paes 
14303 But the night belonged to the upstarts 
14304 Washington who climbed back from a 1-5 deficit two sets down in the third set against Todd Martin in the Wimbledon semifinals looked poised for another sensational comeback 
14305 O'Brien a winner two weeks ago in New Haven for his first pro title served for the match at 5-4 in the third set before Washington came charging back 
14306 I just kept saying to myself keep giving yourself the best chance to win keep battling maybe something will happen said the 26-year-old O'Brien ranked 65th 
14307 I kept my composure and I was proud of myself for that usually I would have folded up the tent and gone home 
14308 The hard-serving O'Brien a former U.S. collegiate national champion fired up 17 aces to ultimately subdue the never-say-die Washington 
14309 The fifth set stayed on serve until the sixth game when Washington after saving one break point with a forehand winner down the line netted a backhand to give O'Brien a 4-2 lead 
14310 The Texan blasted in two aces to hold serve at 5-2 and then converted his eighth match point for victory when Washington found the net with another backhand from 40-0 
14311 You just kind of keep fighting and you keep trying to make him play a little bit 
14312 I think he got a little tight at a couple of moments said Washington 
14313 But I think he served pretty well when he had to 
14314 Tarango whose Wimbledon tantrum two years ago brought him a $ 28,000 fine and suspension from this year 's tournament at the All-England Club argued calls and taunted fans in his lively two hour 24 minute tango with Rios on the grandstand 
14315 A boisterous cheering section backed the distracted Chilean and booed the lanky American who ate up all the attention 
14316 I 'm an emotional player said the 104th-ranked Tarango 
14317 I think I played very well tonight very focused 
14318 The match turned on the third-set tiebreaker which the American won 7-5 much to the dismay of the spectators 
14319 I love the crowd if they boo me every day 
14320 It fires me up makes me play my best tennis Tarango said 
14321 I played some of my best tennis in college when fraternities were throwing beer on me 
14322 If tennis was like that every day I think everybody wold be having a lot more fun 
14323 Rios did not appreciate Tarango 's antics 
14324 He 's always complaining too much said Rios 
14325 But I think it 's not that 
14326 I think I played really bad 
14327 It was tough to play at night 
14328 Balls were going really fast 
14329 I lost too many points that I never lose 
14330 I did n't play my tennis 
14331 I do n't see the ball like I see during the day 
14332 I play an American so that 's why I play at night 
14333 I did n't feel good on the court 
14334 At the end of the match Tarango blew sarcastic kisses to the crowd then jiggled his body to a Rios rooting section in a jeering salute 
14335 I support their enthusiasm Tarango said about the fans 
14336 At the same time they 're cheering blatantly against me 
14337 After I won I figured I could give them a little razzle-dazzle 
14338 NFL AMERICAN FOOTBALL-RANDALL CUNNINGHAM RETIRES 
14339 PHILADELPHIA 1996-08-29 
14340 Randall Cunningham the National Football League 's all-time leading rusher as a quarterback and one of the most athletic players ever to line up over centre retired Thursday 
14341 Cunningham played his entire 11-year career with the Philadelphia Eagles 
14342 A three-time Pro Bowl selection Cunningham rushed for 4,482 yards on 677 carries 
14343 I would like to thank the Eagles organisation and the wonderful fans of Philadelphia for supporting me throughout my career Cunningham said 
14344 Although it saddens me to leave I am looking forward to spending more time with my family and pursuing other interests that have been on the back burner for sometime 
14345 Randall was one of the most exciting quarterbacks in NFL history said Eagles owner Jeffrey Lurie 
14346 During his 11 years in Philadelphia Randall was the cornerstone of the Eagles franchise and brought many great moments to fans in Philadelphia as well as across the NFL 
14347 A second-round choice in 1985 Cunningham completed 1,874-of-3,362 passes 55.7 percent for 22,877 yards and 150 touchdowns 
14348 Cunningham has already been signed as a broadcaster

14364 GOLF HENKE TAKES LEAD IN MILWAUKEE WOODS MAKES PRO DEBUT 
14365 MILWAUKEE Wisconsin 1996-08-29 
14366 Nolan Henke fired a nine-under-par 62 to grab a two-shot lead after the opening round of the $ 1.2 million Greater Milwaukee Open Thursday as 20-year-old Tiger Woods shot 67 in his professional debut 
14367 Henke stood two strokes ahead of Bob Estes and three up on Billy Andrade Duffy Waldorf and Jesper Parnevik 
14368 Woods who turned pro Tuesday after winning an unprecedented third successive U.S. Amateur Championship almost eagled the 18th hole 
14369 He settled for a birdie and a four-under opening round that left him five shots off the pace 
14370 Yesterday was the toughest day I 've had for a long time Woods said 
14371 Today I got to play golf 
14372 He added I thought I got off off to a great start 
14373 It was a perfect start 
14374 I 'm in a good position 
14375 Henke who called his round a pleasant surprise finished with six birdies on the final eight holes 
14376 We finally got things going in the right direction he said 
14377 It was my best round in a very long time 
14378 My short game has improved since I 've had to use it so often 
14379 That 's always been the worst part of my game 
14380 All in all playing bad 's been a good experience 
14381 Henke who came within one shot of the course record set by Andrew Magee during Wednesday 's pro-am has three career PGA Tour victories but none since the 1993 BellSouth Classic 
14382 Estes whose only win came at the 1994 Texas Open and whose best finish this year was a third-place tie at the Nortel Open in January eagled the par-five fourth hole and added five birdies to grab sole possession of second place 
14383 No bogeys on the card he noted 
14384 Sometimes I take more pride in that 
14385 Woods was among a group of 13 players at four under including 1993 champion Billy Mayfair who tied for second at last week 's World Series of Golf and former U.S. Open champ Payne Stewart 
14386 Defending champion Scott Hoch shot a three-under 68 and was six strokes back 
14387 Phil Mickelson the only four-time winner on the PGA Tour skipped the tournament after winning the World Series of Golf last week 
14388 Mark Brooks Tom Lehman and Mark O'Meara who make up the rest of the top four on the money list also took the week off 
14389 SOCCER SILVA 'S `LOST PASSPORT EXCUSE NOT ENOUGH FOR FIFA 
14390 MADRID 1996-08-30 
14391 Spanish first division team Deportivo Coruna will be without key midfielder Mauro Silva for Saturday 's game with Real Madrid after FIFA soccer 's world governing body suspended the Brazilian for one game for missing his national side 's European tour 
14392 Silva excused his absence from Brazil 's game against Russia on Wednesday and Saturday 's match with the Netherlands by saying he had lost his passport 
14393 But that did not prevent him from collecting the one-match suspension 
14394 ATHLETICS MITCHELL DEFEATS BAILEY IN FRONT OF FORMER CHAMPIONS 
14395 Adrian Warner 
14396 BERLIN 1996-08-30 
14397 American Dennis Mitchell outclassed Olympic 100 metres champion Donovan Bailey for the third time at a major post-Games meeting in front of the most experienced sprinting crowd in the world on Friday 
14398 Watched by an array of former Olympic sprint champions at the Berlin grand prix meeting Mitchell made a brilliant start in the 100 metres and held off Bailey 's strong finish to win in 10.08 seconds despite cool conditions 
14399 Bailey who set a world record of 9.84 on his way to victory in Atlanta could not catch his American rival and had to settle for third in a tight finish 
14400 Jamaica 's Michael Green was second with 10.09 with Bailey finishing in 10.13 
14401 Last Friday Mitchell who finished fourth at the Atlanta Games upstaged a trio of Olympic champions including Bailey to win the 100 in Brussels 
14402 Earlier this month he also beat world champion Bailey in Zurich 
14403 Berlin Brussels and Zurich all belong to the most lucrative series in the sport the Golden Four 
14404 Among the crowd on Friday were Olympic 100 metres champions going back to 1948 
14405 They had been invited to the meeting to watch a special relay to mark the 60th anniversary of Jesse Owens 's four gold medals at the 1936 Olympics in the same Berlin stadium 
14406 Today the concentration was the most important thing for me Mitchell said 
14407 Despite the coolish conditions American Olympic champion Gail Devers looked in commanding form in the women 's 100 clocking 10.89 to defeat Jamaican rival Merlene Ottey who was second in 10.94

14576 SOCCER THREE STANDARD LIEGE PLAYERS BANNED CLUB FINED 
14577 GENEVA 1996-08-30 
14578 UEFA came down heavily on Belgian club Standard Liege on Friday for disgraceful behaviour in an Intertoto final match against Karlsruhe of Germany 
14579 The Belgian club were fined 25,000 Swiss francs $ 20,850 for unsporting conduct and captain Guy Hellers banned for seven games 
14580 He was sent off for insulting the referee and then urged his team mates to protest 
14581 Roberto Bisconti will be sidelined for six Euro ties after pushing the referee in the back as he protested about a Karlsruhe goal while Didier Ernst was banned for four matches for a verbal attack soon after Bisconti was also dismissed 
14582 Karlsruhe won the August 20 match 3-1 thanks to two late goals 
14583 They took the tie 3-2 on aggregate and qualified for the UEFA Cup 
14584 ATHLETICS HARRISON EDWARDS TO MEET IN SARAJEVO 
14585 MONTE CARLO 1996-08-30 
14586 Olympic champion Kenny Harrison and world record holder Jonathan Edwards will both take part in a triple jump competition at the Solidarity Meeting for Sarajevo on September 9 
14587 The International Amateur Athletic Federation said on Friday that a schedule reshuffle had allowed organisers to hold a men 's triple jump as well as the women 's long jump on the one usable runway at the war-devastated Kosevo stadium 
14588 Atlanta Games silver medal winner Edwards has called on other leading athletes to take part in the Sarajevo meeting a goodwill gesture towards Bosnia as it recovers from the war in the Balkans two days after the grand prix final in Milan 
14589 Edwards was quoted as saying What type of character do we show by going to the IAAF Grand Prix Final in Milan where there is a lot of money to make but refusing to make the trip to Sarajevo as a humanitarian gesture ? 
14590 SOCCER BARATELLI TO COACH NICE 
14591 NICE France 1996-08-30 
14592 Former international goalkeeper Dominique Baratelli is to coach struggling French first division side Nice the club said on Friday 
14593 Baratelli who played for Nice and Paris St Germain takes over from Albert Emon who was fired on Thursday after Nice 's home defeat to Guingamp 2-1 in the league 
14594 Nice have been unable to win any of their four league matches played this season and are lying a lowly 18th in the table 
14595 SOCCER MILAN 'S LENTINI MOVES TO ATALANTA 
14596 MILAN 1996-08-30 
14597 Former Italian international winger Gianluigi Lentini transferred to Milan in 1992 for what was believed to be a world record sum has been loaned to serie A club Atalanta for a year newspapers reported on Friday 
14598 The Gazzetta dello Sport said the deal would cost Atalanta around $ 600,000 
14599 Lentini 27 joined Milan from Torino in a $ 12 million deal that many have speculated involved far more money changing hands and which has subsequently been investigated by magistrates for alleged financial irregularities 
14600 The player suffered severe head injuries in a near-fatal car crash the following year and has since struggled to regain the form that made him a hero in Turin 
14601 The move to Bergamo-based Atalanta reunites Lentini who fell out with ex-Milan coach Fabio Capello last season with his former coach at Torino Emiliano Mondonico

14666 ROMANIA COMELF H1 PROFIT RISE BELOW TARGET 
14667 BUCHAREST 1996-08-30 
14668 Romanian listed state engineer Comelf said it almost doubled six-month output with net profit rising by 33 percent to 1.069 billion lei 
14669 But the company complained inflation and the artificially high rate of the leu cut profit margins on exports keeping profits well below its forecast of 1.4 billion lei 
14670 Comelf 's six-month output rose to 4,378 tonnes of equipment from 2,684 tonnes in the equivalent period in 1995 the company report to the Bucharest stock exchange showed 
14671 Comelf based in the central Transylvanian town of Bistrita manufactures water purification equipment machinery for the thermal power sector and other equipment 
14672 In the first six months of 1996 we concentrated on increasing the volume of our output and exports in particular and improving the quality of our products the report said 
14673 From January to June Comelf exported 59 percent of its output up from 37.3 percent in the same period last year 
14674 The company said higher than anticipated inflation and rising raw materials and wage costs also hit profits 
14675 Year-on-year inflation initially estimated at 20 percent in December was 33.8 percent in June higher than a revised end-year forecast of 30 percent 
14676 The 12 month figure quickened to 40.3 percent in July 
14677 The leu currency has slipped only gradually this year and is currently quoted at an official rate of 3,162 to the dollar well below the 3,550 retail price that exporters say is more realistic 
14678 Luli Popescu Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264

14683 bank said

14705 Jones Medical completes acquisition 
14706 ST. LOUIS 1996-08-30 
14707 Jones Medical Industries Inc said Friday it completed the acquisition of Daniels Pharmaceuticals Inc of St. Petersburg Fla. for about 2,960,000 shares of Jones common stock 
14708 Jones stock closed down 1/8 at 40 Friday 
14709 Daniels Pharmaceuticals manufactures prescription pharmaceutical products the largest of which is Levoxyl a synthetic thyroid hormone for treating hypothyroidism 
14710 Chicago newsdesk 312 408-8787 
14711 NYMEX heating oil near session lows in pre-close 
14712 NEW YORK 1996-08-30 
14713 NYMEX refined product prices lingered at session lows amid slim volume before the close while crude experienced lackluster buying ahead of the U.S. Labor Day weekend traders said 
14714 There was some profit-taking early on and it 's just sitting there a Texas trader said of heating oil 's and gasoline 's losses 
14715 September heating oil stood 1.02 cents lower at 62.65 cents a gallon 
14716 Heat hit a session low of 62.45 shortly before the close 
14717 September gasoline stood 0.87 cent lower at 62.85 cents a gallon 
14718 Friday 's low in September gasoline was 62.75 
14719 Traders also said players were selling refined products in favor of crude ahead of the front month 's Friday expiry in the refined products 
14720 The October heating oil-to-crude crack spread narrowed to $ 4.22 a barrel from Thursday 's $ 4.58 while the October gasoline-to-crude spread narrowed to $ 3.60 from Thursday 's $ 3.86 a barrel 
14721 October crude stood eight cents higher at $ 22.23 barrel 
14722 Buying interest in crude did not have enough conviction to send it much higher since many players had left early to start the Labor Day holiday weekend traders said 
14723 NYMEX will be closed Monday due to Labor Day 
14724 Harry Milling New York Energy Desk +1 212-859-1761 
14725 U.S. debt futures end lower shaken by Chicago NAPM 
14726 CHICAGO 1996-08-30 
14727 U.S. debt futures finished a shortened pre-holiday session sharply lower as the markets were shaken by a stronger than expected rise in the August National Association of Purchasing Management NAPM index for the Chicago area traders and analysts said 
14728 The August Chicago NAPM rose 8.8 points to 60.0 its highest level since 62.6 in February 1995 and the largest monthly rise since December 1993 
14729 Primary dealers immediately sold Eurodollar and bond futures after the market on average was expecting the index to rise marginally to 51.9 from July 's 51.2 
14730 Traders also said Japanese investors were unwinding long Eurodollar futures short swaps and that heavy put buying helped pressure Eurodollars to lower levels before the close 
14731 One U.S. firm bought 35,000 September 97 mid-curve put options at a strike price of 93.25 to 93.30 in the last two sessions while a French firm bought 4,000 September 93.30 to 93.32 put spreads 
14732 Even before the data came out we were seeing put buying one floor trader said 
14733 Meanwhile funds were reportedly good sellers of five-year notes 
14734 Rumors circulated that the Federal Reserve was buying five-year notes and that a renowned hedge fund manager was buying 10-year notes in the cash markets 
14735 However December T-bonds ended below a major trendline level at 106-26/32 as the yield in the cash bond market set its highest monthly close since April 1995 at 7.12 percent one analyst said 
14736 December bonds blew through the July 30 low of 107-06/32 even though conditions were slightly oversold traders said 
14737 The December calendar spread continued to widen also reflecting the market 's fear of rising inflation 
14738 While the market continues to price-in higher U.S. interest rates there was little conviction to the theory that the Federal Reserve would tighten rates before the next Federal Open Market Committee meeting on September 24 
14739 Federal Reserve governor Lawrence Lindsey speaking on U.S. cable television network CNBC said the U.S. economy appears on balance to be a bit strong adding the central bank would not curb growth provided inflation remains in check 
14740 Earlier in the day Fed chairman Alan Greenspan said at the annual Jackson Hole symposium that the goal of price stability is within reach for major nations 
14741 Traders said the Fed 's decision to adopt a tightening bias at the July FOMC meeting has cast more focus on every piece of U.S. economic news 
14742 The Fed 's stance has really sensitized us to all this data one analyst said 
14743 The revisions to GDP for example may not have attracted a lot of attention 
14744 At the end of pit trade December bonds were off 27/32 at 106-25/32 10-year notes down 21/32 at 105-17/32 munibonds off 17/32 at 111-20/32 December Eurodollars were down 11 bps at 93.94 March Eurodollars were off 13 bps at 93.72 and March T-bills were down 12 bps at 94.33 
14745 Douglas & Lomason shares rise on merger 
14746 FARMINGTON HILLS Mich 
14747 1996-08-30 
14748 Shares of Douglas & Lomason Co were up 4-1/2 at 30-5/8 Friday afternoon after Thursday 's announcement that the vehicle seat maker had agreed to be acquired by Magna International Inc for $ 31 a share or $ 135 million 
14749 Magna was up 1/8 to 48-1/4 on the New York Stock Exchange 
14750 Douglas & Lomason has 4.45 million common shares outstanding some of which are option shares to be purchased at exercise prices less than the $ 31 offered price 
14751 The acquisition will beef up Markham Ontario-based Magna 's North American car and truck seating business allowing it to better compete with Johnson Controls Inc and Lear Corp 
14752 Family-controlled Douglas & Lomason which had 1995 revenue of $ 561 million was finding it more difficult to compete for new seating contracts from vehicle makers said James Hoey chief financial officer 
14753 Unfortunately in the auto industry these days a $ 500 million company is not a big company anymore Hoey said 
14754 This merger makes us much more competitive 
14755 He added that Douglas & Lomason 's top executives have been asked to stay on with Magna after the merger though their future roles have not yet been defined 
14756 Douglas & Lomason 's profits were hurt in the past year by model changeovers which had reduced production at some important customers but are now recovering analysts said 
14757 The company earned $ 11.2 million on sales of $ 299 million in the first six months of 1996 up from year-earlier earnings of $ 4.7 million on sales of $ 285.7 million 
14758 Ford plans to cut its roster of 2,300 tier-one suppliers those it deals with directly in half over the next five years 
14759 The deal really levels the seating field somewhat said John Casesa of Schroder Wertheim & Co 
14760 It should give Magna the critical mass to be a bigger player in that market 
14761 Magna 's traditional strength has been instrument panels door panels and other interior components 
14762 Magna Johnson Controls and Lear have been working to build up their capabilties to supply complete interiors to automakers including seats instrument panels door panels carpeting and headliners 
14763 UK meals feeds follow Chicago higher trade slow 
14764 LONDON 1996-08-30 
14765 UK meals and feeds sellers marked up high protein soymeal by around 1.50 stg a tonne on Friday following gains in Chicago at Thursday 's close 
14766 Trade was very quiet with only one deal reported when spot high protein soymeal fetched 215 stg a tonne ex-store on the south coast 
14767 I would n't get too excited about this one becuase I think it 's for all of five tonnes which when you think about just about sums up the state of the market at the moment said a trader 
14768 Jim Ballantyne London Newsroom +44 171 542 8062 
14769 Iraqi captors of Sudanese jet charged with hijack 
14770 LONDON 1996-08-30 
14771 Seven Iraqis who seized a Sudanese airliner with 199 people aboard and forced it to fly to London were on Friday charged with hijack ending speculation that they might be offered immediate asylum in Britain 
14772 Police said the seven men who freed all their hostages after the plane landed at Stansted airport on Tuesday and then appealed for asylum would appear in court on Saturday 
14773 The Iraqis claimed they were ordinary people persecuted by the regime of Saddam Hussein but interior ministry officials had consistently said it was likely the seven would be charged with hijack before any plea for asylum was considered 
14774 Under English law the maximum sentence for hijack is life imprisonment but there has been widespread speculation that the seven will receive lesser sentences and then be allowed to stay rather than being sent back to Iraq 
14775 The hijack began on Monday when an Amman-bound plane was taken over shortly after it took off from Khartoum 
14776 The hijackers threatened to blow it up during a refuelling stop in Cyprus unless they were taken to London 
14777 After a search of the aircraft following the hijackers surrender police found only knives and fake explosives 
14778 Late bond market prices 
14779 LONDON 1996-08-30 
14780 This is how major world bond markets were trading in late European business on Friday 
14781 GERMANY Bunds extended losses flirting with session lows after falling victim to sharply higher U.S. economic data which revived fears that interest rates may soon turn higher 
14782 The September Bund future on the London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange LIFFE was trading at 97.18 down 0.20 from Thursday 's settlement price 
14783 BRITAIN Gilts struggled off the day 's lows but ended 10/32 down on the day 
14784 A sharp plunge in U.S. Treasuries after a shock rise in the Chicago PMI pulled gilts lower but traders said the market was nervous anyway ahead of August MO data and the PMI survey due on Monday 
14785 The September long gilt future on LIFFE was trading at 107-2/32 down 8/32 from Thursday 's settlement price 
14786 FRANCE Bond and PIBOR futures ended the day higher despite much stronger than expected U.S. data 
14787 The September notional bond future on the MATIF in Paris settled at 123.14 up 0.04 from Thursday 's settlement price 
14788 ITALY Bond futures held to easier levels in late afternoon after the sharp drop in Treasuries but a resilient lira helped limit BTP losses 
14789 The September bond future on LIFFE was trading at 115.45 down 0.13 from Thursday 's settlement price 
14790 UNITED STATES Prices of U.S. Treasury securities were trading sharply lower near midday after a surprisingly strong Chicago Purchasing Managers report shook the markets ahead of the long Labour Day weekend 
14791 The September Treasury bond future on the Chicago Board of Trade was trading at 107-11/32 down 26/32 from Thursday 's settlement price 
14792 The long bond was quoted to yield 7.12 percent

14794 Japanese Goverment Bonds futures which closed before the output data lost much of day 's gains as Tokyo stock prices recovered from the day 's low.In after hours trading the September future on LIFFE was trading at 122.53 up 0.26 from Thursday 's settlement price on the Tokyo Stock Exchange

14800 Boxing-Bruno quits on doctor 's advice 
14801 LONDON 1996-08-30 
14802 Former world heavyweight champion Frank Bruno has quit the ring on medical advice Britain 's Sun newspaper reported on Friday 
14803 An eye specialist told the 35-year-old Bruno that he could be blinded in one eye if he boxed again the newspaper said 
14804 The Briton who lost his World Boxing Council WBC title to Mike Tyson in March said I was in shock as soon as he told me and it still has n't really sunk in 
14805 I never wanted to end like this but at the end of the day I 'm glad I had a good innings 
14806 Bruno for years one of Britain 's most popular sportsmen had hoped to have another shot at the world title and had been in training until a routine eye test on Monday highlighted a problem with his right eye 
14807 Professor David McLeod who examined Bruno told the Sun There is a risk he could be blinded in the eye if he steps into the ring again 
14808 He is in danger of getting a retinal detachment and there is no point in exposing himself to that 
14809 Bruno lost three world title fights before finally landing the crown by beating American Oliver McCall in a unanimous points decision at Wembley in September 1995 
14810 He was only the third Briton ever to hold a world heavyweight title 
14811 But Bruno lost the title on his first defence when he fought American Tyson in Las Vegas 
14812 Bruno suffered a cut eye in the opening round and the referee stopped the fight in the third as the Briton crumbled under a flurry of punches

14844 Yeltsin endorses Lebed Chechnya peace plan agency 
14845 MOSCOW 1996-08-30 
14846 Russian Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin said on Friday that President Boris Yeltsin who is vacationing outside Moscow had backed security chief Alexander Lebed 's peace plan for Chechnya Interfax news agency said 
14847 Lebed is now in Chechnya solving some problems Interfax quoted Chernomyrdin as saying 
14848 The main thing is his programme 
14849 It was agreed with Boris Nikolayevich Yeltsin yesterday 
14850 Lebed whom Yeltsin ordered to restore peace in Chechnya struck a military deal with separatist rebels last week ending the worst fighting in the region in more than a year 
14851 He later discussed with rebel chief-of-staff Aslan Maskhadov a framework political agreement to tackle the most painful issue of the 20-month war the future political status of Chechnya 
14852 Lebed said on Friday he hoped to sign a document with the rebels later in the day which would deal with the political settlement of the conflict 
14853 Moscow which wants to keep Chechnya as a part of the Russian Federation sent troops to the region in December 1994 to quell its independence bid 
14854 Yeltsin has said any deal should preserve Russia 's territorial integrity 
14855 Itar-Tass news agency quoted Lebed as saying that he would suggest to the rebels that the decision on Chechnya 's future political status be deferred by up to 10 years 
14856 Lebed said he had a telephone conversation with Yeltsin late on Thursday but gave no details 
14857 Yeltsin 's press office could not confirm the call 
14858 Chernomyrdin said on Thursday after a meeting with Lebed and top officials who discussed Lebed 's plans to restore peace in Chechnya that it needed more work 
14859 Lebed Chechens sign framework political deal 
14860 KHASAVYURT Russia 1996-08-31 
14861 Russian peacemaker Alexander Lebed said he and rebel military leader Aslan Maskhadov agreed after overnight talks to defer the decision on whether Chechnya should be independent until December 31 2001 
14862 We just now signed a statement and attached the basic principles of relations between the Russian Federation and the Chechen Republic Lebed told reporters after he and Maskhadov signed a package of documents 
14863 He gave no further details 
14864 That 's it the war is over Lebed told reporters who witnessed the signing 
14865 Lebed said he and Maskhadov agreed to defer by more than five years the painful issue of Chechnya 's political status 
14866 Then with cool heads calmly and soberly we will sort out our relations Lebed said after the late-night signing ceremony in this settlement outside Chechnya 's eastern border 
14867 Tens of thousands of people have died in the war begun in late 1994 after Moscow sent troops to quell Chechnya 's independence bid 
14868 But Russia failed to win control over the whole of Chechnya and its troops suffered several humiliating defeats 
14869 President Boris Yeltsin ordered Lebed to restore peace in Chechnya and gave him unspecified sweeping powers to carry out the mission 
14870 Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin said on Friday that Yeltsin backed a package of proposals Lebed took to the talks

14872 SARAJEVO 1996-08-30

14876 Absentee voting in the elections began on Wednesday August 28 and runs for a week 
14877 Election day for those living inside Bosnia is September 14 
14878 The Party of Democratic Action SDA had called on Wednesday for its followers abroad to boycott the absentee balloting because of voter registration irregularities especially among Serb refugees 
14879 The Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe OSCE postponed municipal elections as a result of the irregularities but decided to proceed with voting for higher offices 
14880 The SDA joined by two other parties has been demanding that OSCE prohibit refugees voting from any place other than their pre-war place of residence as a means to prevent the elections from ratifying the results of ethnic cleansing

14889 Top Belarus politician blasts president 
14890 Larisa Sayenko 
14891 MINSK 1996-08-30 
14892 A senior Belarus politician accused President Alexander Lukashenko on Friday of attempting to set up a dictatorship in the former Soviet republic 
14893 The speaker of the Belarus parliament Semyon Sharetsky told Reuters that a draft constitution due to be put to a national referendum on November 7 would dangerously increase the powers of the ruler 
14894 The world community should not be indifferent to the fact that President Lukashenko who leads this European state of 10 million people is trying to establish a dictatorship with his new constitution Sharetsky said 
14895 The new constitution calls for a two-chamber parliament with a 110-seat majority-elected house of representatives and a regionally-represented senate with a third of its members named by the president 
14896 Lukashenko 's aides shrugged off Sharetsky 's charge 
14897 If there was a dictatorship they would n't have the right to say things like this Sergei Posukhov Lukashenko 's political adviser told Reuters 
14898 The people have asked us to establish order and that 's our main aim 
14899 Lukashenko 41 won presidential polls in 1994 on promises to restore order fight corruption and repair the strong links with Russia that were disrupted by the collapse of the Soviet Union 
14900 But during his period in office he has battled against nationalist opponents trade unions and parliament and Sharetsky said the current parliament was ready to try to impeach him 
14901 This constitution which has been prepared in secret aims to gather all power in one man 's hands he said 
14902 We should not be fooled by his quasi-democratic rhetoric and his methods like this referendum 
14903 Lukashenko signed a pact with Moscow in April to create a strong economic and political union which he believes could grow into a federation 
14904 But nationalist groups scared by the prospect of renewed Moscow domination and Russia 's backing for Lukashenko protested against the deal 
14905 Lukashenko responded by cracking down on the nationalist opposition and jailing nearly 200 people for taking part in demonstrations against the pact 
14906 The United States last week granted political asylum to two opposition leaders Zenon Poznyak and Sergei Naumchik 
14907 Tajik troops now control devastated town 
14908 Yuri Kushko 
14909 TAVILDARA Tajikistan 1996-08-30 
14910 Tajik government troops now control of the strategically vital town of Tavildara after driving out Islamic rebels but sporadic gunfire still echoed in the nearby Pamir mountains on Friday 
14911 The commander-in-chief of Tajikistan 's armed forces Major-General Nikolai Sherbatov took a group of journalists by helicopter to the remote and now devastated town to show that his forces held it 
14912 He said his troops took Tavildara without casualties on August 23 but the crack of sniper and machinegun fire revealed the presence of opposition fighters in the surrounding mountains 
14913 Sherbatov said the rebels were located about three km two miles east of Tavildara around the village of Layron 
14914 Tavildara 200 km 120 miles east of the capital Dushanbe was in ruins 
14915 Shells had smashed roofs and windows and empty shell cases littered the streets 
14916 The town straddles a strategically important road linking government and rebel-held territory and has fallen succesively to both sides in a bloody tug-of-war which began last February 
14917 Tajikistan which borders Afghanistan and China has been split by a dragging four-year conflict after a civil war between communists and a frail coalition of Islamic and liberal groups 
14918 Tens of thousands of people have been killed and many more have been displaced in the fighting which breached a shaky United Nations-sponsored ceasefire 
14919 Tavildara is now apparently inhabited only by a few old men women and their grubby barefoot children 
14920 Fruit remained on the trees as there was no one to pick it 
14921 Help me help me said a chorus of women begging soldiers for food 
14922 The town 's school and a shop doubling as a warehouse for humanitarian aid were destroyed in the fighting 
14923 We had to build our own earth shelters to survive the fighting said Rajab Adinayev a bearded elderly Tajik in a long white shirt 
14924 Although shy in front of the government soldiers several inhabitants accused government forces of widespread looting of homes and livestock 
14925 They also said rebel fighters had looted medicines from the local hospital 
14926 One elderly man who declined to give his name said two of his sons were now refugees in Moscow and the other two had left to fight for the opposition 
14927 He also said government soldiers had raped the wife of one of his sons 
14928 It 's not important who holds this town we just need to stop the war he said

14932 During Rosati 's trip the two countries will sign an agreement on mutual protection of investments and a note easing conditions on the granting of visas the agency quoted Foreign Ministry officials as saying 
14933 The Federal Republic of Yugoslavia is the only country of the former Yugoslavia where Poles currently require visas 
14934 They are also to clinch protocols on culture and understanding between the two foreign ministries 
14935 Rosati will meet Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic and Yugoslav politicians in Belgrade before visiting Montenegro 
14936 Poland revived diplomatic ties at ambassadorial level with Yugoslavia in April but economic links are almost moribund despite the end of a three-year U.N. trade embargo imposed to punish Belgrade for its support of Bosnian Serbs 
14937 Poland is seeking pacts on avoiding double taxation and wants cooperation in fighting crime

14960 Cofinec plunges on H1 results 
14961 Emese Bartha 
14962 BUDAPEST 1996-08-30 
14963 Shares of France-registered printed packaging company Cofinec S.A. plunged sharply on the Budapest Stock Exchange BSE on Friday despite a mostly reassuring forecast by the group 
14964 Cofinec 's Global Depositary Receipts GDRs opened at 5,200 forints on the BSE down 600 from Thursday 's close following the release of its first half results this morning 
14965 Cofinec CEO Stephen Frater told reporters in a conference call from Vienna on Friday before the opening of the bourse that he expects a stronger second half although the group will not be able to achieve its annual profit goal 
14966 We will not achieve the full 37 million French franc net profit forecast Frater said 
14967 Obviously we cannot make up the unexpected decrease that has been experienced in the first half of the year 
14968 Frater declined to give a forecast for the full year ahead of a supervisory board meeting next week 
14969 Cofinec the first foreign company to list on the Budapest bourse released its consolidated first half figures IAS this morning 
14970 In the conference call Frater said he regarded Cofinec GDRs which are trading below their issue price of 6,425 forints as a buying opportunity 
14971 Obviously at some point it represents a buying opportunity Frater said 
14972 I think the reality is that we operate in emerging markets emerging markets tend to be more volatile 
14973 My message is that the fundamental strategy of the company its fundamental market position has not changed 
14974 The group which operates in Hungary Poland and the Czech Republic reported an operating profit before interest of 21.8 million French francs compared to 34.1 million in the same six months of 1995 
14975 Net profit for the January-June 1996 period was 2.1 million French francs down from 10.3 million in the first six months of 1995 with the bulk of this decline attributable to the performance of Petofi one of its Hungarian units 
14976 Cofinec said Petofi general manager Laszlo Sebesvari had submitted his resignation and will be leaving Petofi but will remain on Petofi 's board of directors 
14977 Until a new general manager of Petofi is appointed 
14978 I will in fact move to Kecskemet site of Petofi printing house for the interim and will serve as acting chief executive officer of Petofi Frater said

14991 They could cause serious damage as much as 500 meters yards away from wherever they were detonated the spokesman added 
14992 He said police backed by explosive experts were combing the area in search of other possible weapons or explosive devices 
14993 The police spokeman said plastic explosive like C-4 is not a normal component in claymore mines 
14994 But he said the eight mines seized by police had been specially adapted

15000 Brunswijk 35 denied the charge and reached an agreement with Pinas after replacing a golden necklace lost in the scuffle 
15001 It was the second time Brunswijk had been charged with attempted murder in less than two years 
15002 In 1994 he served two months for shooting a thief in the backside

15013 Far East Gold Moribund market seen continuing 
15014 Mishi Saran 
15015 HONG KONG 1996-08-30 
15016 Far East gold traders thumped foreheads in frustration at the market 's foot-dragging this week and forecast on Friday that next week would not be much better 
15017 The Southeast Asian gold market was more or less a photo-fit picture of the previous week 's position with activity slow and bullion prices trapped in a well-worn range awaiting a seasonal upturn in demand and prices into the fourth quarter 
15018 Singapore premiums for Australian kilo bars were quoted unchanged at between 25-45 cents an ounce over spot loco London prices with South Korean and Indonesian-origin premiums also steady at 10-20 cents an ounce 
15019 Singapore dealers said they were concerned that there had been a marked revival in offers to sell gold by South Korean traders following the distress sales of recent months after the Seoul government 's crackdown on bullion arbitrage trade 
15020 I was shocked to see these offers coming in again though there 's been no indication of price or volume 
15021 I dread to think what will happen to the premiums if the Koreans start selling in force one dealer said 
15022 Continued dishoarding of kilo-bars by Indonesian sources ahead of next year 's presidential election has also kept a lid on premiums 
15023 Gold closed down at $ 387.00 $ 387.50 an ounce in Hong Kong on Friday versus New York 's $ 387.60 $ 388 finish on Thursday 
15024 Dealers said the precious metal eased on a report that the International Monetary Fund might sell some of its gold to reduce the debts of the poorest developing countries 
15025 Easier silver prices mid-week helped keep spot gold locked in a $ 386 $ 389 an ounce range dealers said but they remained optimistic that the usual seasonal pick-up in jewellery fabrication demand would see gold at $ 395 by end-October 
15026 I still think we 'll see gold at $ 395 by the end of October in a retracement of the $ 418 $ 380 move we saw at the start of the year one said 
15027 Silver basis the September contract on New York 's Comex market was expected to find support at between $ 5.12 $ 5.15 an ounce and meet resistance from $ 5.25 $ 5.30 they added 
15028 September silver closed up $ 0.004 in New York on Thursday at $ 5.255 an ounce

15032 Libyans are dressing up their capital Tripoli for celebrations on Sunday of the 27th anniversary of the coup which brought Muammar Gaddafi to power 
15033 Green flags and banners praise the great revolution and promise defiance against United Nations sanctions imposed for Libya 's refusal to hand over for trial two suspects wanted in connection with the 1988 bombing of a Pan Am flight over Lockerbie Scotland 
15034 We have chosen the challenge because it is our only option proclaimed one banner on the road to Tripoli airport which serves only internal flights because of the sanctions 
15035 Huge stadium lights are directed at the city 's Green Square where makeshift stages await Sunday 's festivities 
15036 Three African leaders from Niger Guinea and Ghana are expected to attend the celebrations marking September 1 1969 when a group of young army officers led by a 27-year-old Gaddafi deposed King Mohammed Idris 
15037 The revolution has brought us great achievements 
15038 We are comfortable the revolution has taken care of us improved our lives and given us capabilites Samer Ammar Soliman 42 told Reuters as he came out of Friday prayers 
15039 But some Libyans have begun to show their discontent in the country 's east which has become a hotbed of militant violence

15041 Travellers arriving in Egypt say militants and police officers clash regularly in Benghazi
